0066626.description: Louise is planning a farewell party for Henry who is moving away to start his own business. The problem is that she can't get George to attend because he won't set foot in a white man's house. So, through a mangle of miscommunication, she manages to get Edith to agree to host the party at her house. Of course, during the party Archie has to give his full opinion of the proceedings and of Henry's new venture. George reluctantly arrives to give his brother a farewell toast.

0066626.title: Archie and the Computer
0066626.description: An early satire on computers: A mix up on a rebate results in Edith inheriting a fortune in quarters from a prune company; Archie is (mistakenly) declared dead.

0066626.title: The Games Bunkers Play
0066626.description: Mike refuses to accept constructive criticism during a group therapy board game.

0066626.title: Edith's Conversion
0066626.description: When Irene Lorenzo invites Edith to attend Catholic Mass with her, Archie begins to get suspicious that Edith will soon be converting to Catholicism.

0066626.title: Archie in the Cellar
0066626.description: When the rest of the family is away for the weekend, Archie accidentally locks himself in the basement, and has only a tape recorder and a bottle of vodka to keep him entertained.

0066626.title: Black Is the Color of My True Love's Wig
0066626.description: Gloria buys a black wig and when she models it for Mike, he gets really turned on. But what happens when she takes off the wig leads to a huge fight about their sex life.

0066626.title: Second Honeymoon
0066626.description: Archie and Edith try to rekindle their romance by traveling to Atlantic City for their 25th anniversary.

0066626.title: The Taxi Caper
0066626.description: Archie is robbed while driving Munson's cab, and finds himself at odds with a corrupt politician who doesn't want him to report the crime.

0066626.title: Archie Is Cursed
0066626.description: When Archie boasts that men are superior to women in every way in sports, Irene sets out to prove him wrong ... by challenging him to a game of pool at Kelsey's Bar.

0066626.title: Edith's Christmas Story
0066626.description: On Christmas Day, Edith tells Gloria that she has found a lump in her breast and worries that she may have cancer.

0066626.title: Mike and Gloria Mix It Up
0066626.description: The Stivics quarrel over sex roles in their marriage when Mike complains that Gloria has become the aggressor as of late.

0066626.title: Archie Feels Left Out
0066626.description: Archie's family and friends throw a surprise party for his 50th birthday, but Archie insists that he's only 49, and is upset to find out he's older than he thinks.

0066626.title: Et Tu, Archie?
0066626.description: Archie learns his old friend is unemployed and engaged in an all-out effort to find a job ... any job, even if it means a job at the loading dock.

0066626.title: Gloria's Boyfriend
0066626.description: Archie learns that the mentally disabled have some real abilities, not to mention savvy, when he causes Gloria's friend, a stock boy at Ferguson's Market, to lose his job. The young man then finds himself another job.

0066626.title: Lionel's Engagement
0066626.description: The Bunkers, Stivics and Jeffersons attend Lionel's engagement party. His fiancée is a young woman whose father is white and mother is black, much to the chagrin of Archie and (especially) George.

0066626.title: Archie Eats and Runs
0066626.description: Archie learns that the canned mushrooms he just ate may have been part of a product recall because of reports of food poisoning. Mike urges Archie to investigate, but Archie decides he's sick and needs hospital treatment.

0066626.title: Gloria Sings the Blues
0066626.description: Gloria's bout with depression takes its toll on the family.

0066626.title: Pay the Twenty Dollars
0066626.description: George Jefferson storms into the house, demanding Archie to explain why he paid him using a counterfeit $20 bill.

0066626.title: Mike's Graduation
0066626.description: Mike graduates from college, an occasion that to Archie means Mike will soon be moving out of the house.

0066626.title: The Bunkers and Inflation: Part 1
0066626.description: Archie's union calls a strike, leaving the family to begin adjusting to not having a steady income.

0066626.title: The Bunkers and Inflation: Part 2
0066626.description: The strike continues to drag and Archie is left to sit home and complain. The household budget, meanwhile, begins to take a beating with the high cost of meat and gasoline. Finally, Louise Jefferson offers the family some stew. Archie doesn't want to accept charity, but Edith persuades him to take the helping hand.

0066626.title: The Bunkers and Inflation: Part 3
0066626.description: Three weeks into the strike, there seems to be no progress between Archie's union and company representatives; in fact, negotiations on both sides seem to be getting worse. With Mike's tutoring jobs only bringing in very little money, Edith decides the Bunkers need some real income, and does so by getting a cashier's job at Jefferson Cleaners.

0066626.title: The Bunkers and Inflation: Part 4
0066626.description: Archie's union finally negotiates a contract with his company that the workers ratify. When Mike finds out the terms - a flat pay rate for the next three years - he tells Archie that his union should have turned down the offer and started to fight for a cost-of-living escalator, especially with the onset of sky-high inflation. Archie, however, is just glad the strike has ended.

0066626.title: Lionel the Live-In
0066626.description: Lionel and George get into a huge late-night fight over Jenny and her mixed-race parents, prompting Lionel to spend the night at the Bunkers. Louise pressures her stubborn husband to apologize, and finds an unexpected ally in Archie, but only because he wants Lionel out of his hair.

0066626.title: Archie's Helping Hand
0066626.description: Archie persuades his boss to hire Irene as a bookkeeper. While she'd undoubtedly do a good job in that job, the boss thinks she'd do even better as a forklift operator. It isn't long before Archie finds himself working alongside Irene!

0066626.title: Gloria's Shock
0066626.description: Four years into the Stivic marriage, Mike and Gloria still have no children. That's just fine by Mike, and his wishes cause yet another argument between him and Gloria.

0066626.title: Where's Archie?
0066626.description: Archie mysteriously disappears while traveling to a union convention in Buffalo, leaving Edith fraught with worry.

0066626.title: Archie Is Missing
0066626.description: After fearing the worst when Archie fails to contact the family for 48 hours, Edith, Mike and Gloria begin speculating about his whereabouts.

0066626.title: The Longest Kiss
0066626.description: The family is relieved to learn that Archie is safe and sound - he had been sidetracked at a podiatrist's convention. But Archie's reaction is priceless when he arrives home to find plenty of wackiness going on - hula hoops, ballroom dancing, and Mike trying to make good on Gloria's dare that they hold a kiss for hours and hours.

0066626.title: Archie and the Miracle
0066626.description: Archie narrowly escapes a potentially deadly accident at the dock, prompting him to see the light. But can he deal with the demands of Christianity, especially after he is asked to drive a church bus on the same day he was looking forward to going to a New York Jets game?

0066626.title: George and Archie Make a Deal
0066626.description: Archie becomes suspicious when political office-seeker George is suddenly very nice to him.

0066626.title: Archie's Contract
0066626.description: A man comes by the house claiming that The Bunker's have a problem with heat loss in their home. He bars up the basement, and has Archie sign a contract for aluminum siding that he says he will get for free despite the fact that their house is brick. Edith reads the fine print and finds out that it will cost them $2000 no matter what happens. Archie is too stubborn to listen to Edith's good advice and signs the contract anyway. After the man leaves, Irene comes by to tell them that the man is scam artist who inspected their house with a light meter and a lot of phony ...

0066626.title: Mike's Friend
0066626.description: Mike's college friend Stu comes to the house to play chess. However, Mike's intellectual conversation leaves Gloria feeling inferior.

0066626.title: The Best of All in the Family
0066626.description: A special one-hour retrospective, celebrating the 100th episode of the groundbreaking sitcom. Host Henry Fonda narrates and shares clips from the series' most memorable episodes up to this point in the series.

0066626.title: Prisoner in the House
0066626.description: Archie can't help but feel uncomfortable - and uneasy - when a plumber's apprentice is a convict on a work furlough from prison.

0066626.title: The Jeffersons Move on Up
0066626.description: The pilot episode for

0066626.title: All's Fair
0066626.description: Mike and Gloria are dumbfounded by Edith's continual submissiveness to Archie. Gloria finally decides it's time to give her mother a long-overdue lesson in how to become more assertive in her marriage.

0066626.title: Amelia's Divorce
0066626.description: The Bunkers are shocked when the seemingly happy marriage of Edith's favorite cousin is anything but.

0066626.title: Everybody Does It
0066626.description: Archie's sense of morality is questioned when he borrows tools and equipment from work in order to complete a home repair project.

0066626.title: Archie and the Quiz
0066626.description: Out of curiosity, Archie takes a magazine test about his health habits. When he scores the test, he learns he might die at age 57. Rather than take the test for what it is worth (or heed the advice of the accompanying article), Archie fumes about his apparent fate.

0066626.title: Edith's Friend
0066626.description: Edith attends a wedding in her hometown of Scranton and runs into her childhood sweetheart, who is interested in rekindling the old romance

0066626.title: No Smoking
0066626.description: A contest between Archie and Mike, to see who can abstain from his favorite indulgence (Archie's being smoking cigars, Mike's eating everything in sight) becomes a battle of wills. Who will win this 48-hour contest?

0066626.title: Mike Makes His Move
0066626.description: Mike accepts a job, which pleases Archie because it means that Mike and Gloria will be moving. Finding a new home proves difficult. George Jefferson schemes to rent his old house next door to them cheap, just to annoy Archie.

0066626.title: The Very Moving Day
0066626.description: With the Jeffersons' old house now ready for the Stivics to move in, Mike and Gloria look forward to some peace and quiet. Then Gloria has some really wonderful news - she's pregnant.

0066626.title: Alone at Last
0066626.description: The day has come that Mike and Gloria are moving into their new home and Archie is practically pushing them out the door. Archie is being so obnoxious that Mike finally reaches a boiling point until he declares his independence and calls Archie a fathead. He and Gloria spend the night in their new home without electricity, plumbing or heat. Archie is overjoyed that the meathead is suffering but Edith's motherly instinct force her to intercede, she walks out and intends to suffer right along with the kids. Archie is all to happy to take care of himself but while making...

0066626.title: Archie the Donor
0066626.description: Archie will do anything to get a promotion at the loading dock. So, he agrees to help Mr. Sanders with his latest charity, unaware that it involves something that goes against his morals - organ donation.

0066626.title: Archie the Hero
0066626.description: While driving Munson's cab, Archie saves the life of a beautiful woman who becomes unconscious. Uh, was that a woman? Sorry, that was no woman, thanks to female impersonator Beverly LaSalle's convincing act.

0066626.title: Mike's Pains
0066626.description: Mike - along with everyone else - debate where he should be when Gloria is in the delivery room giving birth to their baby.

0066626.title: Chain Letter
0066626.description: Archie rips up a chain letter, thinking it to be nothing more than baloney. Then a whole bunch of accidents happen. Coincidence or did Archie really set off the string of mishaps?

0066626.title: Mike Faces Life
0066626.description: When Gloria gets her paycheck in the mail, it is good news and bad news. The good news is that the check is more than she expected. The bad news is that the check also comes enclosed with a pink slip. Determined to find out why she has been fired, she and Mike pay a visit to the boss Mr. Crenshaw. Mike becomes angry and demands to know why Gloria was let go. Crenshaw secretly records the parts of their conversation that makes Mike look like he is threatening him, but turns it off to confesses that he fired Gloria because she is pregnant, stating that she looks like ...

0066626.title: Edith Breaks Out
0066626.description: Archie is unhappy with Edith doing volunteer work at The Sunshine home for seniors and he demands she quit.

0066626.title: Grandpa Blues
0066626.description: Archie's company physical is fast approaching, and he needs to remain calm for an entire weekend for the blood pressure test. Of course, a variety of situations arise that test Archie's ability to keep an even temper.

0066626.title: Gloria Suspects Mike
0066626.description: Gloria, now in her seventh month, is feeling unattractive. Added to that is the fact that Mike is tutoring an attractive young woman in Economics and suspects that something else might be going on. That night, when Mike goes to tutor the woman, they both become mutually attracted to one another leading to a kiss. Meanwhile, Archie gets an idea to trap Mike in a confession. Knowing that he can't hold his wine, Archie decides to try and liquor him up as a truth drug. They both get drunk and right before Mike confesses, Archie passes out, missing the part where he ...

0066626.title: The Little Atheist
0066626.description: Archie and Mike argue over the religious upbringing of baby Joey during a Thanksgiving Day dinner.

0066626.title: Archie's Civil Rights
0066626.description: A mugger tries to attack Archie in his cab ... but this time, Archie strikes back with some pepper spray. So why is Archie the one facing criminal charges?

0066626.title: Gloria Is Nervous
0066626.description: Worried when her baby is nine days overdue, Gloria snaps at Mike. Mike tries to be nice to his wife, but then he forgets that her baby shower is scheduled on a day when he has plans.

0066626.title: Birth of the Baby: Part 1
0066626.description: Archie is a nervous wreck because he wants to back out of the annual minstrel show at the lodge, which he has successfully avoided for several years. Lodge brothers Barney Hefner and Ed Bradley blackmail him by asserting that if Archie doesn't go on with the show, he will be kicked out of the lodge and lose all the benefits therein. Meanwhile, Mike and Gloria try to have a nice dinner at an Italian restaurant to take their minds off the fact that she is a week overdue. When Gloria admits that she is having contractions, which she didn't want to admit because she ...

0066626.title: Birth of the Baby: Part 2
0066626.description: Archie is forced to show up at the hospital for the birth of his grandchild in black face, When his lodge brothers refused to give him their cold cream because he left, He and Edith are surprised to discover that Mike and Gloria haven't arrived - first they that Gloria was stuck in a phone booth at the restaurant and then they found themselves stuck in traffic. All is well, they get to the hospital, Gloria has the baby and Archie manages to borrow cold cream from a terrified elderly woman. The lodge brothers show up and tell him that they understand and that it would ...

0066626.title: New Year's Wedding
0066626.description: In the wake of the birth of little Joey, Gloria and Michael are at odds with one another over communication issues. Gloria is upset because Michael keeps making big and little decisions without consulting her despite the fact that their marriage is suppose to be an equal partnership. The crux of their argument is over plans for their friends who are getting married before the year ends. Problems with the arrangements cause them to lose their original location and so it is suggested that they have it in the Stivic's living room. Mike comes to understand why Gloria is ...

0066626.title: Archie the Babysitter
0066626.description: Archie babysits little Joey with the help of his friends during their poker game.

0066626.title: Archie Finds a Friend
0066626.description: Archie has ulterior motives when he befriends a Jewish watchmaker, who has a sure-fire invention that the world has been waiting for.

0066626.title: Mike's Move
0066626.description: Mike's support of hiring quotas faces a stern test when he is passed over for a promotion to a less-qualified black man. Mike confronts the hiring manager, but his big mouth gets him in trouble again.

0066626.title: Archie's Weighty Problem
0066626.description: Archie is told by his doctor to go on a diet, or else he'll suffer serious health problems. He rejects the efforts of Edith, Mike and Gloria to stick with the diet, but Justin Quigley may provide the inspiration Archie needs.

0066626.title: Love by Appointment
0066626.description: With a lot of demands on Mike and Gloria's time - Joey needs a lot of care, and both of them working - the Stivics begin wondering when...or if they'll ever have time for each other.

0066626.title: Joey's Baptism
0066626.description: Archie is determined to baptize Joey, especially over Mike's express wishes against it. When Edith begins refusing to allow Archie to be with Joey alone (knowing what will happen), Archie begins getting very sneaky.

0066626.title: Gloria and Mike's House Guests
0066626.description: Mike finds out that Archie baptized Joey without his consent, prompting another argument between the agnostic and so-called Christian. The argument begins to simmer ... until the Bunkers' furnace breaks down.

0066626.title: Edith's Night Out
0066626.description: Edith takes matters into her own hands when Archie continually refuses to treat his wife to one night out on the town. An evening at Kelsey's Bar shows Archie that Edith is no social wallflower.

0066626.title: Archie's Brief Encounter: Parts 1 & 2
0066626.description: Archie finds himself in a compromising situation with an attractive waitress after Edith ignores his amorous advances and dashes off to the Sunshine Home.

0066626.title: Archie's Brief Encounter: Parts 1 & 2
0066626.description: Archie finds himself in a compromising situation with an attractive waitress after Edith ignores his amorous advances and dashes off to the Sunshine Home. Janis Paige guest stars as Denise, the attractive waitress whose flirtations with Archie lead him to trouble on the home front.

0066626.title: Archie's Brief Encounter: Part 3
0066626.description: Episode #137 - And estranged Archie and Edith are determined to prove to each other that they are perfectly content going their separate ways, in the conclusion of a three-part presentation. The going gets tough for a while when the Bunkers continue to resist Mike and Gloria's efforts to reconcile them.

0066626.title: The Unemployment Story: Part 1
0066626.description: The family is getting ready to celebrate Mike's good fortune, he's been published. It happens just at the wrong moment, because Archie has just been laid off due to the recall of a government contract. At the unemployment office, he finds nothing but bureaucracy and frustration, especially with the information he won't get much of a check due to his job moonlighting in Munson's cab. At home, Edith makes it worse trying to make him feel better by trying to sing him to sleep.

0066626.title: The Unemployment Story: Part 2
0066626.description: Archie continues to have problems with finances and with finding another job. At the grocery store, he stresses himself about Edith's spending habits and tries to save money even if it means denting cans to save two cents. Gloria informs him that he has an interview for a job as a custodian, and at the interview he finds out that he is only being offered the job because of his lack of education. He gets the job over a man who is highly educated but has been out of work for three years. The man is so distraught that he climbs out onto the ledge of the building and ...

0066626.title: Archie's Operation: Part 1
0066626.description: Archie goes into the hospital and has a verbal run-in with a Puerto Rican nurse and gets a blood transfusion from a black doctor.

0066626.title: Archie's Operation: Part 2
0066626.description: Archie goes into the hospital and has a verbal run-in with a Puerto Rican nurse and gets a blood transfusion from a black doctor.

0066626.title: Beverly Rides Again
0066626.description: Archie is tired of being the butt of Pinky Peterson's practical jokes and sets out to get revenge by fixing Pinky up on a date with Beverly Lasalle.

0066626.title: Teresa Moves In
0066626.description: The outspoken Puerto Rican nurse that Archie met at the time of his operation moves into Mike and Gloria's old room.

0066626.title: Mike and Gloria's Will
0066626.description: When Mike and Gloria are preparing their will, they have problems with having Archie and Edith as guardians for little Joey.

0066626.title: Mr. Edith Bunker
0066626.description: Edith saves a man's life and becomes a local celebrity much to Archie's annoyance.

0066626.title: Archie's Secret Passion
0066626.description: Edith invites a couple of high school friends over for dinner, unaware that Archie had a brief fling with the wife back in their high school days.

0066626.title: The Baby Contest
0066626.description: Despite the objections of Mike and Gloria, Archie enters his grandson in a beautiful baby contest.

0066626.title: Gloria's False Alarm
0066626.description: Gloria wants Mike to have a vasectomy when she thinks she might be pregnant.

0066626.title: The Draft Dodger
0066626.description: The Bunkers invite Archie's buddy Pinky Peterson to Christmas dinner. Then Mike's old friend David Brewster drops by unexpectedly, which worries Mike because David's a draft dodger wanted by the FBI and he's been living in Canada. When Pinky arrives, Archie reminds the family not to move the conversation toward his son Steven since he's still in shock over his tragic death in Vietnam. During dinner Archie keeps quizzing David about why he lives in Canada. David is so put out that he admits that he is a draft dodger, which incites furious rage from Archie. He assumes ...

0066626.title: The Boarder Patrol
0066626.description: Episode #150 - The Bunker's unexpected return from a weekend trip puts Edith in a precarious situation when she discovers that Teresa has her boyfriend in her bedroom. Edith and the embarrassed Teresa agree that the only course of action is to try to sneak out the visitor before Archie finds out.

0066626.title: Archie's Chair
0066626.description: After Mike accidentally breaks Archie's chair he has it repaired, however it mistakenly gets thrown out and ends up in an art exhibit.

0066626.title: Mike Goes Skiing
0066626.description: Against his wife's wishes Mike goes skiing with his buddies.

0066626.title: Stretch Cunningham, Goodbye
0066626.description: Archie is shocked when his coworker Stretch has died after cavorting with a young woman. Asked to give the eulogy, he enlists Mike's help, requesting Bible references. But the biggest shock comes at the funeral.

0066626.title: The Joys of Sex
0066626.description: Mike and Gloria help advise the Bunkers on their sex life after they find Edith reading a sex manual.

0066626.title: Mike the Pacifist
0066626.description: Mike gets very upset when he defends Gloria on the subway since he never once in his life advocated violence.

0066626.title: Fire
0066626.description: A bathroom fire drives the Bunkers from the house in the middle of the night. Later Archie expects a handsome insurance check.

0066626.title: Mike and Gloria Split
0066626.description: Mike and Gloria have an argument after a Scrabble game about Mike always being right and that she never did get to go to college as Mike had promised. Mike also ends up with Archie as a roommate for one night.

0066626.title: Archie the Liberal
0066626.description: To change the public perception of their lodge Archie proposes that they let in a black Jewish fellow from his work.

0066626.title: Archie's Dog Day Afternoon
0066626.description: Archie starts another battle when he goes one-on-one with a neighborhood dog.

0066626.title: Archie Gets the Business
0066626.description: Archie buys Kelsey's Bar, but has to forge Edith's signature to get the money.

0066626.title: Archie Gets the Business
0066626.description: Mike has to soothe Edith's feelings after she learns that Archie forged her signature to buy the bar.

0066626.title: Cousin Liz
0066626.description: After Edith's cousin Liz dies her female roommate admits to Edith that they were lovers.

0066626.title: Edith's 50th Birthday
0066626.description: Archie, Mike and Gloria plan a surprise party for Edith to celebrate her 50th birthday. But an unwelcome visitor to the Bunker's home - while Edith is home alone - has a much different surprise in mind for the Bunker matriarch.

0066626.title: Edith's 50th Birthday
0066626.description: Edith encounters a life-threatening rapist on her 50th birthday.

0066626.title: Unequal Partners
0066626.description: Archie has to delay his fishing trip when Edith has an anniversary party for a couple from the Sunshine Home.

0066626.title: Archie's Grand Opening
0066626.description: Harry the bartender quits after Archie keeps bossing him around. Edith and the Stivics end up helping out during the grand opening of Archie's Place.

0066626.title: Archie's Bitter Pill
0066626.description: Slow business at the saloon depresses Archie, so well-meaning Hank Pivnik gives him some pills to help him cheer up. But Archie takes too many and the family fears for his health.

0066626.title: Archie's Road Back
0066626.description: Depressed Archie confines himself to bed indefinitely, so the family tries to get Harry the bartender to become Archie's partner and invest in Archie's Place.

0066626.title: Archie and the KKK: Part 1
0066626.description: A power outage and reports of looting in the city prompt Mike to write a letter to the editor about how greedy governments do the same in the name of free enterprise. At the bar, Archie vents his frustrations about how Mike always argues his point and doesn't see things his way. Two men - who have been listening in - approach Archie and suggest that he come to a meeting of the Kweens Kouncil of Krusaders (a chapter of the Klu Klux Klan), where they will come up with a more severe way of "teaching" Mike a lesson.

0066626.title: Archie and the KKK: Part 2
0066626.description: Archie learns that Gordie and Mitch - the two men he met earlier at his bar - plan to burn a cross on the Stivic's lawn and must come up with a way to stop them. When Archie tries to persuade Mike to write a new letter to the editor (recanting his previous stance on free enterprise), he lets slip that he had spoken with known Klu Klux Klan members. Mike is outraged and tells Archie to go away, but Archie is still determined to stop the cross burning - even if it means he will be the KKK's next target.

0066626.title: Mike and Gloria Meet
0066626.description: A flashback episode of when Mike and Gloria first came together by mutual friends at the Bunker home while Archie and Edith are out. Initially their differences lead to much tension until they discover a shared love for old style dancing.

0066626.title: Edith's Crisis of Faith: Part 1
0066626.description: Edith's faith is severely shaken when their friend Beverly, the female impersonator, is murdered at Christmastime.

0066626.title: Edith's Crisis of Faith: Part 2
0066626.description: Mike recovers from the injuries he sustained in the mugging. But the Christmas Day gift exchange is still strained due to Edith's depression, so the family rallies around her.

0066626.title: The Commercial
0066626.description: Honest Edith just can't lie during a detergent commercial.

0066626.title: Super Bowl Sunday
0066626.description: On Superbowl Sunday, Archie's Place is robbed.

0066626.title: Aunt Iola's Visit
0066626.description: Archie will not allow Edith's aunt to move in after she was rejected by the rest of her family.

0066626.title: Love Comes to the Butcher
0066626.description: The butcher falls in love with Edith.

0066626.title: Two's a Crowd
0066626.description: Mike and Archie get locked together in the storage room at Archie's Place and have a long talk.

0066626.title: Stalemates
0066626.description: Even a Pocono weekend doesn't seem to spark the romance in the Stivic's marriage.

0066626.title: The Brother
0066626.description: Before an operation, Archie's brother tries to smooth over differences that occurred long ago.

0066626.title: Mike's New Job
0066626.description: Mike accepts a job on the west coast and the Stivics prepare to move.

0066626.title: The Dinner Guest
0066626.description: Mike and Gloria can't make the special dinner that Edith prepared for the departing Stivics.

0066626.title: The Stivics Go West
0066626.description: Saying goodbye to Mike and Gloria proves traumatic for the Bunkers. Before they leave for their new life in California, Mike and Gloria share some long-hidden feelings, confused tears, and much, much more with Archie and Edith.

0066626.title: Little Miss Bunker
0066626.description: Edith's cousin leaves his nine year old daughter Stephanie with the Bunkers.

0066626.title: End in Sight
0066626.description: Archie slips into a bout of depression when he finds out from his insurance company's physical that a spot appeared on the X-Ray on his liver. Despite the fact that the doctor isn't sure what the spot is, Archie is convinced that the end is near. His first response is to be nice to Edith, and his second is to retire to his bedroom to wait out the inevitable.

0066626.title: Reunion on Hauser Street
0066626.description: Edith and Archie try and get their friends Barney and Blanche back together.

0066626.title: What'll We Do with Stephanie?
0066626.description: After her father fails to return for Stephanie, the Bunkers decide to raise her themselves.

0066626.title: Edith's Final Respects
0066626.description: Edith goes to the funeral of her Aunt Rose and is the only mourner. She has a long talk with her aunt.

0066626.title: Weekend in the Country
0066626.description: During a weekend in a fishing cabin, a disagreement over a Monopoly game has the men and women sleeping in separate bedrooms.

0066626.title: Archie's Other Wife
0066626.description: At a convention Archie awakens next to a black woman who claims that they were married.

0066626.title: Edith Versus the Bank
0066626.description: No one will loan Edith money to buy a new television because she has no job and is just a housewife.

0066626.title: Return of the Waitress
0066626.description: Archie is caught between sympathy and self-preservation when the "other woman" from his past really needs his help. Her name is Denise and she's the attractive waitress who was the other half of an evening that Archie - and Edith - will always remember.

0066626.title: Bogus Bills
0066626.description: Edith is arrested for passing counterfeit money that she got from Archie at the bar.

0066626.title: The Bunkers Go West
0066626.description: The Bunkers plan to go to California to visit the Stivics after they cancel their Christmas trip to New York.

0066626.title: California, Here We Are
0066626.description: When the Bunkers visit the Stivics in California, Mike and Gloria are hiding the fact that they have separated.

0066626.title: A Night at the PTA
0066626.description: Edith can't sing at the PTA meeting because she has laryngitis.

0066626.title: A Girl Like Edith
0066626.description: The butcher returns with his fiancee who is the spitting image of Edith who he still seems to have feelings for.

0066626.title: The Appendectomy
0066626.description: On her tenth birthday Stephanie is rushed to the hospital with appendicitis.

0066626.title: Stephanie and the Crime Wave
0066626.description: Stephanie has been stealing from school and from the Bunkers.

0066626.title: Barney the Gold Digger
0066626.description: Barney is distraught after Blanche finally leaves him so Archie tries a bit of matchmaking himself.

0066626.title: The Return of Archie's Brother
0066626.description: Archie's brother shows up with an eighteen year old wife.

0066626.title: Stephanie's Conversion
0066626.description: The Reverand Chong visits Edith to tell her that Stephanie is Jewish. Archie wants her to convert, but Edith backs Stephanie's decision.

0066626.title: Edith Gets Fired
0066626.description: Edith is dismissed when she honors a patient's wishes and lets her die in peace.

0066626.title: "All in the Family" Retrospective
0066626.description: Producer/Developer Norman Lear hosts a 90 minute retrospective on the long-running comedy with classic footage from past episodes.

0066626.title: The Family Next Door
0066626.description: Louise Jefferson shows up and asks Edith to help her find a buyer for their house next door. At first Archie is excited... until he sees Edith's choice for new neighbors.

0066626.title: The Return of Stephanie's Father
0066626.description: Archie's fighting instincts are aroused when Stephanie's derelict father returns and uses blackmail to try an get his daughter back. Edith panics at the thought of losing Stephanie, and does her best to help Archie with a plan.

0066626.title: Too Good Edith
0066626.description: Archie keeps a sick Edith so busy cooking for his big St. Patrick's Day party, that she doesn't get the chance to tell him that "hard work is hazardous to her health." When Archie finds out the truth about Edith's illness, he takes steps to make sure she will never "forget" to tell him again.

0068044.title: Detour to Nowhere
0068044.description: An insurance investigator tries to find an armored car carrying gold bullion that disappeared in the middle of a deserted Texas highway.

0068044.title: Let's Hear It for a Living Legend
0068044.description: When a football player vanishes from the field in full view of network cameras and a live audience, it's up to Banacek to figure out how his kidnappers spirited him away without a trace.

0068044.title: Project Phoenix
0068044.description: The multi-million dollar Phoenix, prototype for a revolutionary new car, disappears from a non-stop train en route to Boston - flat-car included. Banacek is called in to find the missing vehicle before a huge insurance claim must be paid.

0068044.title: No Sign of the Cross
0068044.description: A golden cross, on it's way from a Mexican church to an American gangster anxious to reform his image, turns into worthless junk without ever leaving the possession of the couriers sent to deliver it. Banacek must figure out where and how the switch was pulled off.

0068044.title: A Million the Hard Way
0068044.description: Banacek must figure out who stole a million dollars from a supposedly tamper-proof display case.

0068044.title: To Steal a King
0068044.description: A king's ransom in precious coins vanishes from a hotel-suite vault while the owners sleep only a few feet away. Banacek arrives to figure out how the impossible to open vault was so easily breached without a sign left behind.

0068044.title: Ten Thousand Dollars a Page
0068044.description: When a priceless book vanishes from a sealed display case in a room that no thief could possibly escape, it's up to Banacek to show how someone beat the supposedly foolproof alarms to make off with the artifact.

0068044.title: The Greatest Collection of Them All
0068044.description: Banacek figures out how $23 million worth of paintings vanished from a moving truck transporting them from New York to Boston.

0068044.title: The Two Million Clams of Cap'n Jack
0068044.description: Just before Cap'n Jack's seafood restaurant franchise is set to go public, millions of dollars in stock certificates are stolen from a non-stop elevator, leaving Banacek to find them before someone walks through walls with a fortune.

0068044.title: No Stone Unturned
0068044.description: "Man in Harmony," a 3-ton, 11-foot tall sculpture is missing at its gala unveiling. The 5-foot pedestal to which it was attached is all that remains to mark the theft. A ransom demand threatening to turn the large stone into gravel unless $500,000 is paid further complicates the case. Working, and competing, with a Boston Insurance Company colleague, Banacek has only two days to find the statue and collect his fee.

0068044.title: If Max Is So Smart, Why Doesn't He Tell Us Where He Is?
0068044.description: One morning Max - a huge, complex computer system - is missing from the locked, alarmed and guarded building he filled just the night before. Banacek steps in to find out how tons of computer machinery could be sneaked out leaving only bare walls.

0068044.title: The Three Million Dollar Piracy
0068044.description: A three-million dollar wedding coach, being sent overseas, disappears shortly after being placed into a shipping container and loaded aboard ship, under the watchful eyes of two Boston Insurance Company employees. Enter Banacek, who must figure out the puzzling theft and find the coach before the ship sails to collect his ten percent.

0068044.title: The Vanishing Chalice
0068044.description: A one-of-a-kind Greek chalice worth 1.5 million dollars is stolen in front of many witnesses.

0068044.title: Horse of a Slightly Different Color
0068044.description: How can a valuable, highly recognizable thoroughbred horse start a practice run around an open racetrack and be an unknown nag when it reaches the finish line? Bet on Banacek to solve the puzzle before the horse thieves make tracks with the real article.

0068044.title: Rocket to Oblivion
0068044.description: A small but powerful prototype engine sits sealed in a rotating display case in the middle of a crowded trade-show floor. A power failure turns out the lights for a few seconds, and when the lights return, the rocket engine has vanished. Banacek must beat his competition to the solution before Federal agents step in.

0068044.title: Fly Me- If You Can Find Me
0068044.description: A charter company jetliner makes an emergency landing at a small desert airstrip, blowing all of its tires and leaving a shaken flight crew. The next morning finds the pilot left guarding the plane dead and the airstrip empty of the immovable aircraft. Enter Banacek - in a chauffeur-driven jeep - to sort out the convolutions of pilots, stewardesses, old business partners and more to learn where the crippled plane has gone.

0068044.title: Now You See Me, Now You Don't
0068044.description: A stage magician vanishes in the middle of his act, as he is about to be arrested on suspicion of a $1,750,000 securities fraud. Banacek is called in to try to recover the missing money and solve the mystery of the disappearing man.

0068098.title: Pilot
0068098.description: The Swamp's Korean houseboy, Ho-Jon, is accepted to attend school at Hawkeye's alma mater. The camp raises money to send Ho-Jon to Maine by raffling a weekend in Tokyo with a nurse, much to the chagrin of Hot Lips and Burns.

0068098.title: To Market, to Market
0068098.description: After losing vital medical supplies to black marketeers, Hawkeye and Trapper attempt to make a deal to get them back. Henry gets a new antique oak desk.

0068098.title: Requiem for a Lightweight
0068098.description: Trapper enters the inter-camp boxing tournament.

0068098.title: Chief Surgeon Who?
0068098.description: When Hawkeye is appointed Chief Surgeon over Frank Burns, Burns and Houlihan go over Col. Blake's head to a general to protest the decision.

0068098.title: The Moose
0068098.description: Hawkeye is outraged when a visiting sergeant brings his 'moose' to camp - a young Korean woman he has bought to keep as his personal servant.

0068098.title: Yankee Doodle Doctor
0068098.description: The 4077th is chosen as the site for a documentary featuring 'false heroics' about MASH units in Korea. After destroying the film, Hawkeye and Trapper make their own movie as a replacement.

0068098.title: Bananas, Crackers and Nuts
0068098.description: Hawkeye feigns insanity to prove he needs a leave.

0068098.title: Cowboy
0068098.description: A wounded cowboy is itching to get back to the states to keep his marriage intact, but his request is denied. Henry becomes the target of a mad bomber.

0068098.title: Henry, Please Come Home
0068098.description: When Col. Henry Blake is transferred to Tokyo and Frank starts imposing military discipline on the camp, the surgeons will do anything to get Henry back.

0068098.title: I Hate a Mystery
0068098.description: Hawkeye finds himself investigating a rash of petty thefts in the camp.

0068098.title: Germ Warfare
0068098.description: After tapping Frank Burns for blood, Hawkeye and Trapper's patient develops complications. They believe Frank has hepatitis and try to keep Frank from operating.

0068098.title: Dear Dad
0068098.description: Hawkeye writes his dad, describing the antics of the 4077th.

0068098.title: Edwina
0068098.description: The nurses refuse to date until their lonely colleague Edwina gets a date, so the men draw straws.

0068098.title: Love Story
0068098.description: After Radar gets a "Dear John" letter Hawkeye and Trapper try to help him with a new nurse who's into classical literature and music.

0068098.title: Tuttle
0068098.description: A little white lie about an imaginary officer balloons into an elaborate charade.

0068098.title: The Ringbanger
0068098.description: Hawkeye and Trapper hit it off with a wounded Colonel, but when they discover his combat zeal is costing lives, they conspire to keep him from returning to the front line.

0068098.title: Sometimes You Hear the Bullet
0068098.description: Hawkeye's childhood buddy drops by, and reveals that he is writing a book about his experiences in the infantry - experiences that may hit a little too close to home.

0068098.title: Dear Dad, Again
0068098.description: Hawkeye is bored and tired, the best time to pen another missive to his father. He describes Klinger's sheer white wedding gown, which does little to hide his white boxer shorts but is better than Hawkeye's naked dining fiasco. There is more fun to be had over Hotlips' recent tiff with Frank; he got drunk on gin and confided that his own brother used to call him Ferret Face. Radar is now a real, honest to goodness mail order graduate. But, Captain Casey, the new boy genius of their surgical team, is not really a doctor; Hawkeye's failure to throw the book at him ...

0068098.title: The Longjohn Flap
0068098.description: A cold snap has everybody trying to get their hands on Hawkeye's thermal underwear.

0068098.title: The Army-Navy Game
0068098.description: The Army-Navy game back home holds everyone's attention (and everyone's bet money) until an artillery barrage forces the camp to dispose of an unexploded shell.

0068098.title: Sticky Wicket
0068098.description: Hawkeye moves out of the Swamp while brooding over a patient gone sour, while Frank rubs salt in the wound after suffering Hawkeye's insults to his surgical ability.

0068098.title: Major Fred C. Dobbs
0068098.description: Frank applies for a transfer out of the 4077, and Hawkeye and Trapper can't resist broadcasting his goodbye to Margaret through the camp P.A. The prospect of gold in the region gives Frank second thoughts.

0068098.title: Ceasefire
0068098.description: The camp erupts into celebration when they receive word that there's a ceasefire.

0068098.title: Showtime
0068098.description: A USO troupe entertains the 4077th in between the usual chaos.

0068098.title: Divided We Stand
0068098.description: Henry's orders to the 4077th to be on their best behavior when General Clayton sends a psychiatrist to evaluate them meet with mixed results. Will the team be broken up and sent to other units?

0068098.title: 5 O'Clock Charlie
0068098.description: Every day for the past six weeks, at 5:00 o'clock p.m. on the nose, a North Korean "washout from Kamikaze school" has let loose a bomb in the general direction of the hospital's sub-ammo dump. Very affectionately known as "Five O'Clock Charlie," the only thing he hits on the nose is the time. Every day, Radar opens book on the day's exploits and takes bets on how close (in yards) Charlie will come to the sub-ammo dump. It is an occasion for cocktails and frivolity at 4077, not unlike the Kentucky Derby... until Frank demands Henry get him a "nug" from Brigadier Gen. ...

0068098.title: Radar's Report
0068098.description: Radar reports on the comedies and tragedies of a typical 4077th week while Majors Houlihan and Burns try to get Cpl. Klinger transferred and Hawkeye falls hard for a nurse.

0068098.title: For the Good of the Outfit
0068098.description: Hawkeye and Trapper discover that a nearby town has been shelled by U.S. forces. When they pursue the issue, the army resists accepting responsibility.

0068098.title: Dr. Pierce and Mr. Hyde
0068098.description: After Hawkeye is kept awake in surgery for 3 days straight he decides to find out who started the war.

0068098.title: Kim
0068098.description: A wounded Korean boy captures the hearts of the 4077th especially Trapper who wants to adopt him.

0068098.title: L.I.P. (Local Indigenous Personnel)
0068098.description: Hawkeye helps a soon-to-be-discharged enlisted man who wants to marry a Korean girl and take her and their child back to the U.S.

0068098.title: The Trial of Henry Blake
0068098.description: Henry's on trial on charges that Frank and Margaret brought against him. So that Hawkeye and Trapper can't help Henry, the Majors put them under house arrest.

0068098.title: Dear Dad... Three
0068098.description: Hawkeye pens another letter to his father during a 'typical' day at the 4077th.

0068098.title: The Sniper
0068098.description: The 4077th deals with more than the usual mayhem when a sniper opens fire on the camp.

0068098.title: Carry On, Hawkeye
0068098.description: All the surgeons except for Hawkeye, and most of the support staff except for Margaret, Radar, and Mulcahey come down with the flu. In this Korea-wide epidemic, they can't even find someone to come in and help with casualties.

0068098.title: The Incubator
0068098.description: After an epic Swamp debauch to end all debauchery, the drunken duo give up on alcohol. They are upset when one of their patients has an infection which the 4077 cannot identify. They determine that the 4077 needs an incubator, so they call the Quartermaster. Capt. Sloan is from the 375th QMHQ COMSEAPAC SEOULSEC REPDEP...Hawkeye needs a drink. But, according to Sloan, an incubator is "a luxury item." So the drunken duo go on a quest for luxury. They meet inept supply sergeants, hoarder, Major Morris, and the cupidinous Col. Lambert who is willing to give the guys what ...

0068098.title: Deal Me Out
0068098.description: Radar hits a local with a jeep and a GI suffers from battle fatigue while Pierce and McIntyre clash with Frank Burns and the CID all during a poker game disguised as an officer's conference.

0068098.title: Hot Lips and Empty Arms
0068098.description: A friend's letter causes Margaret to re-evaluate her life in the 4077th and request a transfer.

0068098.title: Officers Only
0068098.description: In gratitude for Hawkeye and Trapper saving his son, a general donates an officer's club to the 4077th. Hawkeye and Trapper work to allow everyone access to the club.

0068098.title: Henry in Love
0068098.description: Family man Henry falls in love with 21-year-old ex-cheerleader Nancy Sue Parker, who is half his age. Nancy visits Henry at the camp and comes on to Hawkeye while Henry is in surgery.

0068098.title: For Want of a Boot
0068098.description: After months of waiting, Hawkeye finds that it may take more than a requisition form to get a new pair of boots.

0068098.title: Operation Noselift
0068098.description: Another day, another complaint to Gen. Mitchell, compliments of Hotlips, Inc. and Henry is tired of their constant abuse. To make matters worse, Private Danny Baker keeps going AWOL. With the help of Fr. Mulcahy, Hawkeye and Trapper get to the bottom of Baker's trouble: his huge nose. Hawkeye calls his old buddy, renowned plastic surgeon, Major Stanley "Stosh" Robbins, (Stuart Margolin) to perform the surgery...in exchange for a date with "The Barracuda." The big problem: all elective surgery is against U.S. military regulations. Hotlips, Inc. are very suspicious. But...

0068098.title: The Chosen People
0068098.description: A Korean family claims that the 4077th is set up on their farm and wants the unit to move; a Korean girl names Radar as the father of her child.

0068098.title: As You Were
0068098.description: The team delivers a baby, handles casualties and operates on Frank Burns' hernia during a power outage while Radar tries to divert friendly mortar fire falling too close to the camp.

0068098.title: Crisis
0068098.description: When enemy action cuts the supply lines to the 4077th in the middle of a freezing Korean winter, the unit struggles with a shortage of supplies and heating fuel.

0068098.title: George
0068098.description: A decorated GI confides to Hawkeye that he was beaten by his own unit for being gay but Frank Burns is outraged when he finds out from another source and tries to have the soldier dishonorably discharged.

0068098.title: Mail Call
0068098.description: Mail call yields goodies like photos and cookies (Trapper) and a huge knitted sweater (Hawkeye) but Henry gets only canceled checks. Frank's stock portfolio doubled since the war began but when he tells the guys they are less than thrilled. Margaret takes it as a near proposal of marriage. Klinger's father is dying for the 18th time; his file is full of familial death and pregnancy. Frank finds Hawkeye's letter to his father about Pioneer Aviation so Frank asks Radar to cable his brokers to liquidate and buy Pioneer. Radar has a pen pal named Mary Jo Carpenter; he ...

0068098.title: A Smattering of Intelligence
0068098.description: A helicopter crash introduces the 4077 to Colonel Sam Flagg, the well-built (says Hotlips) paranoid with a broken arm who refuses all painkillers. Colonel Flagg (who can also be identified as Major Brooks, Lt. Carter, Ensign Troy and Capt. Louise Klein) is CIA. Meanwhile, Trapper's friend, Vinny Pratt, also drops in; Vinny is Intelligence (G-2) and he wants to find out what Flagg is doing. Flagg is BIG, so his operation must be crucial. Because of Fr. Mulcahy, Vinny cannot be Capt. Perkins the priest, so he becomes Capt. Stone, the engineer. Vinny Pratt introduces ...

0068098.title: The General Flipped at Dawn
0068098.description: A visiting general, appearing to be more eccentric than the usual army brass and a stickler for regulations, tries to move the camp closer to the front and court martial Hawkeye before they discover that he's completely loony.

0068098.title: Rainbow Bridge
0068098.description: Hawkeye and Trapper are Tokyo-bound, Frank is jealous; but Trapper wants 3 days without amputating something. Father and Henry bring shopping lists but Radar brings news of more casualties. Thirty-six hours and 473 cases later (an all time record) Henry tells the officers about an unusual radio call Radar took from the Chinese. The Chinese have 9 shot-up GIs they are willing to free...but only if unarmed doctors, a corpsman and a driver travel 9 miles into Chinese territory in one vehicle to retrieve the GIs. All must be totally without weaponry. Margaret and Frank do...

0068098.title: Officer of the Day
0068098.description: Assigned by Frank Burns as Officer of the Day in Henry's absence, Hawkeye must deal with the daily 4077th chaos and try to thwart sneaky Col. Flagg's plans for his Korean prisoner.

0068098.title: Iron Guts Kelly
0068098.description: General Robert "Iron Guts" Kelly arrives for an inspection and dies in Margaret's tent, prompting his aide Colonel Wortman to do damage control and make it look as if Kelly died in combat.

0068098.title: O.R.
0068098.description: Drama, pathos and humor combine when heavy casualties result in a long session in the O.R.

0068098.title: Springtime
0068098.description: It is a beautiful Spring day that makes one yearn for a group lobotomy. Trapper grabs a nurse; Radar wants to grab pretty Lt. Simmons (Mary Kay Place) and Henry grabs some golf. In the field, nostrils flare as Hotlips and Frank grab each other. A hairy English rose reads Rupert Brooke... and a telegram. She said yes! Hawkeye almost gets grabbed by a disturbed feline fondler, but his new buddy, Gargantuan Marine, Lyle Wesson (Alex Karras) saves him. And he keeps on saving him! Henry arranges a wireless wedding between Korea and Toledo with Father Mulcahy presiding. The...

0068098.title: Check-Up
0068098.description: Trapper John's ulcer flares up and could provide grounds for a medical discharge from the Army.

0068098.title: Life with Father
0068098.description: Henry suspects his wife is having an affair, Hawkeye searches for presidents' faces to try to win a pony and Father Mulcahy officiates at a Jewish Bris with the help of a rabbi on a faraway aircraft carrier.

0068098.title: Alcoholics Unanimous
0068098.description: When Henry goes to Tokyo for a conference Frank outlaws alcoholic beverages and dismantles the still but discovers that it's not so easy to dry out the 4077th.

0068098.title: There Is Nothing Like a Nurse
0068098.description: After a run-in with Major Houlihan, Henry is not altogether unhappy when the nurses are evacuated due to a possible enemy attack but soon finds out with rest of the camp just how much the nurses mean to the unit.

0068098.title: Adam's Ribs
0068098.description: After literally being fed up with mess hall food, Hawkeye goes on a desperate quest to order barbecue spare ribs from his favorite restaurant, Adam's Ribs, at Dearborn Station in Chicago.

0068098.title: A Full Rich Day
0068098.description: Hawkeye records a letter to his Dad, detailing the exploits of a mad Turkish soldier, the loss of a Luxembourg Lieutenant's corpse, and a lieutenant's strong-arm tactics to obtain medical care for a comrade.

0068098.title: Mad Dogs and Servicemen
0068098.description: Against Frank's objections, Hawkeye and Trapper treat a young, shell-shocked GI with hysterical paralysis while Henry searches for a possibly rabid dog that bit Radar.

0068098.title: Private Charles Lamb
0068098.description: When the 4077th is invited to share an Easter meal with a Greek unit, tender-hearted Radar comes up with a creative way to save the main course...a lamb!

0068098.title: Bombed
0068098.description: While Radar tries to stop the camp from being shelled by their own artillery, Frank finds a wounded enemy soldier wired to explode, Margaret and Trapper get stuck in a supply shed and Henry and Father Mulcahy get blown up in the latrine.

0068098.title: Bulletin Board
0068098.description: Trapper writes a letter to his daughter, Shirley Temple dances, and the 4077th tries to take a mental break from GIs suffering from hypothermia and post-op bleeding by throwing a benefit picnic for the orphanage.

0068098.title: The Consultant
0068098.description: Hawkeye learns more than just a new surgical technique when a casual conversation in a Tokyo bar with a medical consultant convinces the man to come to the 4077th.

0068098.title: House Arrest
0068098.description: After Hawkeye makes an insulting remark about Margaret, Frank snaps him with a towel and Hawkeye responds with a nicely placed right cross to Frank's eye. Hawkeye is then placed under house arrest and instead of being treated like a criminal, he is treated like a conquering hero for what he did even to the point of getting some very tasty water buffalo steak and having movies shown in the Swamp. In the meantime, Colonel Reese, the woman in charge of all the nurses in Korea, arrives to observe Margaret and her staff and, for some strange reason, becomes attracted to ...

0068098.title: Aid Station
0068098.description: Hawkeye, Margaret, and Klinger travel to an aid station at the front, where they end up working closely together under heavy fire and unsanitary medical conditions.

0068098.title: Love and Marriage
0068098.description: Hawkeye and Trapper try to unite a Korean medic with his family in spite of Frank's interference and find out that a young GI isn't telling the whole truth about his upcoming marriage to a Korean woman.

0068098.title: Big Mac
0068098.description: The camp prepares for a visit from General Douglas MacArthur, but Klinger interrupts the proceedings with his attempts to earn a Section 8 discharge.

0068098.title: Payday
0068098.description: A clerical error results in an unexpected payday windfall for Hawkeye and the ire of a zealous payroll clerk.

0068098.title: White Gold
0068098.description: The attempted theft of penicillin from the 4077th by a group of suspected black marketeers brings Col. Flagg to investigate.

0068098.title: Abyssinia, Henry
0068098.description: Henry finds out he's been discharged from the army, and everyone at the 4077th prepares to say goodbye to him as he heads for home.

0068098.title: Welcome to Korea
0068098.description: Hawkeye returns from R&R to find out Trapper has been discharged. He rushes to the airport to say goodbye but misses him. But it gives him an opportunity to welcome Trapper's replacement, B.J., to Korea.

0068098.title: Change of Command
0068098.description: Col. Sherman T. Potter assumes command of the 4077th.

0068098.title: It Happened One Night
0068098.description: It's a bitterly cold night, and Hawkeye and B.J. are stuck with the overnight shift and a roomful of unruly patients. In the meantime, Margaret tells Frank that she keeps all his love letters--so he ransacks her tent to get them back.

0068098.title: The Late Captain Pierce
0068098.description: Hawkeye finds out that due to clerical error, he has been declared dead.

0068098.title: Hey, Doc
0068098.description: Hawkeye and B.J. agree to help a colleague trying to start a Korean restaurant when he gets home. But Frank refuses to cooperate--until he is involved in an ridiculous tank accident.

0068098.title: The Bus
0068098.description: After their bus breaks down in the middle of nowhere on the way back from a medical convention, Hawkeye, B.J., Colonel Potter, Frank and Radar find themselves stranded.

0068098.title: Dear Mildred
0068098.description: Colonel Potter writes his anniversary letter to his wife. Meanwhile, Frank and Margaret try to find the perfect anniversary gift, only to be outdone by Radar.

0068098.title: The Kids
0068098.description: The 4077th takes in Nurse Cratty's Korean orphans during a shelling attack, including a pregnant girl with a bullet wound. But Frank accuses one of the orphans of stealing his newly (and dubiously) awarded Purple Heart.

0068098.title: Quo Vadis, Captain Chandler
0068098.description: The latest group of casualties includes a bomber pilot who claims he's Jesus Christ. Frank and Margaret think he's faking battle fatigue in order to get a discharge, and they bring in Colonel Flagg to help expose him.

0068098.title: Dear Peggy
0068098.description: B.J. writes a letter home to his wife, and Father Mulcahy gets a visit from one of his rigid superiors.

0068098.title: Of Moose and Men
0068098.description: Hawkeye saves the life of a colonel who wants him reprimanded for disrespect. B.J. tries to save the marriage of a friend who found out his wife is cheating on him, and Frank is paranoid that all Koreans are hiding or burying bombs.

0068098.title: Soldier of the Month
0068098.description: The 4077th introduces a "soldier of the month" award, which includes a week of R&R in Tokyo, and Klinger and Radar go all out to win the honor. Frank is supposed to choose the winner, but he contracts a rare fever.

0068098.title: The Gun
0068098.description: A vintage revolver is stolen from the camp's gun locker and Radar is accused as the thief.

0068098.title: Mail Call, Again
0068098.description: Colonel Potter finds out that he's about to become a grandfather, and Major Burns learns that his wife knows about his affair with Margaret--and wants a divorce.

0068098.title: The Price of Tomato Juice
0068098.description: What seems to be a simple request to get tomato juice for Colonel Potter becomes a ridiculous, complicated ordeal when Major Burns asks for something in return.

0068098.title: Dear Ma
0068098.description: Radar's letter home recounts the latest round of foot inspections, and how Colonel Potter's wife's premonition of bad luck comes to fruition.

0068098.title: Der Tag
0068098.description: Hawkeye and B.J. place a toe tag on a passed-out Frank as part of a drunken practical joke. But the joke backfires on them when he is accidentally shipped out to the front lines.

0068098.title: Hawkeye
0068098.description: Hawkeye Pierce, going solo, has an accident with a Jeep, and is rescued by a South Korean family. To prevent himself from succumbing to a concussion, Hawkeye begins talking endlessly to the family, who can't understand a word he's saying.

0068098.title: Some 38th Parallels
0068098.description: Hawkeye has impotency problems, Frank auctions off the 4077th's garbage, and Radar becomes distraught after a patient he has taken special interest in dies.

0068098.title: The Novocaine Mutiny
0068098.description: Hawkeye is court martialed for mutiny under Frank Burns' command.

0068098.title: Smilin' Jack
0068098.description: A chopper pilot with diabetes dead set on bringing in the most wounded from the front to be the 'Chopper Pilot of the Year' continues flying against the docs' orders.

0068098.title: The More I See You
0068098.description: A nurse that Hawkeye used to live with and never got over arrives at the 4077th. And Hawkeye's heartbreak is only intensified when he learns that she is now married.

0068098.title: Deluge
0068098.description: The Chinese Army joins the war, killing any hopes the 4077th has about a speedy resolution and homecoming.

0068098.title: The Interview
0068098.description: War Correspondent Clete Roberts interviews the members of the 4077.

0068098.title: Bug Out
0068098.description: When a rumor for a camp relocation turns out to be real, Hawkeye, Margaret and Radar volunteer to stay behind for a patient who cannot be moved.

0068098.title: Margaret's Engagement
0068098.description: Margaret's sudden engagement comes as a surprise to everyone, but Frank predictably takes it the hardest.

0068098.title: Out of Sight, Out of Mind
0068098.description: Hawkeye is temporarily blinded while trying to fix the nurses' furnace, and Frank finds a sure-fire way to win bets on baseball games.

0068098.title: Lt. Radar O'Reilly
0068098.description: To settle a poker debt, an officer forges promotion papers for Radar to become a Lieutenant

0068098.title: The Nurses
0068098.description: The nurses go behind Margaret's back so that a fellow nurse confined to her tent can spend the night with her soldier husband who is paying her a surprise visit.

0068098.title: The Abduction of Margaret Houlihan
0068098.description: Margaret takes off in the middle of the night to help deliver a Korean baby. Nobody knows of her whereabouts, and Colonel Flagg is brought in to help investigate her disappearance.

0068098.title: Dear Sigmund
0068098.description: Psychiatrist Sidney Freedman composes a letter to Sigmund Freud during a visit to the 4077, while the rest of the camp endures the hijinks of a mystery prankster.

0068098.title: Mulcahy's War
0068098.description: Father Mulcahy, troubled by his lack of experience at the front, insists on accompanying Radar for an errand there.

0068098.title: The Korean Surgeon
0068098.description: Instead of turning him in as a prisoner of war, Hawkeye and B.J. pull some strings to get a wounded North Korean surgeon a spot on the staff.

0068098.title: Hawkeye Get Your Gun
0068098.description: Hawkeye and Potter provide assistance at a Korean clinic, and run into an enemy attack on the way home. Meanwhile, Klinger begins posing as a Gypsy to help get his discharge papers.

0068098.title: The Colonel's Horse
0068098.description: Everybody pitches in to save Colonel Potter's horse, who becomes sick while Potter is away in Tokyo. And Margaret asks Hawkeye, not Frank, to operate on her appendix.

0068098.title: Exorcism
0068098.description: To save the life of an elderly local who rejects an operation because he believes bad spirits surround the 4077th, Colonel Potter permits a Korean exorcism.

0068098.title: Hawk's Nightmare
0068098.description: Hawkeye starts sleepwalking and having horrific nightmares. He begins to think that he may be starting to lose his "war against the war."

0068098.title: The Most Unforgettable Characters
0068098.description: Radar becomes an aspiring writer after ordering a flier from a comic book, and Hawkeye and B.J. give Frank a surprise birthday present that only he will appreciate.

0068098.title: 38 Across
0068098.description: A fouled radio call for help on a crossword puzzle leads to a senior officer coming to the 4077th to help with a supposed serious medical problem.

0068098.title: Ping Pong
0068098.description: The 4077th hosts a traditional Korean wedding, much to Frank's objections. And Colonel Potter runs into an old friend who has put his troops in jeopardy so that he could receive a promotion.

0068098.title: End Run
0068098.description: A former star college football player suffers a severe leg injury in combat and must deal with the consequences, and Major Burns goes behind Colonel Potter's back to set up a boxing match between Klinger and Zale.

0068098.title: Hanky Panky
0068098.description: B.J. falls off the fidelity wagon while trying to provide consolation to a nurse whose marriage has just ended. But will he confess his infidelity to his wife?

0068098.title: Hepatitis
0068098.description: The 4077th has an outbreak of hepatitis and Hawkeye needs to inoculate the reluctant staff while dealing with back pain.

0068098.title: The General's Practitioner
0068098.description: General Korshak wants Hawkeye to be his personal practitioner, despite his constant snottiness. And Radar helps take care of a soldier's half-Korean baby after he is shipped back home.

0068098.title: Movie Tonight
0068098.description: Colonel Potter hopes a Western will be the cure for the 4077th's morale problem. But during the show, the staff of the camp is forced to make its own entertainment during the frequent film breakages.

0068098.title: Souvenirs
0068098.description: Hawkeye and BJ try to stop a chopper pilot from selling souvenirs derived from war materials derived from locals facing danger getting them, and Klinger becomes a pole-sitter in his latest attempt to get a Section Eight.

0068098.title: Post Op
0068098.description: The 4077th is deluged with patients and their individual medical histories. Then they run out of blood and everyone is donating at 48-hour intervals.

0068098.title: Margaret's Marriage
0068098.description: Pressured by Frank, Margaret decides to marry Colonel Donald Penobscott at the 4077th. When Donald arrives in camp, he is treated to a bachelor party and a practical joke while the nurses give Margaret a bridal shower.

0068098.title: Fade Out, Fade In
0068098.description: Frank Burns cracks up over Margaret's marriage while on R&R in Tokyo, and Major Charles Emerson Winchester III is sent to the 4077th as a replacement by a vindictive superior officer.

0068098.title: Fallen Idol
0068098.description: Radar has always looked up to Hawkeye and admired him as his hero. But after suffering a Jeep accident en route to R&R at Hawkeye's behest. Radar questions his own hero worship. Particularly when he and his hero have a falling out.

0068098.title: Last Laugh
0068098.description: A practical joking friend gets BJ into serious trouble when he is arrested for a run-in he supposedly had with a general in Seoul.

0068098.title: War of Nerves
0068098.description: Sidney Freedman feels depressed over Tom, a young soldier, who blames Sidney for his injuries because Sidney sent him back into combat. The 4077th members light a bonfire to release their stress.

0068098.title: The Winchester Tapes
0068098.description: Hawkeye tries to travel to Seoul in order to visit Nurse Gilmore for the weekend. Charles tapes an angry message to his influential parents back home in Boston, asking for their help in getting him reassigned stateside.

0068098.title: The Light That Failed
0068098.description: A delivery error keeps the 4077th from receiving a vital shipment of supplies, Winchester has a selfish reaction to an error that nearly kills a patient, and everyone is forced to guess at the murderer's identity in a mystery novel.

0068098.title: In Love and War
0068098.description: Despite Colonel Potter's warning, Hawkeye falls in love with a Korean villager. Meanwhile, Margaret learns that her husband Donald may have made a pass at a new nurse assigned to the 4077th.

0068098.title: Change Day
0068098.description: Winchester plots to cheat the natives when the Army changes the military scrip while Klinger tries to attempt to apply to West Point in order to drop out later.

0068098.title: Images
0068098.description: Radar wants to get a tattoo, which Hawkeye and B.J. try to discourage. Major Houlihan wants to transfer one of her nurses out because she is too emotional for the job.

0068098.title: The M*A*S*H Olympics
0068098.description: When Col. Potter decides the 4077th personnel are out of shape, he orders them to exercise. To motivate them, he comes up with the idea for a series of competitions like the Olympics, with the prize being a 3-day pass.

0068098.title: The Grim Reaper
0068098.description: Colonel Bloodworth threatens to press court-martial charges against Hawkeye, who shoved him in the bar. But then he becomes a patient and witnesses Hawkeye's skills. Klinger bonds with a patient from his hometown.

0068098.title: Comrades in Arms: Part 1
0068098.description: Hawkeye and Margaret become romantically involved while they are trapped behind enemy lines.

0068098.title: Comrades in Arms: Part 2
0068098.description: B.J. disobeys orders and goes out to find Hawkeye and Margret, who are still missing in action. Meanwhile, their romantic relationship quickly goes up in flames, and they become even more hostile toward each other.

0068098.title: The Merchant of Korea
0068098.description: B.J. and Hawkeye are fed up with doing favors for Winchester because they owe him money. So they challenge him to a poker game to win it back.

0068098.title: The Smell of Music
0068098.description: Hawkeye and B.J. refuse to shower until Charles stops playing his French horn, and Colonel Potter deals with a patient who wants to kill himself because he is now disfigured.

0068098.title: Patent 4077
0068098.description: Hawkeye is fed up with having to work with inadequate surgical equipment, so he tries to find somebody to create a makeshift clamp for him. And Klinger tries to find Margaret's wedding ring after it was accidentally thrown out with the trash.

0068098.title: Tea and Empathy
0068098.description: Father Mulcahy and Klinger retrieve some stolen penicillin after a soldier's confession, B.J. deals with a patient's morphine addiction, and British Major Ross demands that Hawkeye release his still-injured soldiers.

0068098.title: Your Hit Parade
0068098.description: As the unit becomes overrun with casualties and tempers begin to flare, Radar tries to raise everyone's spirits by playing some new records over the intercom.

0068098.title: What's Up, Doc?
0068098.description: Hawkeye conducts a rabbit test on Radar's bunny to find out if Margaret is pregnant, and a patient desperate to get home holds Winchester hostage.

0068098.title: Mail Call Three
0068098.description: Klinger's wife wants a divorce, Radar's upset because his mom is seeing a new man, B.J. finds out that another man made a pass at his wife, and Hawkeye receives another love letter for another soldier named Benjamin Pierce.

0068098.title: Temporary Duty
0068098.description: The 4077th and the 8063rd exchange Hawkeye and a nurse for a crude bumpkin surgeon and a personal friend of Margaret.

0068098.title: Potter's Retirement
0068098.description: When Col. Potter learns of an informant feeding negative reports on his command bad enough to prompt an outside inspection, he decides to retire.

0068098.title: Dr. Winchester and Mr. Hyde
0068098.description: While dealing with a long stretch of surgery duty, Winchester gets addicted to amphetamines. And Radar sets up a mouse race competition between the 4077th and a group of cocky Marine patients.

0068098.title: Major Topper
0068098.description: Between the Swamp-mates trying to top each other, the camp deals with a bad batch of morphine and a corporal who shoots down invisible enemy gliders.

0068098.title: Commander Pierce
0068098.description: When Pierce is temporarily put in charge of the 4077th, the weight of the responsibility takes its toll. He changes, becoming up-tight and authoritarian.

0068098.title: Peace on Us
0068098.description: When the Army increases the number of points needed for a discharge, Hawkeye gets angry and interrupts official peace talks. Meanwhile, Margaret decides to divorce Donald after he permanently transfers himself stateside.

0068098.title: Lil
0068098.description: Radar gets bent out of shape when he thinks Colonel Potter is spending too much time with a visiting female colonel, and Hawkeye tries to figure out what BJ's initials stand for.

0068098.title: Our Finest Hour
0068098.description: An hour-long series retrospective. A reporter, Clete Roberts, interviews the staff. Mixed in are scenes from past shows.

0068098.title: The Billfold Syndrome
0068098.description: Major Winchester decides to quit talking to everyone at the camp, which Hawkeye and B.J. take as a challenge. Meanwhile, a medic gets amnesia.

0068098.title: None Like It Hot
0068098.description: A bath tub Hawkeye and B.J. purchase during a heat wave instantly becomes the ultimate hot spot, while Radar prepares for a tonsillectomy.

0068098.title: They Call the Wind Korea
0068098.description: During a wind storm, and while lost on the way to Seoul, Winchester and Klinger come across an overturned Greek transport with several injured men.

0068098.title: Major Ego
0068098.description: Major Winchester lets his surgical prowess go to his head when a "Stars and Stripes" journalist comes to interview him. But the journalist is more interested in making moves on Margaret than getting the story.

0068098.title: Baby, It's Cold Outside
0068098.description: The 4077th is forced to use extreme measures to save a group of soldiers suffering from hypothermia, while Klinger suffers temporary deafness after a mine explosion on his watch.

0068098.title: Point of View
0068098.description: You see a wounded soldier being treated at the 4077th through his eyes.

0068098.title: Dear Comrade
0068098.description: A North Korean Spy infiltrates the 4077 and poses as Charles' houseboy, to observe and report on 4077th's efficiency and success to his superiors. The staff is baffled by a skin-rash epidemic.

0068098.title: Out of Gas
0068098.description: When the camp copes with a critical shortage of sodium pentathol, a vital anesthetic, Father Mulcahy must use his black market contacts to get some.

0068098.title: An Eye for a Tooth
0068098.description: Winchester encourages Hawkeye, B.J. and Margaret to raise the stakes in their practical joke battle, and Father Mulcahy is desperate to receive a promotion.

0068098.title: Dear Sis
0068098.description: It's Christmas time in Korea, and everybody's depressed--especially Father Mulcahy, who is concerned that he isn't making a difference to anyone.

0068098.title: B. J. Papa San
0068098.description: B.J. helps out a local Korean family. Meanwhile, a general has a series of mishaps in camp.

0068098.title: Inga
0068098.description: Hawkeye falls for a visiting Swedish doctor, but is disconcerted by her take-charge ways. As a result, he is forced to confront his chauvinistic views toward powerful women.

0068098.title: The Price
0068098.description: Klinger tries to bribe Colonel Potter, but Potter is more concerned with the disappearance of his horse, Sophie. Meanwhile, Hawkeye and B.J. try to hide a man who is about to be drafted into the Korean army.

0068098.title: The Young and the Restless
0068098.description: The arrival of fresh-faced lecturer Capt. Simmons and his subsequent performance in ER turns Winchester into a drunk, Potter into an invalid, and BJ into a bookworm. Meanwhile, Klinger begins acting like he's back home in Toledo.

0068098.title: Hot Lips Is Back in Town
0068098.description: Margaret celebrates her newly obtained divorce by creating a new way to handle triage and invites a general to observe. Radar is enamored of a new nurse and tries everything he knows to get her attention.

0068098.title: C*A*V*E
0068098.description: A hurried relocation to a cave is complicated by Hawkeye revealing he has claustrophobia.

0068098.title: Rally 'Round the Flagg, Boys
0068098.description: A patient accuses Hawkeye of being a Communist sympathizer when he operates on a Korean soldier ahead of an American. As a result, Colonel Flagg attempts to recruit Winchester to spy on Hawkeye.

0068098.title: Preventative Medicine
0068098.description: Hawkeye performs a shocking and sinister stunt to keep a war-obsessed colonel from sending more young victims to a possible early grave, while Klinger tries to use voodoo on Potter to get a discharge.

0068098.title: A Night at Rosie's
0068098.description: In an act of protest, Hawkeye goes to Rosie's Bar and decrees he is not leaving. One by one he is joined by fellow surgeons and staff, including an annoyed Colonel Potter.

0068098.title: Ain't Love Grand
0068098.description: While B.J. and Hawkeye snipe at each other, Klinger romances a nurse and Winchester romances a Korean working girl.

0068098.title: The Party
0068098.description: Even while the camp is bugging out (and back), B.J. promotes the idea of a stateside "reunion" for the families of those at the 4077th.

0068098.title: Too Many Cooks
0068098.description: The 4077 receives a patient who is a bumbler at the front but regular gourmet in the mess tent. The surgical staff try and convince Potter to keep him but he flatly refuses. He has enough trouble as it is, his marriage is in danger.

0068098.title: Are You Now, Margaret?
0068098.description: A visiting Congressional aide accuses Margaret of being a Communist sympathizer and it could ruin her career. This dovetails with Klinger entering the Stars & Stripes photo contest.

0068098.title: Guerilla My Dreams
