Jerry, George, and the understudy are vilified for the incident, and Kramer goes out of his way to help Bette. Meanwhile, Elaine suspects that a local nail shop is making fun of her in Korean. She learns that George's dad Frank speaks Korean and ...

0098904.title: The Engagement
0098904.description: While sitting in the coffee shop, Jerry and George resolve to grow up and take life more seriously. Jerry decides to call the woman he recently broke up with - because she shushed him. For his part, George has been thinking a lot about his former girlfriend Susan. After imagining the ideal life they could have together, he goes to her apartment and proposes. She accepts and George almost immediately begins to have second thoughts, especially after Jerry breaks up with his girlfriend a second time. Elaine meanwhile is having trouble with a neighbor's barking dog and ...

0098904.title: The Postponement
0098904.description: George gets cold feet and tries everything he can to postpone the engagement; Elaine is jealous of George's engagement; Kramer spills hot coffee on himself.

0098904.title: The Maestro
0098904.description: Elaine's latest boyfriend likes to be known as "The Maestro"; Kramer reaches an unsatisfactory settlement with the coffee company, much to his lawyer's chagrin.

0098904.title: The Wink
0098904.description: Jerry squirts grapefruit into George's eye at breakfast, and for the rest of the day George is misinterpreted because everyone thinks he is winking at them.

0098904.title: The Hot Tub
0098904.description: Wilhelm thinks George is cracking under the pressure of working in the big leagues. So he has George entertain a group of visiting baseball officials from the Houston Astros, who are in New York to discuss inter-league play. George picks up a bad habit from them, who call everyone either a "bastard" or a "son of a bitch". Kramer buys a hot tub from his friend Lomez and installs it in his apartment. At the same time, Elaine is having a marathon runner from Trinidad And Tobago named Jean Paul Jean Paul stay with her as a house guest. Jean Paul was in the Olympics and ...

0098904.title: The Soup Nazi
0098904.description: A soup stand owner obsesses about his customers' ordering procedure, but his soup is so good that people line up down the block for it anyway.

0098904.title: The Secret Code
0098904.description: George refuses to give anyone his secret code (BOSCO). Kramer buys a police scanner. Jerry does a series of ads for Leapin' Larry's Appliance Store. Elaine has dinner with J. Peterman but after she and Jerry bail on the dinner, George is stuck to dine with Peterman. George spills his secret code to Peterman's dying mother and gets in trouble for it.

0098904.title: The Pool Guy
0098904.description: Jerry has a hard time telling the pool guy at his new health club that there isn't room for a 5th member of the group. George's worlds collide when Elaine starts hanging out with Susan. Kramer discovers that his phone number is one digit off from that of a popular movie-finding service and offers help to those that mistakenly call his number.

0098904.title: The Sponge
0098904.description: After learning that her prophylactic of choice is being discontinued, Elaine buys a case of Today sponges and scrutinizes her dates for their sponge-worthiness.

0098904.title: The Gum
0098904.description: When Lloyd Braun comes back from the psychiatric hospital, Kramer takes him under his wing and convinces Jerry to buy gum from him and wear glasses that don't belong to him to prove that Lloyd isn't crazy. George tries to prove to his old neighbor Deena that he isn't crazy after a cashier short-changes him.

0098904.title: The Rye
0098904.description: After George's parents take back the bread they gifted to Susan's parents, George makes Jerry find another loaf and tries to appease Susan's parents by taking them on Kramer's Manhattan horse tours, to disastrous consequences.

0098904.title: The Caddy
0098904.description: Elaine's floozy former ex-roommate Sue Ellen Mischkie returns. George locks his keys in his car and leaves it in the Yankees parking lot. Elaine, out of spite, buys Sue Ellen a bra for a birthday gift as she has never worn one. George, having successfully convinced Wilhelm and Steinbrenner that he's putting in extra hours, decides to skip town with Susan after learning that her father rebuilt the cabin. So George asks Kramer and Jerry to go to Yankee Stadium and take the fliers off of his car. The car is really dirty, and Jerry and Kramer decide to go take it to the ...

0098904.title: The Seven
0098904.description: George becomes upset when Susan's cousin names her baby with the name he planned to use for his first child; Jerry questions his girlfriend's style.

0098904.title: The Cadillac
0098904.description: In this hour-long episode, Jerry performs the biggest show of his life in Atlantic City. He receives a rather generous pay check for the event, and decides to buy his father a Cadillac. Unfortunately, doing so puts Morty in the hot seat with the condo board of directors, where he serves as president. Morty is accused of stealing money from the board, and ultimately gets removed from his post as president and kicked out of the condo. Meanwhile, thanks to Elaine, George can score a date with "My Cousin Vinny" star Marisa Tomei but Elaine objects because of George's ...

0098904.title: The Shower Head
0098904.description: Peterman wants Elaine to go to Africa, but when Elaine tests positive for Opium in her physical, that means no dice. George tries to convince his parents to move to Florida so that he finally gets his "buffer zone", but they have problems with Jerry's parents. Kramer and Newman scheme to buy black market shower heads when the building switches to low-flow ones.

0098904.title: The Doll
0098904.description: George freaks out when he discovers that Susan has a doll that looks exactly like his mother. Jerry decides to use that as a bit on the Charles Grodin show when his prop gets destroyed in his carry-on luggage, but fellow comedian Sally Weaver screws up his bit by bringing him the wrong doll.

0098904.title: The Friars Club
0098904.description: Jerry has a hard time getting membership in the Friar's Club when the Flying Santos Brothers take his jacket during a show. Meanwhile, Elaine suspects that a new co-worker (Rob Schneider) is faking a hearing disorder to get out of doing work.

0098904.title: The Wig Master
0098904.description: Susan's friends are in town for the Broadway production of Joseph And The Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat. Kramer gets to wear the coat and is mistaken for a pimp in public when he accuses a local parking lot of running a prostitution ring out of his car. Jerry buys a jacket and later returns it for spite. Elaine tries to buy a dress from the same guy Jerry gets the jacket from, but is stunned to learn that he's holding it until Elaine sleeps with him.

0098904.title: The Calzone
0098904.description: George gets Steinbrenner hooked on eggplant calzones from a local Italian restaurant. But George gets banned from the restaurant when he's accused of stealing from the tip jar. He then asks Kramer to pick up the calzones, but Kramer gets kicked out when he tries to pay with pennies. George's last resort in getting the calzones is Newman who wants a cut of every delivery. Meanwhile, Kramer will only wear clothing if it's straight from the dryer.

0098904.title: The Bottle Deposit
0098904.description: A garage mechanic steals Jerry's car. Elaine tries to win J. Peterman JFK's presidential golf clubs at an auction. George is asked to work on a mysterious assignment. Kramer and Newman run a recycling scam.

0098904.title: The Wait Out
0098904.description: A comment from George ends up causing a married couple to get divorced and Jerry and Elaine to date the soon-to-be exes. Kramer tries wearing jeans.

0098904.title: The Invitations
0098904.description: It's finally time for George and Susan's wedding. George doesn't think he can go through with the wedding. But when Susan puts George in charge of the wedding invitations, George gets the cheapest ones in the lot, knowing that the glue for the envelopes is cheap. Unfortunately for Susan, the glue is also toxic and licking the envelopes has fatal consequences. Meanwhile, Jerry courts a woman just like him named Janeanne Steinberg and holds up his end of George's "pact" (see episode "The Engagement").

0098904.title: The Foundation
0098904.description: George enjoys the single life. Elaine takes over the catalog when J. Peterman suddenly goes missing. Kramer is taking karate lessons.

0098904.title: The Soul Mate
0098904.description: George thinks the Board of Directors are talking behind his back. Kramer has a crush on Jerry's new girlfriend. Elaine doesn't see the big deal in having a baby.

0098904.title: The Bizarro Jerry
0098904.description: George uses Susan's death to pick up women. Elaine's new friend is Jerry's exact opposite. Jerry's new girlfriend has manly hands. Kramer pretends to work for an upscale firm.

0098904.title: The Little Kicks
0098904.description: Jerry is forced to bootleg a movie for Kramer's friend. George tries the "bad boy" image. No one has the heart to tell Elaine that she's a terrible dancer.

0098904.title: The Package
0098904.description: A mysterious package arrives for Jerry. Elaine is curious about what the doctors are writing in her records. George tries to hit on the cute girl at the "One Hour Photo" place.

0098904.title: The Fatigues
0098904.description: Jerry's new girlfriend's mentor is dating Bania. Kramer volunteers to host a Jewish singles mixer. George tries to study up on risk management. Elaine promotes a man she is afraid to fire.

0098904.title: The Checks
0098904.description: Jerry gets hundreds of royalty checks, worth 12 cents each, for appearing on a Japanese TV program and gets writer's cramp. George and Jerry pitch their pilot to Japanese TV executives.

0098904.title: The Chicken Roaster
0098904.description: Kenny Rogers' Roasters sets up shop across the street from Jerry and Kramer's apartments. Unfortunately, their unusually large chicken sign causes problems for everybody. Kramer and Jerry wind up switching apartments--and personalities--because of it. Jerry is freaked out by a wooden doll in Kramer's apartment, and Newman gets Kramer hooked on Kenny Roger's chicken. Elaine gets comfortable in her position as president of the catalog but is quickly accused of abusing the company credit card, especially when she buys George an expensive hat and George purposefully ...

0098904.title: The Abstinence
0098904.description: Abstinence allows George to become a genius, but it turns Elaine into an idiot. Jerry gets bumped from career day at his old Jr. High School. Kramer turns his apartment into a smoking lounge and all the smoke disfigures his face.

0098904.title: The Andrea Doria
0098904.description: A survivor of a shipwreck beats George out of an apartment, so George decides to tell the landlords the tragedies of his life in hopes of getting it back based on pity.

0098904.title: The Little Jerry
0098904.description: Jerry bounces a check. Kramer buys a live chicken. George dates a female convict. Elaine dates a man who shaves his head.

0098904.title: The Money
0098904.description: Jerry's parents believe he is financially unstable. Kramer has trouble sleeping with his girlfriend. Elaine enjoys her position as President of the J. Peterman catalog. George hopes to get his parents' money when they die.

0098904.title: The Comeback
0098904.description: George tries to come up with a good comeback after someone insults him. Elaine falls in love with a mysterious employee at the video store. Kramer wants to die a certain way. Jerry takes advice from a tennis player who stinks.

0098904.title: The Van Buren Boys
0098904.description: Kramer gets mixed up with a gang when he is mugged by them and mistakenly shows their secret sign.

0098904.title: The Susie
0098904.description: Kramer sets his watch an hour ahead. George tries to avoid a breakup with his girlfriend. A colleague keeps calling Elaine, Susie. Jerry gambles on a basketball game, but the bookie can't pay him.

0098904.title: The Pothole
0098904.description: Jerry accidentally knocks his girlfriend's toothbrush in the toilet. George drops his keys in a pothole that is paved over. A restaurant refuses to deliver food to Elaine's address. Kramer adopts a highway.

0098904.title: The English Patient
0098904.description: Elaine is dragged to see the movie "

0098904.title: The Nap
0098904.description: George takes a nap under his desk. Kramer swims in the East River. Jerry has some maintenance done on his kitchen. Elaine's new boyfriend buys her a new mattress.

0098904.title: The Yada Yada
0098904.description: George's new girlfriend keeps including "Yada Yada" in her stories. Jerry is offended by Tim Whatley's Jewish jokes. Elaine tries to help her friends adopt a baby. Kramer and Mickey fight over two women.

0098904.title: The Millennium
0098904.description: Kramer and Newman compete during the early planning of each of their millenium parties.

0098904.title: The Muffin Tops
0098904.description: Elaine opens a new bakery that sells only the tops of the muffins.

0098904.title: The Summer of George
0098904.description: Unemployed again, George decides to have a "memorable" summer. Jerry's new girlfriend has another dude. Kramer wins a Tony Award. A new girl at work is hostile towards Elaine.

0098904.title: The Butter Shave
0098904.description: Kramer discovers the amazing yet unknown uses of butter, but accidentally fries himself after using it as sunscreen.

0098904.title: The Voice
0098904.description: George's colleagues try to force him to leave. Jerry makes fun of his girlfriend's bellybutton. Kramer hires an intern. Elaine gets back together with David Puddy.

0098904.title: The Serenity Now
0098904.description: Jerry opens up his feelings. Elaine is getting hit on by the Jews. Kramer gets a screen door. George helps his father sell computers.

0098904.title: The Blood
0098904.description: Jerry's parents hire their friend Izzy Mandelbaum to become Jerry's personal trainer while George decides to associate food and television with his love life.

0098904.title: The Junk Mail
0098904.description: Kramer is annoyed with the catalogs he keeps getting in the mail. Elaine falls in love with a guy because of his smile. George's parents are avoiding him. Jerry can't find it in his heart to reject a gift from an old school friend.

0098904.title: The Merv Griffin Show
0098904.description: George runs over a flock of pigeons. Jerry's girlfriend has a vintage toy collection she won't let him touch. A new co-worker is freaking Elaine out. Kramer rebuilds the set of "The Merv Griffin Show" in his apartment.

0098904.title: The Slicer
0098904.description: Elaine borrows Kramer's meat slicer to feed her neighbor's cat while George tries to hide his not-so-great past from his new boss.

0098904.title: The Betrayal
0098904.description: Elaine and the gang head to India to attend a wedding; Jerry betrays George by having sex with his prospective girlfriend; Kramer grapples with a malignant wish.

0098904.title: The Apology
0098904.description: George is angered when an old acquaintance withholds a 12-Step-mandated apology; Jerry's girlfriend is too comfortable with her nudity; Elaine works with a germaphobe.

0098904.title: The Strike
0098904.description: Jerry goes out with a woman who is beautiful one day and ugly the next. Kramer goes back to work at H&H Bagels. George makes up a charity. Elaine gives a fake number to a man.

0098904.title: The Dealership
0098904.description: Jerry looks to buy a new car from Elaine's boyfriend. George tries to find a snack. Kramer test drives a car.

0098904.title: The Reverse Peephole
0098904.description: Elaine is embarrassed by Puddy's fur coat. Kramer tries to keep Newman from getting evicted. George carries everything in his wallet. Jerry is through with wallets.

0098904.title: The Cartoon
0098904.description: Sally Weaver makes fun of Jerry. George's new girlfriend looks just like Jerry. Kramer takes a vow of silence. Elaine gets a job drawing cartoons for the New Yorker.

0098904.title: The Strongbox
0098904.description: George's new girlfriend refuses to break up with him. Jerry doesn't help out a neighbor. Elaine's new boyfriend is poor. Kramer tries to find a good place to hide his key for his strongbox.

0098904.title: The Wizard
0098904.description: Jerry goes down to Florida for his father's birthday. George tries to avoid Susan's parents. Elaine can't figure out her new boyfriend's nationality. Kramer decides to retire.

0098904.title: The Burning
0098904.description: Elaine finds out that Puddy is religious. Kramer pretends to have gonorrhea. Jerry's new girlfriend has a tractor story to tell him. George wants everyone at work to like him.

0098904.title: The Bookstore
0098904.description: George is forced to buy a book he took with him into the bathroom. Jerry finds out that his Uncle Leo is a shoplifter. Elaine doesn't want to be known as the office skank. Kramer and Newman start a Hong Kong rickshaw business.

0098904.title: The Frogger
0098904.description: George is obsessed with preserving his Frogger high score for posterity; Jerry stays one step ahead of a serial killer; Elaine eats Peterman's expensive cake:

0098904.title: The Maid
0098904.description: Jerry gets into romance with his maid; George struggles to get the nickname "T-Bone" around the office; Elaine searches for a new telephone number.

0098904.title: The Puerto Rican Day
0098904.description: Jerry, George, Kramer and Elaine get stuck in standstill traffic due to the massive Puerto Rican Day Parade.

0098904.title: The Chronicle
0098904.description: Just as the four are about to go to the movies, Jerry looks back on the past nine years with the audience.

0098904.title: The Finale
0098904.description: After George and Jerry land a production deal with NBC, the four head out for Paris on NBC's private plane and are waylaid in a small Massachusetts town.

0105946.title: Midnight on the Firing Line
0105946.description: The Narn attack a Centauri colony, while Raiders attack transport ships. And Talia Winters arrives at the station.

0105946.title: Soul Hunter
0105946.description: A mysterious alien who steals the souls of the living arrives on the station putting Delenn's life in danger.

0105946.title: Born to the Purple
0105946.description: Londo falls for a beautiful slave, whose owner wants to steal sensitive information. Garibaldi discovers that someone is using a restricted communications channel.

0105946.title: Infection
0105946.description: A living weapon wreaks havoc on the station.

0105946.title: The Parliament of Dreams
0105946.description: A week long cultural festival is takes place on board the station. Catherine Sakai, Sinclair's old girlfriend, arrives on the station and G'Kar receives a death threat.

0105946.title: Mind War
0105946.description: The Psi-Cops arrive at the station to capture Talia's old Psi Corps instructor. Catherine is warned not to survey a sector of space by G'Kar.

0105946.title: The War Prayer
0105946.description: A pro-Earth group attacks a Minbari poet and two Centauri lovers seek Londo's help.

0105946.title: And the Sky Full of Stars
0105946.description: Sinclair is kidnapped by people who want to know what happened when he disappeared in the last battle of the Earth/Minbari war, knowledge that even Sinclair does not know.

0105946.title: Deathwalker
0105946.description: A war criminal scientist who is the last of the notorious Dilgars is discovered on B5 bearing an extraordinary medication that all the powers want.

0105946.title: Believers
0105946.description: An alien family refuses surgery to save their dying child.

0105946.title: Survivors
0105946.description: Garibaldi is blamed for an accident aboard B5, leading to his return to the bottle.

0105946.title: By Any Means Necessary
0105946.description: While the station's dock workers stage an illegal strike, G'Kar tries to hold a Narn religious ceremony, but Londo holds the plant he needs and won't relinquish it.

0105946.title: Signs and Portents
0105946.description: Londo obtains a priceless Centauri artifact and a stranger visits each alien ambassador asking only one question.

0105946.title: TKO
0105946.description: A disgraced boxer comes to Babylon 5 to compete in the Mutai, an alien fighting match. Meanwhile, an old friend visits Ivanova so that she can mourn the loss of her father.

0105946.title: Grail
0105946.description: A man searching for the Holy Grail arrives. Ambassador Kosh may be behind a string of attacks on the station.

0105946.title: Eyes
0105946.description: A Colonel investigates Sinclair and his command staff for recent station actions.

0105946.title: Legacies
0105946.description: A Minbari military leader's dead body disappears on the station.

0105946.title: A Voice in the Wilderness: Part 1
0105946.description: One of Delenn's old friends arrives on the station when an extinct civilization is found on the planet that Babylon 5 orbits.

0105946.title: A Voice in the Wilderness: Part 2
0105946.description: An Earthforce captain and an alien race both lay claim to the planet below.

0105946.title: Babylon Squared
0105946.description: B5's immediate predecessor, Babylon 4, suddenly reappears after mysteriously vanishing years ago.

0105946.title: The Quality of Mercy
0105946.description: Talia must enter the mind of a convicted murderer while Dr. Franklin goes to Downbelow to investigate a doctor who apparently is 'magically' healing people.

0105946.title: Chrysalis
0105946.description: Garibaldi investigates a death on the station which leads him to a terrible discovery.

0105946.title: Points of Departure
0105946.description: As Captain John Sheridan assumes command of B5, he learns the reason why the Minbari inexplicably surrendered to Earth in the Earth-Minbari war while a renegade Minbari ship seeks to restart it.

0105946.title: Revelations
0105946.description: G'Kar brings news of an old enemy's return. Dr. Franklin tries to bring Garibaldi out from his coma. Delenn returns, quite changed.

0105946.title: The Geometry of Shadows
0105946.description: Ivanova deals with a Drazi custom, which only occurs once every 5 years. Techno-mages arrive on the station.

0105946.title: A Distant Star
0105946.description: Captain Sheridan's old commanding officer arrives at the station, and disaster ensues in Hyperspace.

0105946.title: The Long Dark
0105946.description: A sleeper ship is found adrift near the station, where a deadly force awaits.

0105946.title: Spider in the Web
0105946.description: Talia witnesses a murder at the hands of a Free Mars member.

0105946.title: Soul Mates
0105946.description: Visitors to the station include Londo's three wives and Talia's ex-husband. Delenn has a bad hair day.

0105946.title: A Race Through Dark Places
0105946.description: Bester has Talia investigate an "underground railroad" of telepaths escaping the Psi-corp.

0105946.title: The Coming of Shadows
0105946.description: The Centauri emperor visits the station, leading G'Kar to attempt to assassinate him. Lord Refa and Londo conspire to expand their power on Centauri Prime.

0105946.title: GROPOS
0105946.description: A task force of ground troops led by Dr. Franklin's father is assembled at B5, leading to some friction.

0105946.title: All Alone in the Night
0105946.description: Sheridan is kidnapped onto an alien ship and General Hague makes an unofficial visit to the station.

0105946.title: Acts of Sacrifice
0105946.description: G'Kar asks Sheridan for Earth Force help in the Narn/Centauri war.

0105946.title: Hunter, Prey
0105946.description: A fugitive with secret Earth Force data flees to Babylon 5.

0105946.title: There All the Honor Lies
0105946.description: Sheridan kills a Minbari warrior in self-defense, but a Minbari witness to the incident claims it was not justified.

0105946.title: And Now for a Word
0105946.description: ISN arrives on the station to film a documentary of the station and crew.

0105946.title: In the Shadow of Z'ha'dum
0105946.description: Sheridan discovers that Morden has a connection with his dead wife. Nightwatch, a new agency on Earth is trying to recruit new personnel.

0105946.title: Knives
0105946.description: An old friend asks for help from Londo. Sheridan is possessed by a strange creature.

0105946.title: Confessions and Lamentations
0105946.description: Dr. Franklin tries desperately to find a cure for a disease which is killing off all the Markab on the station.

0105946.title: Divided Loyalties
0105946.description: Lyta Alexander returns to the station with news that one of the officers on the station is an undercover operative.

0105946.title: The Long, Twilight Struggle
0105946.description: The Narn/Centauri War comes to a devastating turn of events.

0105946.title: Comes the Inquisitor
0105946.description: Kosh tests Delenn's allegiance while G'Kar attempts to bring his people together on Babylon 5.

0105946.title: The Fall of Night
0105946.description: While the Centauri/Narn war escalates the Earth government enters into a non-aggression treaty with the Centauri. While Keffer is in Hyperspace, he discovers a dangerous secret.

0105946.title: Matters of Honor
0105946.description: A small colony is attacked by the Shadows. It's the location of a Ranger training base, Marcus Cole goes to Babylon 5 to get help. Sheridan and Delenn embark on a mission to help the Rangers in the newly built White Star. Meanwhile Earth force sends a representative to find out more about the ship that destroyed Lt. Keffer.

0105946.title: Convictions
0105946.description: A mad bomber is loose on Babylon 5. When they find him, he threatens to detonate the station, if his demands are not met. Meanwhile G'Kar and Londo are trapped in an elevator. Londo wants to work together so they can escape, but G'Kar refuses to aide his nemesis.

0105946.title: A Day in the Strife
0105946.description: Sheridan and Ivanova deal with a dispute with the worker's guild. Then a probe arrives, and gives the station a test. If they pass, it promises to share advanced technology, if they fail the station will be destroyed in a few hours. Garibaldi talks to Franklin about his stim use-age.

0105946.title: Passing Through Gethsemane
0105946.description: Kosh's ship arrives at the station bearing a surprise visitor, Lyta Alexander returns after visiting the Vorlon home world. Brother Edward, a monk with Brother Theo visits with Delenn to discuss religion. Soon he begins to hear voices. They discover that Edward is experiencing repressed memories, someone is forcing him to relive past moments. Why would someone make a monk relive such horrors?

0105946.title: Voices of Authority
0105946.description: Sheridan has an interesting time dealing with the new Political Officer stationed by EarthGov and Ivonova visits the planet below Babylon 5 in search of the "first ones".

0105946.title: Dust to Dust
0105946.description: Bester returns to Babylon 5 to stop the flow of Dust, a powerful new drug which can temporarily unlock telepathic powers. But Captain Sheridan and the crew can't risk Bester reading their minds and uncovering their secret Shadow war preparations.

0105946.title: Exogenesis
0105946.description: Marcus and Franklin investigate a series of deaths caused by a mysterious parasite.

0105946.title: Messages from Earth
0105946.description: Sheridan discovers a terrifying new alliance between the Shadows and another race.

0105946.title: Point of No Return
0105946.description: Nightwatch takes control of Babylon 5 security. The widow of the former Centauri Emperor visits Londo, and gives Londo and Vir news of their future.

0105946.title: Severed Dreams
0105946.description: When President Clark escalates his brutal repression of the people of Earth Alliance, Captain Sheridan declares Babylon 5 independent.

0105946.title: Ceremonies of Light and Dark
0105946.description: After severing ties with Earth, the command staff must deal with some unexpected issues. Delenn suggests they go through a Minbari rebirth ceremony. Secrets are revealed, and hidden dangers are revealed as a group loyal to Clark takes Delenn hostage.

0105946.title: Sic Transit Vir
0105946.description: Vir returns to Babylon 5, and meets his fiancée'. As he and his bride to be get to know each other, a Narn attacks, and takes a blood oath to kill them. The command staff must figure out why someone would want to kill Vir.

0105946.title: A Late Delivery from Avalon
0105946.description: An impressive man in medieval armor arrives on the station, claiming to be King Arthur. Is he the genuine hero, sent by the Vorlons? If not, who is he and what are his secrets?

0105946.title: Ship of Tears
0105946.description: Bester arrives in a starfury. He wants their help in tracking down weapons, which turns out to be telepaths captured by the Shadows. They discover why the Shadows wanted telepaths for their war.

0105946.title: Interludes and Examinations
0105946.description: Garibaldi tries to get Franklin to face up to his stim usage. Londo waits anxiously for Adira to return. Morden returns first, and manipulates the situation to his advantage. The alliance asks Sheridan to prove he has forces equal to the Shadows before they will commit. Sheridan calls on Kosh for assistance, but Kosh is resistant at first, Kosh finally agrees to help Sheridan, and later pays the price for his involvement.

0105946.title: War Without End: Part One
0105946.description: Sinclair returns to Babylon 5 with a mission, going back in time to take Babylon 4 where it is most needed. This is a continuation of First Season's Babylon Squared. Many things about the past are explained. And some surprises about the future are revealed

0105946.title: War Without End: Part Two
0105946.description: The mission to send Babylon 4 where it's needed continues. Sinclair's destiny is revealed. Sheridan sees what will happen to Centauri Prime in the future. Zathras explains who the "One" is.

0105946.title: Walkabout
0105946.description: Kosh's replacement arrives and Dr. Franklin falls in love with a singer during his search.

0105946.title: Grey 17 Is Missing
0105946.description: With Sinclair gone, the Rangers need a new leader, and everyone looks to Delenn. But some in the warrior caste will not accept her in this new role, and seek a way to block her. Marcus must stop Neroon from interfering in the ceremony at any cost. Meanwhile Garibaldi investigates the death of a maintenance worker and a mysterious cult on a section that "vanished"

0105946.title: And the Rock Cried Out, No Hiding Place
0105946.description: Religious leaders gather on Babylon 5 bringing news of events on Earth. Sheridan and Delenn figure out where the Shadows will strike next. G'Kar is captured by Refa, this will lead to a final confrontation with Londo.

0105946.title: Shadow Dancing
0105946.description: Delenn asks the League for ships for a mission, she won't tell them where or when the mission will take place. The League hesitates, but they agree to support her. The fleet manages to prevent an attack by a Shadow Fleet. Franklin finally finds himself, and confronts his inner demons. An unexpected visitor from Sheridan's past arrives.

0105946.title: Z'ha'dum
0105946.description: Sheridan goes to Z'Ha'Dum, to try and prevent the fall of Centauri Prime, and end the Shadow War. Secrets are revealed, and Kosh's warning haunts Sheridan.

0105946.title: The Hour of the Wolf
0105946.description: After the destruction of Z'Ha'Dum, Sheridan: presumed dead, Garibaldi: missing and the fragile alliance against the Shadows is crumbling. Mollari faces the new Emperor, and B5 is in a holding pattern, waiting for the next shoe to drop.

0105946.title: Whatever Happened to Mr. Garibaldi?
0105946.description: G'Kar finds trouble while searching for Garibaldi. Sheridan hovers between life and death.

0105946.title: The Summoning
0105946.description: A mysterious spacecraft heads towards Babylon 5 as Ivanova and Marcus search for more First Ones to aid in the war.

0105946.title: Falling Toward Apotheosis
0105946.description: Refugees from worlds destroyed by the Vorlons descend on Babylon 5.

0105946.title: The Long Night
0105946.description: Sheridan schemes to lure the Shadows into open warfare with the Vorlons.

0105946.title: Into the Fire
0105946.description: Sheridan has managed to get the Vorlons and Shadows into one sector, where they are not attacking each other directly. He and Delenn lead a fleet into the sector where the source of the conflict is finally revealed, this is the end of the Shadow War.

0105946.title: Epiphanies
0105946.description: Earth prepares to shut down Babylon 5.

0105946.title: The Illusion of Truth
0105946.description: ISN reporters come to Babylon 5 to interview the Command staff, and film them for a documentary. The staff is reluctant at first, but they finally agree.

0105946.title: Atonement
0105946.description: While defending her love for Sheridan to the Minbaris, Delenn might be forced to expose an astounding secret.

0105946.title: Racing Mars
0105946.description: Sheridan clashes with Garibaldi. Franklin and Marcus encounter trouble near the Mars resistance camp.

0105946.title: Lines of Communication
0105946.description: Delenn meets the Drakhs for the first time.

0105946.title: Conflicts of Interest
0105946.description: Ivanova prepares for her first resistance broadcast.

0105946.title: Rumors, Bargains and Lies
0105946.description: Delenn meets with Neroon to discuss the war that's torn their planet apart. She proposes a plan but she'll need his support. Sheridan launches an eccentric plan involving misdirection, rumors, etc, to get the League to agree to a new role for the White Star Fleet.

0105946.title: Moments of Transition
0105946.description: The Minbari war between the warrior and the religious castes comes to an end, leading to the formation of a new Grey Council. Bester comes to Babylon 5 to make Lyta an offer. Clark's forces attack a transport convoy carrying thousands of civilians, prompting Sheridan to change strategies.

0105946.title: No Surrender, No Retreat
0105946.description: After Clark's order causes the death of civilians, Sheridan decides it's time to attack Clark's forces directly. First mission is a colony that's being oppressed by some Earth Cruisers. Some in Earth force also distrust Clark, Sheridan might find some allies, amongst those he might be fighting.

0105946.title: Exercise of Vital Powers
0105946.description: Garibaldi meets with his benefactor. He wants to join with Edgar Industries. But his employer wants proof of his commitment. He want Garibaldi's to bring in Sheridan. Meanwhile Franklin finally manages to temporarily revive a telepath that had been captured by the Shadows. He'll need Lyta's help to continue his research

0105946.title: The Face of the Enemy
0105946.description: Garibaldi sets up Sheridan who is promptly taken into custody by Clark's men. Garibaldi's behavior and what happened to him when he disappeared in his Starfury is revealed.

0105946.title: Intersections in Real Time
0105946.description: Sheridan has been captured. Now he's being tortured for information. How long can he hold out?

0105946.title: Between the Darkness and the Light
0105946.description: Garibaldi now freed of Bester's influence tries to find allies to free Sheridan. But no one trusts him, not even those who used to call him friend. Now Garbaldi, Franklin, and Lyta try to free Sheridan. Meanwhile Ivanova and Marcus find out Clark has new more powerful ships. They take a contingent of White stars to destroy the new ships, someone will pay a high price for the victory.

0105946.title: Endgame
0105946.description: The battle for Earth concludes as Sheridan leads his forces to Earth to confront Clark's forces in an all out battle. Meanwhile Marcus learns of the alien device Franklin used to heal Garibaldi when he was critically injured. But to save a person's life, someone else must die.

0105946.title: Rising Star
0105946.description: Earth is now free from Clark. Sheridan must now face the new President for his actions. He's forced to resign. Delenn, G'Kar, and Londo offer the Earth President a chance to join the newly formed Inter Stellar Alliance. Garibaldi searches for Lise. Ivanova revives and tries to deal with what her recovery cost someone else.

0105946.title: The Deconstruction of Falling Stars
0105946.description: In the distant future, a man exams key moments in history that have shaped the world. Starting with the formation of the Alliance that was formed on Babylon 5.

0105946.title: No Compromises
0105946.description: Captain Lochley arrives just as preparations are underway for Sheridan's swearing in ceremony as the President of the newly formed Interstellar Alliance. Telepaths arrive seeking a sanctuary while they search for a home world.

0105946.title: The Very Long Night of Londo Mollari
0105946.description: During a heart attack, Londo experiences an epiphany and apologizes to G'Kar.

0105946.title: The Paragon of Animals
0105946.description: Military crises threaten the ongoing formation of the InterStellar Alliance, but Sheridan asserts its power.

0105946.title: A View from the Gallery
0105946.description: A day in the life of 2 maintenance workers on Babylon 5. As crisis arises, they encounter the command staff, and the ambassadors each dealing with the crisis.

0105946.title: Learning Curve
0105946.description: Two Minbari Rangers-in-training come to the station and learn a difficult lesson. A new underworld boss tries to take control of Down-below.

0105946.title: Strange Relations
0105946.description: The secret of Sheridan and Lochley's past marriage is revealed.

0105946.title: Secrets of the Soul
0105946.description: A telepath is assaulted, and the others vow revenge.

0105946.title: Day of the Dead
0105946.description: It is the Brakiri Day of the Dead. They purchase a large section of the station for their holiday. That night everyone in that sector meets with people who have passed away. Most of the inhabitants of the sector are happy to see their loved ones, but Lennier's encounter leaves him with troubling news about his future.

0105946.title: In the Kingdom of the Blind
0105946.description: Byron and other telepaths seek a homeworld of their own.

0105946.title: A Tragedy of Telepaths
0105946.description: Lochley asks Bester for help in dealing with a group of telepaths who have locked themselves in an area of Downbelow.

0105946.title: The Ragged Edge
0105946.description: Garibaldi is sent to retrieve a witness to the shipping line attacks from the Drazi homeworld.

0105946.title: The Corps Is Mother, the Corps Is Father
0105946.description: A day in the life of Alfred Bester, who starts his day in Psi Corps HQ, where he is well liked and respected. He gets an assignment to track down a rogue telepath, two recruits accompany him. They follow the telepath's trail to Babylon 5, where he isn't as popular.

0105946.title: Meditations on the Abyss
0105946.description: Vir learns he is the new Centauri ambassador to Babylon 5.

0105946.title: Darkness Ascending
0105946.description: Sheridan finally discovers why Delenn had Lennier assigned to the White Star Fleet, and orders his ship to return. But Lennier takes his fighter and continues his mission, where he finally gets the information the Alliance needs. Lyta contacts G'Kar and reminds him of the offer he made to her in "The Gathering." She's willing to help the Narn in exchange for money to find a home world for telepaths.

0105946.title: And All My Dreams, Torn Asunder
0105946.description: The Alliance show the member worlds evidence of the Centauri actions, while Londo and Vir are in their room with copies of the evidence. Eventually they're let into the meeting, where they all see the evidence Lennier gathered. Sheridan comes up with a plan to peacefully enforce a blockade, but Garibaldi's issues jeopardize his plans.

0105946.title: Movements of Fire and Shadow
0105946.description: Londo and G'Kar return to Centauri Prime to figure out who in the government started the attacks, and are put in jail. G'Kar eventually figures a way for Londo to get out, and Londo tries to gather support. Garibaldi learns of two member worlds's plans to attack Centauri Prime. He informs Sheridan, who rushes off to try and stop the attack. Delenn and Lennier head back to Minbar to convince the council to build new ships, but are attacked in hyperspace. Lyta and Franklin find out what's been controlling the Centauri attack fleet.

0105946.title: The Fall of Centauri Prime
0105946.description: Centauri Prime has been attacked, thousands have died. Londo finds out the truth, who masterminded the war, and why they allowed the attack on Centauri Prime to happen. Londo becomes Emperor, and has to act hostile to those he once called "friend."

0105946.title: The Wheel of Fire
0105946.description: G'Kar returns to the station to find he has become a religious icon. Sheridan confronts Garibaldi about his drinking problems. Lyta is taken into custody for planning attacks on Psi Corps. Delenn collapses, and they find out she's pregnant.

0105946.title: Objects in Motion
0105946.description: Garibaldi and Lise are going to get married, he'll run her late husband's company. An assassin is hired to kill Lise. Zack has a plan to smoke him out, but another person wants G'Kar dead as well. Both attacks are prevented. Garibaldi deals with the people who ordered the hit on Lise. G'Kar and Lyta leave the station.

0105946.title: Objects at Rest
0105946.description: Garibaldi forms a new Board of Directors for his company. Ta'Lon becomes the new Narn ambassador. Sheridan and Delenn leave for Mimbar. An accident on board their White Star ship creates doubt/hesitation for Lennier, who fails to act appropriately. He leaves the ship, and tells Delenn he'll come back one day to atone for what he's done. Sheridan and Delenn are greeted by Londo on Mimbar who has a gift for them.

0105946.title: Sleeping in Light
0105946.description: 20 years after he visited Z'Ha'Dum, Sheridan knows his time is short and gathers his old comrades together. Afterwards he takes personalized White Star to Babylon 5 where it's going to be decommissioned shortly. The final leg of his journey takes him to Coriana 6 where they ended the Shadow War, and meets with one last person. The old command staff gather on Babylon 5 to watch its decommissioning.

0106145.title: Emissary
0106145.description: When the troubled Commander Sisko takes command of a surrendered space station, he learns that it borders a unique stable wormhole.

0106145.title: Past Prologue
0106145.description: Tahna Los, a former Bajoran terrorist during the Occupation, asks Sisko for asylum on DS9. Meanwhile, the station's last Cardassian inhabitant, Garak, possibly a former spy for the Cardassian government, proves an interesting mystery to Dr. Bashir.

0106145.title: A Man Alone
0106145.description: Ibudan, a criminal/murderer Odo has dealt with before, returns to DS9 only to be murdered shortly after. . .leaving Odo to be the prime suspect. Meanwhile, Jake and Nog's trouble making prompt Keiko to do something helpful for the station's children.

0106145.title: Babel
0106145.description: The crew and civilian population of Deep Space Nine begin to gabble when a plague, engineered by the Bajorans as a weapon against the Cardassians, accidentally gets released into the station's atmosphere.

0106145.title: Captive Pursuit
0106145.description: For the first time an alien comes from the other side of the wormhole. He has ship trouble and seems very reluctant to accept any help. Chief O'Brien quickly finds out he has a secret.

0106145.title: Q-Less
0106145.description: Q, the Enterprise-D's consistent omnipotent annoyance, comes to harass the DS9 crew when his traveling companion, Vash, refuses to travel with Q any longer.

0106145.title: Dax
0106145.description: Sins of the Host indeed, as Jadzia Dax is accused of a murder her previous host, Curzon, supposedly committed.

0106145.title: The Passenger
0106145.description: Rao Vantika, a captured criminal, is badly burned and dies in Bashir's arms. . .but the criminal's captor believes he is still alive.

0106145.title: Move Along Home
0106145.description: The Wadi from the Gamma Quadrant are to make first contact and decide to visit DS9. When they catch Quark cheating they let him off by playing a special game.

0106145.title: The Nagus
0106145.description: The Ferengi's greatest politician and leader, the Grand Nagus, comes to the station. He seems very interested in Quark's bar.

0106145.title: Vortex
0106145.description: A man named Croden tells Odo he can take him to a place where aliens much like Odo himself exist, which would help Odo find out where he truly comes from.

0106145.title: Battle Lines
0106145.description: After showing Bajoran spiritual leader Kai Opaka the wormhole, she, Sisko, Bashir and Kira crash land on a moon. Kai Opaka dies and the three meet the unfriendly locals.

0106145.title: The Storyteller
0106145.description: While Sisko tries to negotiate an agreement between two Bajoran factions, he orders O'Brien to escort Bashir to an emergency that endangers a village.

0106145.title: Progress
0106145.description: Kira must convince an old Bajoran farmer to leave a moon becoming uninhabitable due to mining operations. Jake and Nog try to trade off Cardassian yamok sauce.

0106145.title: If Wishes Were Horses
0106145.description: Dax investigates if an unusual energy reading is dangerous for the station when all of the sudden people's imaginations really come alive, causing chaos.

0106145.title: The Forsaken
0106145.description: Lwaxana Troi comes for a political visit and instead hounds Odo for romantic attention. Meanwhile, an alien probe wrecks havoc with the station's computer, leaving Odo and Lwaxana trapped together.

0106145.title: Dramatis Personae
0106145.description: Out of nowhere the entire station's command staff, save Odo, become power hungry and vie to defeat each other by forming secret alliances and plotting assassinations. Needless to say, Odo tries to figure out how this mysterious behavior was influenced.

0106145.title: Duet
0106145.description: A Cardassian suffering from Kalla-Nohra, a disease that indicates he served in a labor camp, visits DS9. Kira is determined to convict him as a war criminal.

0106145.title: In the Hands of the Prophets
0106145.description: Vedek Winn, a candidate in the race for the open Kai position, stirs up trouble on DS9 when she attempts to boycott Keiko's school for not teaching Bajoran religious beliefs.

0106145.title: The Homecoming
0106145.description: Word that a previously thought dead Bajoran resistance legend is still alive sends Kira and Chief O'Brien to Cardassia IV to rescue him; meanwhile "The Circle", a sect of the Bajoran provisional government that is intent on wiping out alien influence, is sneaking into power.

0106145.title: The Circle
0106145.description: Kira spends time with Vedek Bareil on Bajor just as "The Circle" begins arming themselves from a mysterious source.

0106145.title: The Siege
0106145.description: As a "Circle"-led Bajoran military tries to occupy the station, a skeleton crew led by Sisko fight to reveal "The Circle's" big secret before they are forced to evacuate themselves. Meanwhile, Kira and Dax lead a mission to reveal the truth about "The Circle" on Bajor.

0106145.title: Invasive Procedures
0106145.description: A jealous Trill, who had waited his entire life to receive a symbiont but never had, decides to steal one. . .Dax's!

0106145.title: Cardassians
0106145.description: Political heat rises on the station as Bajorans enter the station with orphaned Cardassians they have adopted.

0106145.title: Melora
0106145.description: A new arrival to the station with a special gravity-based disability appeals to Bashir's heart; meanwhile an old associate of Quark's comes to the station to kill the barkeep.

0106145.title: Rules of Acquisition
0106145.description: A female Ferengi, posing as a male to be available to participate in business (a rule STRICTLY forbidden by the Ferengi government), falls for Quark during very important negotiations between the Ferengi and a Gamma Quadrant race.

0106145.title: Necessary Evil
0106145.description: Odo relives some terrible and tragic memories of a past investigation when he was the constable on Cardassian-occupied Deep Space Nine, then named Terok Nor.

0106145.title: Second Sight
0106145.description: While noted scientist Gideon Seyetik is preparing for an ambitious project, re-igniting a star, Sisko is intrigued by a woman who keeps disappearing.

0106145.title: Sanctuary
0106145.description: A race that has been conquered twice over, one of the conquerors being the mysterious Dominion, comes to the station seeking aid and a new home.

0106145.title: Rivals
0106145.description: Quark meets his match when a new rival opens a casino opposite Quark's Bar on the Promenade; meanwhile the station is suffering issues of high improbability.

0106145.title: The Alternate
0106145.description: Odo and Dr. Mora Pol, Odo's 'father', discover a life form similar to Odo on a Gamma Quadrant planet.

0106145.title: Armageddon Game
0106145.description: Chief O'Brien, who still doesn't like the good Doctor Bashir, must rely on him when the two are stranded on a planet and O'Brien is infected with a deadly, fast moving disease.

0106145.title: Whispers
0106145.description: Chief O'Brien's world is turned upside down when for no reason whatsoever he is being ignored by his family and friends and is being closed out of every essential job on the station.

0106145.title: Paradise
0106145.description: Sisko and Chief O'Brien discover a colony that lives without technology.

0106145.title: Shadowplay
0106145.description: Odo and Dax investigate the mysterious disappearance of people from a village. Kira tries to keep a close eye on Quark, while Vedek Bareil unexpectedly visits.

0106145.title: Playing God
0106145.description: A Trill named Arjin comes to DS9 to learn what it is to be a Trill with a symbiont but finds his teacher, Dax, to be less than he expected.

0106145.title: Profit and Loss
0106145.description: A Cardassian woman, who was once a former flame of Quark's, visits the station under dubious circumstances.

0106145.title: Blood Oath
0106145.description: Three legendary Klingons come to DS9 to see if Jadzia Dax will participate in a Blood Oath they made with Jadzia's previous host Curzon.

0106145.title: The Maquis: Part 1
0106145.description: The destruction of a Cardassian ship leads Sisko, Dukat, and Sisko's old friend Cal Hudson to the fact that there is an unofficial war between the Maquis and the Cardassians.

0106145.title: The Maquis: Part 2
0106145.description: Sisko tries to resolve the Maquis crisis by preventing a war, freeing Gul Dukat and offering the defected Hudson the chance to return.

0106145.title: The Wire
0106145.description: Dr. Bashir fights to save Garak's life when a device implanted in his brain, designed to alleviate pain in the event of torture, begins to malfunction and is slowly killing him.

0106145.title: Crossover
0106145.description: Kira and Bashir find themselves in an alternate universe.

0106145.title: The Collaborator
0106145.description: Vedek Bareil is targeted by fellow Kai candidate Vedek Winn as having been a collaborator with the Cardassians during the Occupation.

0106145.title: Tribunal
0106145.description: Chief O'Brien goes through the horrific Cardassian judicial system when he is charged for an unknown crime.

0106145.title: The Jem'Hadar
0106145.description: Sisko and Quark and a strange telepathic woman are arrested by Jem'Hadar, soldiers of the Dominion.

0106145.title: The Search: Part 1
0106145.description: Instead of waiting for the Jem'Hadar to attack, Sisko wants to try a different approach. He wants to take a new class starship to try to find the Founders.

0106145.title: The Search: Part 2
0106145.description: Odo has found his home and is introduced. Meanwhile Sisko finds out peace talks between the Dominion and the Federation have already started.

0106145.title: The House of Quark
0106145.description: Quark is forced to marry a Klingon widow after he takes credit for the accidental death of her husband, the head of a powerful Klingon House.

0106145.title: Equilibrium
0106145.description: The Trill homeworld is the setting, as Sisko and Bashir take Jadzia home for treatment when she begins experiencing hallucinations after playing a tune she can't recall.

0106145.title: Second Skin
0106145.description: Kira finds herself on Cardassia as a Cardassian. She is told she is called Iliana Ghemor and was a Cardassian spy.

0106145.title: The Abandoned
0106145.description: Odo tries to change the nature of a Jem'Hadar boy that Quark finds, while Sisko tries to break his son's relationship with a 20 year old Dabo girl.

0106145.title: Civil Defense
0106145.description: The station goes into lockdown and the crew is endangered when an old Cardassian security program is accidentally activated.

0106145.title: Meridian
0106145.description: Dax falls in love with one of the residents of a multi-dimensional planet, while on DS9 an alien requests a holosuite program of Kira from Quark.

0106145.title: Defiant
0106145.description: Thomas Riker, impersonating Will Riker, steals the Defiant in order to fight with the Maquis. Sisko assist Gul Dukat on Cardassia Prime in stopping the ship entering Cardassian territory.

0106145.title: Fascination
0106145.description: As Lwaxanna Troi visits the station for a Bajoran festival, the crew is stricken with intense romantic attractions to one another.

0106145.title: Past Tense: Part 1
0106145.description: Sisko, Bashir and Dax are accidentally sent to San Francisco in the 21st century due to a transporter malfunction, and must figure out how to get back to return without changing the time line.

0106145.title: Past Tense: Part 2
0106145.description: Sisko is forced to take the place of a key historical figure on Earth in 2024 in order to preserve the timeline.

0106145.title: Life Support
0106145.description: Dr. Bashir must use extraordinary measures to prolong Vedek Bareil's life long enough to allow Bareil to complete sensitive peace negotiations between the Bajorans and the Cardassians.

0106145.title: Heart of Stone
0106145.description: After chasing a fugitive into a cave, Kira gets stuck and is slowly encapsulated by a growing crystal stone while Odo tries to figure out how to free her.

0106145.title: Destiny
0106145.description: Sisko faces a conflict between his Starfleet duties and his role as the Bajoran Emissary when an ancient Bajoran prophecy predicts that a joint Federation-Cardassian project will lead to the destruction of the wormhole.

0106145.title: Prophet Motive
0106145.description: Grand Nagus Zek is acting bizarre by giving away money and rewriting the Rules of Acquisition. Quark attempts to get the old Nagus back.

0106145.title: Visionary
0106145.description: While a Romulan delegation tries to get information about the Dominion, O'Brien gets visions of unpleasant things that are about to happen in the future.

0106145.title: Distant Voices
0106145.description: After being attacked in the infirmary, Dr. Bashir has a dual mystery on his hands: what has happened to the station while he was out and why is he aging so rapidly now?

0106145.title: Through the Looking Glass
0106145.description: Sisko is kidnapped to impersonate his deceased, mirror universe self to gain Jennifer Sisko's loyalty in the Rebel Alliance.

0106145.title: Improbable Cause
0106145.description: After an attempt is made on Garak's life, Odo conducts the investigation on who tried to murder the Cardassian tailor - and why.

0106145.title: The Die Is Cast
0106145.description: Now rejoined with his former mentor, Garak is ordered to interrogate Odo about the secrets of his people, while the joined Romulan/Cardassian attack fleet moves towards the Founders' home world on a mission of destruction.

0106145.title: Explorers
0106145.description: Sisko rebuilds an ancient Bajoran space vessel from the blueprints, and he and Jake take the ship on a trip, attempting to prove that the ancient Bajorans went beyond their solar system without warp drive.

0106145.title: Family Business
0106145.description: Quark and Rom return to the Ferengi home world because their mother has broken the law - by wearing clothes and earning profits, forbidden for women in Ferengi society.

0106145.title: Shakaar
0106145.description: News arrives that Kai Winn has also become Bajor's political leader. She asks Kira to negotiate with an old resistance friend about returning soil reclamators.

0106145.title: Facets
0106145.description: Dax asks the crew to join her Zhian'tara ritual. The memories of her former hosts will take over their bodies. Nog is preparing for Starfleet Academy.

0106145.title: The Adversary
0106145.description: The Defiant is off to show the Federation's presence to the new Tzenkethi government. While underway the ship malfunctions and Bashir is suspected of sabotage.

0106145.title: The Way of the Warrior
0106145.description: Sisko becomes uncomfortable when the Klingons station a task force to help defend against the Dominion. Worf is summoned to find out their true intentions.

0106145.title: The Visitor
0106145.description: Melanie, an aspiring writer, wants to know why Jake Sisko stopped writing at 40. Jake tells how his father died in an accident and then suddenly reappeared.

0106145.title: Hippocratic Oath
0106145.description: Bashir is asked to help a group of renegade Jem'Hadar break their addiction to ketracel white. Meanwhile Worf is dissatisfied with the way Odo runs security.

0106145.title: Indiscretion
0106145.description: Kira and Gul Dukat go after the lost prison ship Ravinok. Dukat has a secret. Meanwhile Kasidy Yates tries to find work near Bajor, leaving Sisko uncomfortable.

0106145.title: Rejoined
0106145.description: Lenara Kahn, the new host of the wife of Dax's former host Torias, comes to the station. While they're not allowed to renew their relation, there's still a spark.

0106145.title: Starship Down
0106145.description: A damaged Defiant must play a dangerous game of cat-and-mouse with two Jem'hadar ships inside a gas giant.

0106145.title: Little Green Men
0106145.description: Quark and Rom take Nog to Earth and Starfleet Academy, but a malfunction with the ship takes the crew back in time, to Roswell New Mexico in 1947.

0106145.title: The Sword of Kahless
0106145.description: Worf, Dax and the Klingon Dahar master Kor set out to find an ancient lost relic: the Sword of Kahless.

0106145.title: Our Man Bashir
0106145.description: When an transporter emergency turns the command crew into holosuite characters, Bashir's James Bond fantasy takes on a deadly reality.

0106145.title: Homefront
0106145.description: Sisko travels to Earth when a bombing at a Federation conference is determined to be the work of Changelings.

0106145.title: Paradise Lost
0106145.description: When Starfleet institutes martial law to combat the Changeling Menace, Sisko begins to question if the Dominion is the real threat.

0106145.title: Crossfire
0106145.description: First Minister Shakaar visits the station, despite a threat of assassination. He falls in love with Kira much to Odo's dismay.

0106145.title: Return to Grace
0106145.description: Dukat returns, stripped of his prestige, to escort Kira to a Cardassian conference about the Dominion. But an attack by a Klingon raider may give Dukat a chance to redeem himself in the eyes of his government.

0106145.title: Sons of Mogh
0106145.description: Worf's brother Kurn asks him to perform a death rite to regain his lost honor. Meanwhile Kira and O'Brien investigate Klingon activity near the Bajoran border.

0106145.title: Bar Association
0106145.description: Unfair working conditions and pay cuts cause Rom to organize a union of the employees of Quark's Bar. Meanwhile Worf still finds it hard to settle on the station.

0106145.title: Accession
0106145.description: A man claiming to be the emissary comes through the wormhole. Sisko is happy to give up his position. Meanwhile Keiko returns and O'Brien stops spending time with Bashir.

0106145.title: Rules of Engagement
0106145.description: When Worf destroys a civilian shuttle during an engagement with the Klingons, an extradition hearing is held to see if he must face charges.

0106145.title: Hard Time
0106145.description: O'Brien tries to re-integrate to life on the station after serving 20 years in a virtual prison.

0106145.title: Shattered Mirror
0106145.description: When the Mirror Universe counterpart of Sisko's deceased wife lures Jake to the other side, Sisko must follow and help the human resistance against the Alliance's forces.

0106145.title: The Muse
0106145.description: A mysterious woman approaches Jake about his future as a writer. Odo promises to do whatever it takes to help Lwaxana Troi keep her baby over the father's wishes - even if it means marrying her himself.

0106145.title: For the Cause
0106145.description: Sisko must face betrayal when evidence surfaces that Kasidy is smuggling for the Maquis. Meanwhile Garak makes acquaintance with Ziyal.

0106145.title: To the Death
0106145.description: A renegade group of Jem'Hadar plunders Deep Space Nine. Sisko agrees to a combat operation with loyal Jem'Hadar to prevent the renegades completing a planetary gateway.

0106145.title: The Quickening
0106145.description: Bashir tries to help a planet in the grips of a Dominion-engineered plague that guarantees a painful death.

0106145.title: Body Parts
0106145.description: Quarks hears on Ferenginar he is going to die. Rom convinces him to sell his remains. After an accident, Bashir has to move Keiko's baby to Kira's womb.

0106145.title: Broken Link
0106145.description: Odo is suddenly struck by illness. He is barely able to hold shape. Bashir and Odo see no other alternative then going to the Founders. Garak wants to come along.

0106145.title: Apocalypse Rising
0106145.description: With the war between Klingons and Federation intensifying, Sisko must make a plan to expose Gowron as a changeling. Odo is still having trouble with becoming a solid.

0106145.title: The Ship
0106145.description: The crew is forced to retreat in a crashed Jem'Hadar ship after an attack by the Jem'Hadar. They get the feeling there's something very important about this ship.

0106145.title: Looking for par'Mach in All the Wrong Places
0106145.description: While Worf helps Quark to pursue his former wife Grilka, O'Brien and Kira grow uncomfortably close to each other.

0106145.title: ...Nor the Battle to the Strong
0106145.description: Jake, reporting from the front lines, sees what war truly is.

0106145.title: The Assignment
0106145.description: An alien entity has possessed Keiko's body and is holding it hostage until O'Brien completes an assignment for it.

0106145.title: Trials and Tribble-ations
0106145.description: Darvin, a disgraced Klingon spy, travels back in time to alter some events to his likings. The DS9 crew must find what he's trying to change and prevent it without altering the time line. They'll have to blend in with the crew from Star Trek: The Original Series.

0106145.title: Let He Who Is Without Sin...
0106145.description: While vacationing on Risa, Worf and Dax meet a group of fundamentalist protesters who claim that the Federation has gone soft.

0106145.title: Things Past
0106145.description: Sisko, Dax, Odo and Garak find themselves in the past when the Cardassians controlled the station, and a crime that Odo investigated may be the key.

0106145.title: The Ascent
0106145.description: When Odo and Quark crash land, they must put aside their differences to climb a mountain to signal for help. Jake and Nog try to be roommates, but their different styles clash.

0106145.title: Rapture
0106145.description: Sisko begins having visions that may show him how to best help Bajor, but they're killing him.

0106145.title: The Darkness and the Light
0106145.description: A mysterious assassin begins wiping out all the members of Kira's old resistance cell.

0106145.title: The Begotten
0106145.description: The discovery of an infant Changeling gives Odo a chance to correct what he sees as the "mistakes" in his upbringing. But as Starfleet's pressure for results grows, he has to turn to his "father," Dr. Mora

0106145.title: For the Uniform
0106145.description: When the traitorous Eddington returns, Sisko will go to any lengths to capture him.

0106145.title: In Purgatory's Shadow
0106145.description: A coded message from the Gamma Quadrant leads Garak to believe his mentor, Enabran Tain, is still alive. He and Worf seek him out, only to discover something much worse: a Dominion invasion fleet poised to attack the Alpha Quadrant.

0106145.title: By Inferno's Light
0106145.description: The station readies for a Dominion attack. Worf and Garak meet some unexpected friends in a Dominion Prison camp.

0106145.title: Doctor Bashir, I Presume?
0106145.description: Dr. Bashir is selected to be the model for the next-generation of Emergency Medical Hologram (EMH). But he balks when his parents are invited to the station to be interviewed by the EMH programmer, Dr. Zimmerman. There is a dark secret in his family that he's afraid that his parents will reveal.

0106145.title: A Simple Investigation
0106145.description: Odo becomes romantically attached to a woman working with the Orion Syndicate.

0106145.title: Business as Usual
0106145.description: Quark must wrestle with his conscience when he becomes involved with arms merchants.

0106145.title: Ties of Blood and Water
0106145.description: When a Cardassian official that thinks of Kira as his daughter is dying, he agrees to reveal all he knows to her. But the experience dredges up Kira's memories of her own father's death.

0106145.title: Ferengi Love Songs
0106145.description: Quark doesn't know whether to be panicked or overjoyed when he learns that his mother is the new lover of the Grand Nagus.

0106145.title: Soldiers of the Empire
0106145.description: Dax and Worf accompany Martok on his first command since being held by the Dominion. But the ship they are given hasn't seen victory in months and the crew is near mutinous.

0106145.title: Children of Time
0106145.description: The DS9 cast discovers a small colony on a remote world that was originally populated by them 200 years earlier due to a time-travel accident with the Defiant. The current colonists lives depend on making sure that accident happens again, even though they've now forwarned the crew that it will happen. Each crew member needs to decide if they are willing to give up their lives on DS9 in order to preserve the history of the colony.

0106145.title: Blaze of Glory
0106145.description: Driven to desperation by the Dominion, the Maquis launch a massive bio-weapons strike towards Cardassia. Sisko must trust the traitor Eddington to try to stop them.

0106145.title: Empok Nor
0106145.description: While salvaging components from DS9's sister station, the crew run afoul of a "surprise" left behind by the Cardassians.

0106145.title: In the Cards
0106145.description: Jake and Nog go through hell and high water, from participating in an auction to dealing with the Dominion, to receiving a Willie Mays baseball card to cheer up the war-fatigued Captain Sisko.

0106145.title: Call to Arms
0106145.description: With the continuing battalions of Jem'Hadar entering the Alpha Quadrant in preparation for war, Sisko decides to mine the wormhole to prevent further troop movement. This provokes a confrontation between the Dominion and the Federation, forcing Sisko to abandon DS9.

0106145.title: A Time to Stand
0106145.description: Borrowing a captured Jem'Hadar attack ship, Sisko and crew embark on a mission to destroy the hidden base where all of the ketracel-white is stored for the entire Alpha Quadrant.

0106145.title: Rocks and Shoals
0106145.description: Sisko and his crew crash on a barren world when their commandeered Jem'Hadar ship is shot down. They encounter Jem'Hadar who crashed there earlier, and have taken Nog and Garak hostage in exchange for medical aid for their Vorta overseer.

0106145.title: Sons and Daughters
0106145.description: Serving with his recruit son aboard a Klingon vessel, Worf finds his relationship with his son strained. Meanwhile, strained relationships abound on DS9 between Major Kira and Gul Dukat.

0106145.title: Behind the Lines
0106145.description: After forming an attack plan on the Dominion, Sisko relinquishes command of the Defiant to Dax after accepting a promotion. On DS9, the resistance faces discovery when Odo links with another changeling.

0106145.title: Favor the Bold
0106145.description: Sisko mounts an attack to re-take DS9, while Rom faces charges as an enemy of the Dominion state.

0106145.title: Sacrifice of Angels
0106145.description: The Federation attacks DS9 in hopes of keeping the mine field in the wormhole intact, while the Dominion waits entrance to the Alpha Quadrant from the other side.

0106145.title: You Are Cordially Invited...
0106145.description: Suddenly desiring to wed within the week on DS9, Worf and Jadzia go through their own Klingon rituals: Worf on a four day bachelor party with the male members of the crew & Jadzia deals with her prospective mother-in-law, who totally opposes the idea of "an alien" marrying into her Klingon household.

0106145.title: Resurrection
0106145.description: Major Kira takes a romantic interest in a Bajoran radical from the other universe who transports himself into her universe and onto DS9.

0106145.title: Statistical Probabilities
0106145.description: A group of genetically engineered humans are brought to Dr. Bashir on DS9 in hopes of integrating them with the rest of the universe.

0106145.title: The Magnificent Ferengi
0106145.description: At the request of the Grand Nagus, Quark puts together a mission to rescue Quark's mother, who is in the hands of the Dominion.

0106145.title: Waltz
0106145.description: After being attacked by Cardassian forces, Sisko gets stranded with a very psychotic Gul Dukat, who was being transported to his trial. Meanwhile the crew of the Defiant races to rescue survivors.

0106145.title: Who Mourns for Morn?
0106145.description: A former patron of Quark's bequeaths everything to him.

0106145.title: Far Beyond the Stars
0106145.description: Captain Sisko has a full sensory vision of himself as an under-appreciated science fiction magazine writer in 1950s America.

0106145.title: One Little Ship
0106145.description: An attack by the Dominion on Sisko's ship endangers Dax and her crew aboard as she leads them into an anomaly that shrinks them to a very minute size. Unfortunately, they were being held stable by Sisko within a tractor beam, which was discontinued during the attack.

0106145.title: Honor Among Thieves
0106145.description: Chief O'Brien goes undercover to infiltrate an Orion crime ring.

0106145.title: Change of Heart
0106145.description: Worf and Jadzia travel to the badlands to procure some information on the Dominion from a traitorous Cardassian. Bashir wants to engage in a holo-suite spy simulation, but O'brian prefers to brush up on his tongo game after watching Jadzia lose to Quark.

0106145.title: Wrongs Darker Than Death or Night
0106145.description: After receiving some disturbing information for Gul Dukat, Major Kira seeks Sisko's approval as Emissary to travel back in time to find out the truth about her mother. Meanwhile, Chief O'Brien and Dr. Bashir discuss a holosuite program surrounding the Battle of the Alamo.

0106145.title: Inquisition
0106145.description: Dr. Bashir's plans to attend a medical conference at a breezy resort are canceled when Starfleet Intelligence boards DS9, suspecting the doctor of treason.

0106145.title: In the Pale Moonlight
0106145.description: To save the Federation in a critical scheme, Sisko comes to realize that he must violate its fundamental principles to do so.

0106145.title: His Way
0106145.description: Odo is schooled in the ways of romance by a holographic programmed lounge singer.

0106145.title: The Reckoning
0106145.description: Spiritualists on Bajor summon Captain Sisko to the planet surface, where they show him a stone tablet with some unknown inscriptions. Once on DS9, the inscription reveals an ancient prophecy of coming disasters surrounding the wormhole, Bajor, and DS9, as those around him voice their uneasiness about Sisko being an Emissary for the planet.

0106145.title: Valiant
0106145.description: Jake and Nog's runabout come under attack from the Jem'Hadar, and are rescued by the Valiant, a ship manned by Red Squad, a elite group of young Starfleet cadets.

0106145.title: Profit and Lace
0106145.description: Quark's mother and the Grand Nagus show up on DS9, announcing a new amendment to the Bill of Opportunities he has instituted on the home planet of Ferenganar, and then follows up with the announcement, that, due to the new amendment, chaos has followed and he has been deposed.

0106145.title: Time's Orphan
0106145.description: The Chief's daughter gets caught in a time displacement and when they get her back, she is considerably older.

0106145.title: The Sound of Her Voice
0106145.description: As the Defiant races to a shipwrecked officer who is days away, the crew keeps in contact with her. Meanwhile, Jake follows Quark's latest scheme for story research.

0106145.title: Tears of the Prophets
0106145.description: When Sisko is picked to head up an attack on the Cardassian homeworld, the Prophets appear to him in a vision, warning him of impending doom if he leaves the station.

0106145.title: Image in the Sand
0106145.description: Having returned to Earth a couple of months ago, Sisko waits for the Prophets to instruct him on what to do next. When he receives one, he begins searching for the woman behind the face in the sand in his vision. Meanwhile, back on DS9, Kira deals with a promotion and handling the decisions surrounding her command, and finding herself wishing for the return of Sisko. And Worf deals with the loss of his wife, Jadzia Dax.

0106145.title: Shadows and Symbols
0106145.description: Ezri joins Sisko and his family on his quest for the Orb of the Emissary. Colonel Kira mounts a blockade around a Bajoran moon where the Romulan alliance has deposited an ammunitions dump, claiming it in the name of defense for a Romulan hospital. And Quark joins the rest of the DS9 crew as they join Worf aboard a Klingon warship as they mount a dangerous mission in Jadzia Dax's name in an effort to get her spirit into Stovokohr, the Klingon equivalent of Heaven.

0106145.title: Afterimage
0106145.description: Sisko tries to convince Ezri to stay in Starfleet and serve aboard DS9, as Ezri tries to get to know Jadzia's friends aboard the station, especially Worf. Meanwhile, Garak tries to deal with a severe bout of claustrophobia.

0106145.title: Take Me Out to the Holosuite
0106145.description: A Vulcan captain challenges Sisko to a game of baseball.

0106145.title: Chrysalis
0106145.description: Dr. Bashir attempts to bring one of his genetically engineered friends out of the catatonic state she is in, and when he is successful, he begins to fall for her.

0106145.title: Treachery, Faith, and the Great River
0106145.description: A Vorta offers Odo valuable information on the Dominion in exchange for asylum. Meanwhile, Nog tries his Ferengi knowledge as he wheels and deals for a valuable piece of equipment for Chief O'Brien.

0106145.title: Once More Unto the Breach
0106145.description: An aged Kor requests an opportunity to die with honor as a warrior.

0106145.title: The Siege of AR-558
0106145.description: Capt. Sisko and his away team volunteer to stay with a besieged unit at an isolate outpost.

0106145.title: Covenant
0106145.description: Kira is kidnapped and taken to Empok Nor by a member of a Pah'Wraith cult and discovers the group leader is Gul Dukat.

0106145.title: It's Only a Paper Moon
0106145.description: Severely depressed at his serious war wound, Nog retreats into Vic Fontaine's holosuite program while the singer tries to help him.

0106145.title: Prodigal Daughter
0106145.description: Ezri travels to her family home in search of Chief O'Brien who has discovered a murdered woman connected with the family and the Orion Syndicate.

0106145.title: The Emperor's New Cloak
0106145.description: Quark and Rom have to rescue Grand Nagus Zek who is being held captive in the Alternate Universe.

0106145.title: Field of Fire
0106145.description: Find an apparently untraceable murderer, Ezri Dax reluctantly calls up the residual consciousness remnant of her symbiont's past hidden psychopathic murderer host, Joran.

0106145.title: Chimera
0106145.description: After searching out and finding Odo, another changeling asks him to leave DS9 with him, even though the rest of the crew aren't convinced the new changeling is not part of the Founders.

0106145.title: Badda-Bing, Badda-Bang
0106145.description: When a programming glitch won't go away, mobsters take over Vic's and open for business, but the DS9 gang takes it personal when their favorite hangout is no longer their favorite, and they plan to get the new management ousted.

0106145.title: Inter Arma Enim Silent Leges
0106145.description: While making plans to attend a medical conference on the Romulan home world, Dr. Bashir is contacted by Sloane of Section 31 and recruited to determine the health of a high-ranking Romulan official. Things turn more desperate, though, when the ranking Starfleet admiral traveling with him, who knows about Section 31's interest in the conference mysteriously suffers a brain aneurysm after Dr. Bashir finds out that Sloane is traveling with the group, as well.

0106145.title: Penumbra
0106145.description: When the ship Worf was serving on is attacked in battle and all search efforts are abandoned, Ezri takes a runabout in search of him against Sisko's orders. Meanwhile, Sisko proposes to Cassidy Yates.

0106145.title: 'Til Death Do Us Part
0106145.description: The Prophets have told Sisko that they do not agree with his impending marriage. Ezri and Worf are captured by Dominion forces. Some of the Cardassians are beginning to regret their alliance with the Dominion, as Gul Dukat, disguised as a Bajoran, sets foot on DS9.

0106145.title: Strange Bedfellows
0106145.description: Kai Winn gets unknowingly involved with Gul Dukat, disguised as a Bajoran. Tensions further escalate between Weyoun and Gul Damar as the Dominion gather to sign a peace treaty with the Breen, including certain concessions of unknown territories by the Cardassians, as Ezri and Worf try to escape the Cardassian home world.

0106145.title: The Changing Face of Evil
0106145.description: After the Breen attack Earth, mixed emotions abound on DS9. Having revealed her secret regarding the Prophets to Dukat, Kai Winn turns her back on them, only to be convinced by Dukat to embrace the Pah Wraiths. And on the home world of Cardassia, Legate Damar mounts a resistance to the Dominion.

0106145.title: When It Rains...
