John Locke is intrigued with the words of Henry about the unnecessary use of the computer. Is Henry playing him for a fool? Elsewhere, ...

0411008.title: Two for the Road
0411008.description: Jack and Kate bring an exhausted Michael back to camp where he has news about "The Others". Meanwhile, Ana Lucia attempts to get the prisoner, Henry Gale to confess to being a spy for the Others, and he attempts to kill her. Also, Hurley plans a surprise date for Libby.

Mr. Eko enlists Locke to help find a secret location he believes houses answers to the island's mysteries. Meanwhile, Jack, Sawyer, and Kate struggle to cope with the horrific situation in the hatch following the escape of "Other" Henry Gale, and of the shooting deaths of Ana-Lucia and Libby, unaware that it was Michael who is responsible.

0411008.title: Three Minutes
0411008.description: Michael's whereabouts during his 13 days in captivity in the "Others" camp are detailed while in the present, he tries to convince Jack to help him mount a search party for his son Walt still being held captive. Meanwhile, Locke struggles with a choice whether or not to abandon the hatch.

0411008.title: Live Together, Die Alone
0411008.description: After discovering a sailboat just offshore containing former hatch oversee Desmond, Jack and Sayid come up with a plan to confront "The Others" and hopefully get Walt back. Meanwhile, Eko and Locke come to blows as Locke makes a potentially cataclysmic decision regarding the "button" and the hatch.

0411008.title: A Tale of Two Cities
0411008.description: Now prisoners of "The Others," head games begin for Jack, Kate, and Sawyer.

0411008.title: The Glass Ballerina
0411008.description: Sayid's attempt to rescue Jack, Kate and Sawyer from the others jeopardizes Sun and Jin's lives.

0411008.title: Further Instructions
0411008.description: Locke experiences visions of Boone, leading him to a new mystery on the island.

0411008.title: Every Man for Himself
0411008.description: The Others perform a sadistic medical procedure on Sawyer in order to prevent him from causing any more mischief.

0411008.title: The Cost of Living
0411008.description: After Mr. Eko has a vision of his dead brother, he sets out to return to the site of his plane crash.

0411008.title: I Do
0411008.description: Kate desperately tries to protect Sawyer from being killed by The Others. But at the same time, The Others plan to use her as a pawn on Jack to get him to perform surgery on Ben.

0411008.title: Not in Portland
0411008.description: Sawyer and Kate struggle to escape the island while Jack sabotages Ben's surgery, and Juliet's plan to make a deal with Jack to kill Ben on the operating table is exposed.

0411008.title: Flashes Before Your Eyes
0411008.description: After Desmond saves Claire from drowning, Charlie and Hurley suspect that he can see the future. So they try to get him drunk to get some answers out of him.

0411008.title: Stranger in a Strange Land
0411008.description: Sawyer, Kate, and Karl reach their Island at night, and a reluctant Kate wishes to return for Jack. Meanwhile, Jack is interrogated by "Others" constable, Isabel about the incident with Juliet. When she mentions the meaning of his tattoo, he recalls his vacation in the paradisaical island of Phuket, in Thailand, where he dated the sexy, mystic, and mysterious local Achara. Ben has an infection in his spinal column, and Jack negotiates the freedom of Juliet, who was going to be sentenced to death for Pickett's murder. Later Jack recalls what happened to him when he ...

0411008.title: Tricia Tanaka Is Dead
0411008.description: Having returned to camp, Sawyer's help is enlisted by Hugo, who has an obsession with retrieving an old VW van found on the island. More events in Hugo's life are also revealed, showing what brought him to be on the doomed flight.

0411008.title: Enter 77
0411008.description: Sayid, John and Kate find another Dharma station on their way to rescue Jack. In the meantime Sawyer tries to get his stuff back in the camp.

0411008.title: Par Avion
0411008.description: Claire launches a plan to use migratory birds to send a message, but she doesn't understand why Desmond keeps sabotaging it. Elsewhere on the island, Sayid, Locke and Kate scale The Others' protective perimeter and discover their camp.

0411008.title: The Man from Tallahassee
0411008.description: Jack tells Kate that he has made a deal with The Others and is leaving via submarine tomorrow. But Locke blows up the submarine before Jack can leave, after having a long conversation with Ben about the island's powers.

0411008.title: Exposé
0411008.description: Nikki and Paulo are two more of the castaways with a past just like any of the others. What have they been doing since the plane crash?

0411008.title: Left Behind
0411008.description: With their secret location now compromised, The Others abandon camp and take Locke with them. But they also leave Juliet behind, handcuffed to Kate in the middle of the jungle.

0411008.title: One of Us
0411008.description: Jack takes Juliet back to their camp after being abandoned by The Others. However, nobody else at the camp trusts her or wants her there, until she saves Claire's life.

0411008.title: Catch-22
0411008.description: Desmond's latest fragmented vision suggests that his old girlfriend, Penny, will crash-land onto the island. Desmond organizes a posse of himself, Hurley, Jin, and Charlie to come along with him into the jungle expecting Penny to parachute onto the island. But the vision also suggests that Charlie will die by stumbling upon a trip-wire if he comes along with them. But Desmond insists that Charlie must come along to make the vision come true. Meanwhile, Desmond recalls his days in a monastery in Scotland over 10 years earlier after leaving his old fiancée, Ruth, a few ...

0411008.title: D.O.C.
0411008.description: An unlikely person helps Desmond save the life of the mysterious woman who crashed onto the island, and Juliet helps Sun find out whether she conceived on the island or before the plane crash.

0411008.title: The Brig
0411008.description: Locke tells Sawyer that he needs to come with him to kill Ben. But the man Locke wants him to kill is actually his father--who also happens to be a figure from Sawyer's past.

0411008.title: The Man Behind the Curtain
0411008.description: As Ben takes Locke to see Jacob and reveal the island's secrets, Ben's background on the island is exposed--as well as what happened to the Dharma Initiative.

0411008.title: Greatest Hits
0411008.description: Desmond has another vision of Charlie's death, but this time his death ultimately will result in Claire's rescue. Meanwhile, the survivors discover that an attack by the others is even more imminent than originally expected.

0411008.title: Through the Looking Glass
0411008.description: Jack and the survivors wait for Charlie to turn off The Others' signal-jamming device, not knowing that he has been captured at the Looking Glass station. In addition, Sayid, Jin and Bernard are captured after The Others invade the camp.

0411008.title: The Beginning of the End
0411008.description: Charlie's dying message casts doubt on the intentions of the people that Jack believes to be their rescuers. A power struggle ensues between Jack, who wants to leave the island, and Locke, who thinks that they're supposed to stay.

0411008.title: Confirmed Dead
0411008.description: The surviving members of the supposed "rescue team" are scattered around the island after a helicopter problem. However, once they are located, they reluctantly reveal that they are indeed not there to rescue them.

0411008.title: The Economist
0411008.description: Sayid negotiates a deal with Locke to hand over Charlotte from the "rescue team," so that he can get on their helicopter and reach their ship. Kate joins Sayid for the mission, but she decides to stay behind with Sawyer.

0411008.title: Eggtown
0411008.description: Kate goes behind Locke's back to arrange a meeting between Miles and Ben, where Miles offers his terms for not giving Ben up to his colleagues. However, Locke discovers what she has done, and banishes her from his camp.

0411008.title: The Constant
0411008.description: During the helicopter ride to the ship, Desmond's consciousness begins jumping back and forth between present day 2004 and 1996. He is forced to find Daniel Faraday in 1996 in order to get answers and stop the jumps.

0411008.title: The Other Woman
0411008.description: Daniel and Charlotte leave Jack's camp to fulfill their objective, and Jack and Juliet try to track them down before they are successful. Juliet's romantic history on the island with The Others is exposed.

0411008.title: Ji Yeon
0411008.description: Juliet exposes Sun's pre-island affair to Jin so that they won't defect to Locke's camp. Sayid and Desmond meet the ship's captain and discover that Michael is working on the boat.

0411008.title: Meet Kevin Johnson
0411008.description: Michael's journey from escaping the island to working as Ben's spy on Widmore's ship is revealed, as well as his mission. Ben tells Danielle and Alex to leave Locke's camp and go to the island temple, but they are ambushed on the way.

0411008.title: The Shape of Things to Come
0411008.description: The team from the ship attacks Locke's camp looking for Ben, with Alex as a hostage. Meanwhile, the doctor from the ship washes up on shore at Jack's camp, and Daniel Faraday provides some distressing news to Jack.

0411008.title: Something Nice Back Home
0411008.description: Juliet is forced to perform an emergency appendectomy on Jack, Jack's post-rescue relationship with Kate is revealed, and Sawyer, Claire, and Aaron head back to Jack's camp with Miles.

0411008.title: Cabin Fever
0411008.description: Locke, Ben, and Hurley continue their search for the cabin so that Locke can talk to Jacob. Back on the boat, Keamy prepares to take off again, this time for a all-out assault on the island.

0411008.title: There's No Place Like Home: Part 1
0411008.description: Ben, Locke, and Hurley go to The Orchid, but Keamy and his men beat them there. Jack and Kate go after the helicopter, and are later joined by Sawyer. Sayid comes back to the island with a rescue boat, and then goes after them too.

0411008.title: There's No Place Like Home: Part 2
0411008.description: Ben tries to escape Keamy's custody so that he and Locke can follow through with Jacob's request to move the island. Michael tries to neutralize the explosives on the boat, while the "Oceanic 6" move closer to rescue.

0411008.title: There's No Place Like Home: Part 3
0411008.description: In the season finale, the Oceanic Six find themselves closer to rescue.

0411008.title: Because You Left
0411008.description: As a result of Ben moving the island, the survivors left on the island begin skipping through time. Meanwhile, three years later in Los Angeles, Ben starts convincing the Oceanic 6 to return to the island.

0411008.title: The Lie
0411008.description: While Ben and Jack try to round the Oceanic 6 up, Sayid and Hurley are on the run from the law. Meanwhile, back on the island, the survivors, still skipping through time, come under attack.

0411008.title: Jughead
0411008.description: Desmond returns to Oxford to fulfill Faraday's request to find his mother. Back on the island, the survivors discover that they've run into The Others 50 years in the past, but Richard Alpert is the same age.

0411008.title: The Little Prince
0411008.description: In Los Angeles, Kate tries to find out who is trying to take Aaron away from her. Back on the island, Locke convinces everyone that they have to go to The Orchid.

0411008.title: This Place Is Death
0411008.description: In order to avoid being killed, Ben promises to offer proof to Sun that Jin is still alive. On the island, Jin meets up with the survivors as Locke reaches The Orchid and fulfills his mission.
Eloise explains that the Oceanic 6 have a very limited window to return to the island, and leaves Jack instructions to bring one of his father's items to John Locke.

0411008.title: The Life and Death of Jeremy Bentham
0411008.description: John Locke, now alive again and back on the island after the second plane crash, flashes back to his return to civilization, where he is brought in by Charles Widmore and asked to convince the Oceanic 6 to return to the island.

0411008.title: LaFleur
0411008.description: The survivors left on the island, now led by Sawyer after Locke's departure, find themselves back in the 1970s, where they are now forced to become members of the Dharma Initiative.

0411008.title: Namaste
0411008.description: Jack, Kate and Hurley wind up on the island in 1977, where they meet up with Sawyer and also join the Dharma Initiative. Meanwhile, Sun is stuck on the island in the present with Ben and the other passengers after the plane crash.

0411008.title: He's Our You
0411008.description: Sayid is held as a prisoner by the Dharma Initiative, presumed to be a Hostile. However, during his capture, he believes he has discovered the reason why he's back on the island.

0411008.title: Whatever Happened, Happened
0411008.description: Jack refuses to help save young Ben after Sayid shoots him, so Sawyer and Kate turn to Richard Alpert for help. Meanwhile, what Sawyer said to Kate on the chopper is revealed, as well as what Kate did with Aaron before the flight.

0411008.title: Dead Is Dead
0411008.description: Ben and Locke return to the island, where Ben says he is going to summon the Smoke "monster" and atone for his daughter's death. In addition, the falling-out on the island between Ben and Charles Widmore is revealed.

0411008.title: Some Like It Hoth
0411008.description: Miles is chosen by Horace to transport a dead body across the island. During the trip, Miles reveals to Hurley that Dr. Pierre Chang (a.k.a. Dr. Marvin Candle) is his father, whom he resents for leaving him and his mother.

0411008.title: The Variable
0411008.description: Faraday returns to the island and tells Jack that his mother, Eloise Hawking, lied to them--they don't belong on the island. He then initiates a dangerous plan to get them back home.

0411008.title: Follow the Leader
0411008.description: Jack attempts to follow through with Daniel Faraday's plan to detonate the hydrogen bomb after Faraday is killed, Locke instructs Alpert to take him to Jacob, and Sawyer is interrogated about an incriminating surveillance video.

0411008.title: The Incident: Part 1
0411008.description: Jack and Sayid's plan faces resistance from Sawyer, Juliet, and Kate. Ben and The Others/Hostiles reach Jacob at the Foot of the Statue, and are soon met by the 316 survivors, who reveal the contents of their mysterious package.

0411008.title: The Incident: Part 2
0411008.description: Jack and Sawyer fight against each other about the fate of the island and the passengers of the Oceanic Flight 815 but Juliet ends the discussion, changing her mind. In the Swan station, Radzinsky is informed by Phil that a group is heading to the spot with a bomb. There is a shooting between Jack's group and Radzinsky's group with tragic consequences. Meanwhile, Locke, Ben, Sun, Richard and The Others head to the temple to meet Jacob. Locke and Ben enter in the temple and Ben stabs Jacob to death. Ilana reaches Richard and The Others and shows the content of the box ...

0411008.title: LA X - Part 1
0411008.description: Flight 815 is shown successfully landing in Los Angeles with no crash on the island, but the survivors are simultaneously shown still on the island after Juliet detonates the bomb.

0411008.title: LA X - Part 2
0411008.description: Sawyer buries Juliet with Miles while Jack, Kate, Hurley and Jin bring Sayid to the underground of the temple; out of the blue, they are attacked by mysterious natives. Hurley shows the guitar case that Jacob gave to him and save the group. Sawyer asks Miles to tell him what Juliet wanted to tell him. Sayid is drowned by the natives and dies. Sawyer and Miles are captured by the natives and Hurley is interrogated and tells that Jacob is dead, panicking the natives. John attacks Richard in front of his group. Meanwhile, in a parallel reality, Kate succeeds to escape ...

0411008.title: What Kate Does
0411008.description: Sayid miraculously comes back to life, but his problems have only just begun. Sawyer escapes, and Kate and Jin go after him. Back in Los Angeles, fugitive Kate helps Claire as she goes into labor.

0411008.title: The Substitute
0411008.description: On the island, the being now occupying Locke's body turns to Sawyer and promises to tell him why he's on the island. Back in Los Angeles, Locke loses his job and encounters a number of familiar faces.

0411008.title: Lighthouse
0411008.description: Jacob sends Hurley on a mission across the island, but Jack must accompany him. In Los Angeles, Jack's difficult relationship with his son is revealed. Meanwhile, Jin discovers that Claire thinks the people at the temple stole her son.

0411008.title: Sundown
0411008.description: Claire arrives at the temple and warns the inhabitants that the being inhabiting Locke wants to talk, but Dogen sends Sayid to kill him instead. In Los Angeles, Sayid saves his brother, who is in trouble with a loan shark.

0411008.title: Dr. Linus
0411008.description: Ilana prepares to kill Ben after Miles reveals that Ben killed Jacob. In Los Angeles, Ben contemplates a power play at his high school. Meanwhile Richard and Jack share their secrets and experiences with Jacob and form an alliance.

0411008.title: Recon
0411008.description: Locke sends Sawyer on a recon mission to the other island, where he runs into Charles Widmore and his submarine crew. In Los Angeles, Sawyer works as a police officer obsessed with finding the conman who destroyed his family.

0411008.title: Ab Aeterno
0411008.description: The mysteries behind Richard Alpert's arrival to the island, his immortality, and his alliance with Jacob are revealed--plus more details about the purpose of the island and the relationship between Jacob and the smoke monster.

0411008.title: The Package
0411008.description: Sun and Jin's search for each other is interrupted when Widmore's crew kidnaps Jin, and Locke heads to the other island to bring him back. In Los Angeles, Jin's job for Sun's father is sidetracked when his money is taken at customs.

0411008.title: Happily Ever After
0411008.description: Charles Widmore brings Desmond back to the island so that he can conduct a dangerous electromagnetic experiment, which sends him back to the alternate reality in Los Angeles, a reality where he has never met Penny.

0411008.title: Everybody Loves Hugo
0411008.description: Michael appears to Hurley and gives him a new mission, and Sayid captures Desmond and sends him to Locke. In Los Angeles, Desmond sets up a meeting between Libby and Hurley to further his assignment.

0411008.title: The Last Recruit
0411008.description: As the battle between Locke and Widmore commences, Sawyer launches his plan to change allegiances. Back in Los Angeles, fate continues to intervene and bring the original survivors together.

0411008.title: The Candidate
0411008.description: With Jack's help, Locke rescues the candidates from Widmore's compound, but their plans for leaving the island are forced to change. In Los Angeles, Jack tries to convince Locke to try an experimental surgery for his paralysis.

0411008.title: Across the Sea
0411008.description: The story of how Jacob and his brother came to the island, their uneasy relationship with their "mother," their eventual falling-out, and revelation of what Jacob was on the island to protect.

0411008.title: What They Died For
0411008.description: Jacob appears to the survivors of the submarine explosion and tells them what they were chosen for, while Ben joins forces with Locke as they both have a final showdown with Charles Widmore.

0411008.title: The End
0411008.description: Locke searches for Desmond to achieve his goal of destroying the island. Jack, the newly-appointed "protector" of the island, sets out to stop him. In Los Angeles, the survivors slowly reunite and recall their island experiences.

0426688.title: To Arms
0426688.description: The First World War shaped the twentieth century. It sparked the Russian Revolution, and it launched America as a world power. The fault lines from its failed peace settlement led to a second terrible world war barely twenty years later. We live with its unresolved consequences; in the Middle East, the Balkans and Ireland. It began as a clash in the Balkans, which grew to engulf Europe and the world. Britain joined in, more to protect her great empire than for the defence of small nations. The merciless pattern of the war was set early on, with Austro-Hungarian atrocities against Serbian civilians.

0426688.title: Under the Eagle
0426688.description: The first months of the war on the Western Front were mobile, fast and dangerous; casualty rates were higher than with later trench warfare. The Germans were halted by the Allies at the Battle of the Mame, fell back to high ground and dug in. The Allies followed suit. The resulting line of trenches stretched from the Channel to Switzerland. Now 11 million French and Belgian civilians were under occupation. German brutality was no myth. Resistance was ruthlessly surpressed. Civilians, including women and children were massacred, used as human shields, and sent to concentration camps as hostages and forced labourers.

0426688.title: Global War
0426688.description: War for Europe meant war for the world. Germany gambled that Britain might risk everything to protect her Empire - even victory on the Western Front. So, to divert British resources, maverick German commanders led the British a dance; across the Pacific, Africa and the Middle East. They became legends in Germany and Britain - men like Admiral Graf von Spee, who inflicted Britain's greatest naval defeat for 250 years. The global war sucked in Africans, Chinese and Indians to serve in France. Meanwhile the war in Africa exploited its people and left behind a wasteland, but sowed the seeds of self-determination.

0426688.title: Jihad
0426688.description: The history of Turkey's involvement in World War I.

0426688.title: Shackled to a Corpse
0426688.description: The war on the Eastern Front was racial; Slav verses Teuton. It was highly mobile, fought across brutal terrain from the Urais to the Alps. It initiated many horros of twentieth century warfare: chemical weapons, mass expulsions of civilians, the persecution of Jews. The Italian front with Austro-Hungary was perhaps the bitterest of all. Soldiers lived and fought for years in the hardhest environments, enduring avalanches and frost-bite as well as relentless enemy action. Mistrust and contempt increasingly threatened alliances. Germany shored up her ally Austria-Hungary, feeling herself "shackled to a corpse", which Austria-Hungary saw Germany as her "secret enemy".

0426688.title: Breaking the Deadlock
0426688.description: Attrition; "lions led by donkeys", the slaughter only ceasing for a brief truce one Christmas - old, mistaken views of the war on the Western Front. In fact there was constant tactical evolutions; hundreds of generals died in action; some men adopted a system of "Live and Let Live", with countless informal local truces. The Germans tried new ideas at Verdun: 750,000 French and Germans died with little gain. After terrible failure on the Somme the British used tanks at Cambrai, but the Germans clawed back lost ground. Victory on the Western Front would go to the side that learned to consolidate success.

0426688.title: Blockade
0426688.description: This history of the naval aspect of the war and how Germany's blockade strategy eventually led to the United States of America to entering it.

0426688.title: Revolution
0426688.description: Increasingly governments faced the risk of their men mutinying, morale cracking, and civilians rising up in strikes and civil disobedience. As governments worried about containing unrest at home, they set agents working to foment revolution among the enemy. Britain sponsored the Arab Revolt through Lawrence of Arabia, Germany backed Irish independence with arms for the Easter Rising and funded Lenin's Russian coup d'etat in 1917. Revolution became a weapon of war, hitting the enemy from within. When Lenin pulled Russia out of the war, it vindicated all Germany's efforts to use subversion, releasing half a million German soldiers for the Western Front.

0426688.title: Germany's Last Gamble
0426688.description: With Russia out of the war, Germany's Triple Alliance attempts to capitalize on the strategic advantage to win the war before the American forces join the fight.

0426688.title: War Without End
0426688.description: The war's last months were more destructive than trench warfare had been. Germany remained on French soil, believing herself unbeaten. The Armistice was the Allies' bid to obtain - on paper - Germany's unconditional surrender. At Versailles she was made to shoulder the blame for the war, to force her to pay for it. The war, with losses over 20 million, was later deemed as a senseless waste. For defense against agression. For glory. It curbed militarism, for a while, but was not the war to end all wars. Its terrible message to the century it shaped was that war can fulfill ambitions. That war can work.

0431891.title: I Am The Man To Beat

0433309.title: Pilot
0433309.description: When a rapist proves a little too difficult to find for the FBI, Agent Eppes and Agent Lake utilize Agent Eppes' genius mathematician brother, Charlie, to discover the rapist's point of origin.

0433309.title: Uncertainty Principle
0433309.description: A pair of bank robbers are quietly taking LA by storm but Charlie delivers an equation that may predict their next location. But these bank robbers aren't as respectful as the bank videos reveal.

0433309.title: Vector
0433309.description: A deadly virus is spreading through LA and only Charlie's equations can determine how far and where the disease is spreading.

0433309.title: Structural Corruption
0433309.description: The mysterious suicide of a brilliant but unfocused CalSci engineering major leads Eppes and Charlie to the site of an iconic building.

0433309.title: Prime Suspect
0433309.description: A genius' (Harris) daughter is captured by two men looking to use his possible solution to a 150 year old math equation for heists.

0433309.title: Sabotage
0433309.description: An unknown terrorist is mimicking horrible train accidents and leaving a number code at the scene.

0433309.title: Counterfeit Reality
0433309.description: When FBI agent Don Eppes finds several murders are linked to counterfeiting, his mathematically genial brother Charlie uses his skills to do what other investigating methods -as used by Agent Kim Hall, Don's colleague and ex in his Albuquerque days, a blank chapter in his past for Charlie- failed to, locate the forging and identify who did the graphical artwork required for his old-fashioned, relatively hard to detect fakes with real printing presses and watermark, not computer printing: it's a missing artist, who must be kidnapped and will probably by murdered as a ...

0433309.title: Identity Crisis
0433309.description: When Riley, who practiced an ingenious pyramid method of skinning numerous bank accounts for over half a million dollars, is strangled, exactly the same way -not revealed to the press- as Lisa Bayle, for whose murder Don Eppes' investigation once put Cliff Howard in jail after a plea bargain-confession, Don now fears the wrong man was arrested. Charlie helps him quantify the unlikeliness of a coincidence and seriously doubt the forensic evidence. Electrician Jose Salazar, whom Don suspects, still turns out to be innocent of Lisa's murder, but Charlie realizes that's ...

0433309.title: Sniper Zero
0433309.description: Sniper attacks are occurring across LA but are all the attacks the result of one inexperienced marksmen or is a fad of sniper killings infecting LA?

0433309.title: Dirty Bomb
0433309.description: A truck of nuclear materials is stolen by terrorists who intend to use the materials to make a bomb which would then be used on the city of LA. Only Charlie and Charlie's father Alan can save the city from a small nuclear blast.

0433309.title: Sacrifice
0433309.description: Dr. Larry Fleinhardt's former college days friend Jonas Hoke, the Senior computer-science researcher, who develops for Robert Oliver's firm Lorman group with gifted college drop-out Scott Reynolds a classified program to evaluate government projects, is murdered in his Hollywood Hills home; data were stolen from his computer, which only contains a coded program for analysis of baseball statistics. Hoke's financial divorce complications seem irrelevant, although his wife had a relationship with their security system installer Lucas Grant. However Charlie finds that ...

0433309.title: Noisy Edge
0433309.description: A UFO is briefly seen flying through Los Angeles with no clear indication on what it is, but Agent Eppes discovers it was heading for the Staples Center and starts an investigation into the possibility of mass terrorism.

0433309.title: Man Hunt
0433309.description: A prison transport bus crashes after maneuvers by two other vehicles, several inmates escape, including the dangerous McDowd. Charlie gets on well with CHP Officer Morris on the scene and works out mathematically it was no accident, both other drivers probably were in the game. Dad is worried Don might be returning to the period he regularly worked in fugitive retrieval, especially now a former colleague, burly federal marshal Cooper, is on the same case. After finding a lesser fugitive, Charlie's mathematical probabilities approach helps reconstructing the remarkable...

0433309.title: Judgment Call
0433309.description: When the wife of a judge is killed the team investigates. And they discover that it might not be for the reason they think.

0433309.title: Bettor or Worse
0433309.description: The team investigates a jewelry store theft where the robbers kidnapped the owner's wife and daughter.

0433309.title: Obsession
0433309.description: Singer Skyler Wyatt reports a knife-wielding intruder in her home. The break-in seems to be connected to the hate mail she has been receiving for the last three months. Don begins to investigate and the body of a paparazzo is discovered overlooking Skyler's home. Don brings in his brother Charlie to analyze the hand-written hate mail and to try to determine where the strange photographs found on the dead body were taken. As the investigation proceeds the brothers are drawn further into the murky world of the paparazzi and celebrity stalking!

0433309.title: Calculated Risk
0433309.description: Don takes under his wing the son of a murdered executive as the team and Charlie try to narrow down who's responsible out of a pool of six thousand or more.

0433309.title: Assassin
0433309.description: The raid on a small time forgers home reveals a secret code book. Don takes the code book to his brother Charlie who tells him that the book hides secrets of a skilled and highly trained assassin somewhere in the country. Interrogation of he forger reveals the name of the intended target, Gabriel Ruiz, the last remaining member of a powerful political family in Colombia. So the hunt begins to catch the assassin before he completes his mission!

0433309.title: Soft Target
0433309.description: When a death results from an anti-terrorism exercise Don and his team are called in, but they end up butting heads with the leader of the unit who refuses to halt further training exercises. Back at home, Alan has volunteered the house for the wedding of a girl both Charlie and Don had a crush on in high school.

0433309.title: Convergence
0433309.description: A series of home invasions become increasingly violent. Charlie's most famous work, The Eppes Convergence, is scrutinized by a former rival.

0433309.title: In Plain Sight
0433309.description: Data from a meth lab explosion reveals a photograph that triggers memories for Charlie and put him at loggerheads with Don who's focused on tracking down the drug dealer who set off the explosion that killed one of his agents.

0433309.title: Toxin
0433309.description: A few apparently random cases of product tampering lead to a mountain man with a grudge, a pharmaceutical company and a conspiracy.

0433309.title: Bones of Contention
0433309.description: The murder of a young museum researcher sends the team on a search for a killer and a missing Native American skull.

0433309.title: Scorched
0433309.description: Charlie seeks out an engineering professor to help him recreate a fire scenario to solve an arson case.

0433309.title: The OG
0433309.description: Charlie uses math to determine the killer of an undercover FBI agent.

0433309.title: Double Down
0433309.description: Charlie and the team investigate a murder at a casino.

0433309.title: Harvest
0433309.description: A crime scene drenched in blood leads the team to a form of human trafficking, and Amita to her past.

0433309.title: The Running Man
0433309.description: When a DNA synthesizer with terrorist possibilities is stolen from a university lab, Charlie and the team must find it before it leaves the country.

0433309.title: Protest
0433309.description: The bombing of a recruitment office puts Don and his father at odds, and brings an agent out of retirement.

0433309.title: Mind Games
0433309.description: A psychic helps to find a burial site of numerous illegal immigrants just across the California-Mexico border. Charlie and he battle to see who will come up with the location of another female migrant before she joins the other victims in the morgue.

0433309.title: All's Fair
0433309.description: After an Iraqi woman - in the US to film an interview on atrocities against women back home - is murdered, clues lead to an American military suspect and the team must determine their truth before another killing occurs.

0433309.title: Dark Matter
0433309.description: Charlie helps the team solve how many shooters there were in a school massacre.

0433309.title: Guns and Roses
0433309.description: An ATF agent is found in her home, an apparent victim of suicide. Don, having been involved with her, asks Charlie to run algorithms to determine if she was likely suicidal, or she was murdered.

0433309.title: Rampage
0433309.description: After an assailant opens fire in the FBI offices, Charlie does not want to return.

0433309.title: Backscatter
0433309.description: The Russian mob threatens Don and his family, however Charlie refuses to give up working the case.

0433309.title: Undercurrents
0433309.description: The bodies of young Asian girls wash up on the beach, including one with bird flu. Amita gets a job offer.

0433309.title: Hot Shot
0433309.description: Don's team investigates a rapist who's converted to a serial killer, as Charlie struggles with memories of his mother.

0433309.title: Spree
0433309.description: Charlie and the team track a couple who are spree killers, but their actions seem to defy profiling.

0433309.title: Two Daughters
0433309.description: The team is in a race against time to rescue fellow agent Megan from the clutches of Crystal Hoyle.

0433309.title: Provenance
0433309.description: The robbery of a painting that unexpectedly turned to murder, has the team exploring a disputed provenance and possible insurance fraud.

0433309.title: The Mole
0433309.description: The hit-and-run death of an interpreter may compromise a team member, and Charlie must deal with not being consulted for a paper.

0433309.title: Traffic
0433309.description: Charlie and the team grapple with the concept of 'randomness' while trying to find a killer targeting drivers on the freeway.

0433309.title: Longshot
0433309.description: Don and the team investigate a suspicious death at a horse track. When Charlie starts looking into the crime, he uncovers something that will send the investigation into an entirely different direction.

0433309.title: Blackout
0433309.description: Blackouts all over Los Angeles leave the city in the dark. Don works with his team to figure out if the power outages are an accident or the work of terrorists.

0433309.title: Hardball
0433309.description: The death of a minor league player leads to a math prodigy and stirs old feelings for Don.

0433309.title: Waste Not
0433309.description: Charlie's investigation of a company's toxic paving material is impeded by a new school administrator who wants him to focus primarily on his pure academic work instead.

0433309.title: Brutus
0433309.description: The assassination of a California senator leads the team to questionable experimentation on prisoners, the CIA, and a man bent on revenge. Elsewhere, Larry makes an announcement that shakes Charlie.

0433309.title: Killer Chat
0433309.description: The team tries to track the person murdering men in homes that are for sale, and Larry's dream of space may be in jeopardy.

0433309.title: Nine Wives
0433309.description: The search for a pedophile polygamist takes an interesting genealogical turn when a quilt is found.

0433309.title: Finders Keepers
0433309.description: The search for a yacht ends up splitting Charlie's loyalties when two agencies ask for his help.

0433309.title: Take Out
0433309.description: Multiple robberies at upscale restaurants bring Don's team in once it escalates to murder. Elsewhere, both Charlie and Don must do some soul searching as one tackles a psychiatric review and another questions the ethics of a pharmaceutical company that wants to use his name.

0433309.title: End of Watch
0433309.description: The discovery of a presumed dead police officer's badge brings the LAPD and Don's team together to solve the mystery of what happened 17 years ago. Elsewhere, Alan is served in a lawsuit, and he has to determine if his calculations were wrong when he consulted for a golf course.

0433309.title: Contenders
0433309.description: One of David's childhood friends is accused of murder while sparring in preparation for an All-Out Fighting bout, and Charlie has a contest of his own trying to defend Larry's chair in a Texas Hold 'em qualifier.

0433309.title: One Hour
0433309.description: The son of a multi-millionaire Latino hip-hop-Song producer is kidnapped. The kidnapper demands $3.2 million for the boy's release, but Granger and his crew only have one hour.

0433309.title: Democracy
0433309.description: An old colleague of Charlie's asks for help because of the untimely deaths of some coworkers, but when she also turns up dead Don and Charlie are started on a trail that may threaten the very democracy they've vowed to protect.

0433309.title: Pandora's Box
0433309.description: Charlie splits his genius between solving a plane crash and the burglary at his home.

0433309.title: Burn Rate
0433309.description: As letter bombs begin targeting people surrounding a previous serial bomber investigation, Don and Charlie must sift through a number of false leads to find the real killer.

0433309.title: The Art of Reckoning
0433309.description: Don finds himself negotiating with a hit man to find an assemblyman's son, and Larry has difficulty adjusting to terra firma.

0433309.title: Under Pressure
0433309.description: The threat of a terrorist attack in L.A. puts everyone on high-alert as Don leads a special task force, and butts heads with Charlie and Alan.

0433309.title: Money for Nothing
0433309.description: A shipment of medicine and cash bound for Zambia is hijacked, and Don and his team find themselves working against a banker focused on retrieving his money at the cost of the people being held for the code to access the safe.

0433309.title: The Janus List
0433309.description: When Charlie and Don are specifically asked for by a bomber who's rigged a bridge, it puts them on a trail of espionage in- and outside the states, and a devastating betrayal.

0433309.title: Trust Metric
0433309.description: Peter MacNicol returns as a regular cast member. Colby is being interrogated by a man named Agent Kirkland, who passes him a handcuff key and gives him escape instructions. Don and his team get information about and from Colby and must figure out if that information is reliable then realizes that everything about Colby being a double agent may not be what it seems.

0433309.title: Hollywood Homicide
0433309.description: The death of a Hollywood wannabe leads to a famous actor, his friends, and a possible double. At the office, David has difficulty dealing with Colby's return.

0433309.title: Velocity
0433309.description: A car crash into a building has ties to street racing and possibly a cold case.

0433309.title: Thirteen
0433309.description: Charlie is uncomfortable when the team has to use a numerologist to solve the current case, that has religious overtones.

0433309.title: Robin Hood
0433309.description: The perfect bank heist almost stumps the team when the profits are donated or returned to their rightful owners, and Don struggles with management issues.

0433309.title: In Security
0433309.description: Don is devastated when he thinks he led a killer to a secured witness, and Charlie sets out to prove he wasn't responsible.

0433309.title: Primacy
0433309.description: Amita's life is put in danger when she consults on a case involving an on-line role-playing game.

0433309.title: Tabu
0433309.description: A wealthy man's daughter is kidnapped, and Megan is astounded by his behavior while the team tries to rescue her.

0433309.title: Graphic
0433309.description: In this episode, it is discovered that someone has stolen, recreated and sold several copies of an extremely rare comic book. Christopher Lloyd plays the original creator of the comic book, who no longer benefits from his past creations. Having thought that his comics wouldn't be worth much in the future, he either lost or sold his entire collection and regrets it now that he and his wife live on very little. His young friend and fellow comics artist, played by Ben Feldman, publicly humiliates the rich man who owned the original before it was stolen.

0433309.title: Chinese Box
0433309.description: David is held hostage in an elevator at the F.B.I. building, and Don keeps brushing aside Charlie's suggestion to save David as an all-out assault is planned.

0433309.title: Breaking Point
0433309.description: Charlie's life is put in danger after he gives an interview about the case he and Don are working on together, attracting the attention of the kidnappers of an investigative reporter.

0433309.title: Power
0433309.description: Don's team tracks a serial rapist who uses his position as a cop to entrap his victims.

0433309.title: Black Swan
0433309.description: A meth lab bust yields a surprise arrest that stymies the team when they can't figure out why he was in the area, and Megan disagrees with what Don chooses to do to get his answers.

0433309.title: Checkmate
0433309.description: A.U.S.A. Robin Brooks is back in town, and her involvement in Don's case brings back memories as they try to keep witnesses alive. Meanwhile, David attempts to bond with a young man who's in the chief suspect's thrall.

0433309.title: End Game
0433309.description: Clay Porter returns to the U.S. when his father and sister are taken hostage, and Don embarks on a deadly cat-and-mouse game to try to catch Porter and rescue his family.

0433309.title: Atomic No. 33
0433309.description: Larry finds himself fighting his own bigotry when he assists Don and Charlie's investigation into the poisoning of cult members.

0433309.title: Pay to Play
0433309.description: The murder of a rapper puts Charlie to work analyzing the mathematics of the music business in the same week that Amita's parents come to town, and Megan has asked for a week off without discussing it with Don.

0433309.title: When Worlds Collide
0433309.description: When one of Charlie's friends, a scientist at the university, is arrested for terrorist activities, it puts him at philosophical odds with Don. And as he works to prove the man's innocence, his beliefs may jeopardize his career.

0433309.title: High Exposure
0433309.description: Charlie's loss of clearance may endanger Don's life when he and Ian Edgerton begin tracking suspects in the murders of two rock climbers.

0433309.title: The Decoy Effect
0433309.description: The team races to find a group of kidnappers who have their victims drain their bank accounts using ATMs, and Charlie's attempt to reinstate his clearance is slowed by an agent with an agenda that may include Don.

0433309.title: Blowback
0433309.description: Agent McGowan makes his move against Don, and Colby gets a little too involved with one of the suspects in a cop killing.

0433309.title: Jack of All Trades
0433309.description: Charlie and Don's fates hang in the balance as the team tracks a white-collar criminal through Los Angeles. Meanwhile, Alan finds out that one of his old planning projects may disappear with a new development by the city.

0433309.title: Scan Man
0433309.description: The death of an agent kicks everyone into high gear, but that slows down when their prime suspect turns out to have Autism Spectrum Disorder, Charlie steps on toes re-establishing himself as the resident expert, and Don looks for deeper meaning.

0433309.title: Magic Show
0433309.description: Charlie's skepticism of magic is revealed when a stunt goes wrong and a magician disappears, leaving David to pick up the pieces of his love life.

0433309.title: Charlie Don't Surf
0433309.description: The father of a childhood friend of Don and Charlie asks for Don's help when his son, a former pro surfer, is found dead.

0433309.title: Thirty-Six Hours
0433309.description: Two trains collide, a passenger train and a freight train carrying toxic chemicals. Don, Charlie and the team are brought to the scene, investigating a potential crime.

0433309.title: Conspiracy Theory
0433309.description: The team descends into a bit of madness as working with a conspiracy theorist to solve bombing case exposes each of their own peculiar beliefs. Meanwhile, a mysterious stranger saves an agent's life.

0433309.title: Frienemies
0433309.description: Charlie and Marshall Penfield work on their collaboration issues when Charlie must consult with him on a case involving robbery, murder and revenge.

0433309.title: Arrow of Time
0433309.description: Buck Winters, who murdered and stole with his older lover in the season three premiere, escapes from prison and comes after Don. Don uses his newfound faith to guide him through.

0433309.title: Jacked
0433309.description: Charlie's hacking skills are put to the test when the team tries to rescue hostages on a bus. Meanwhile, Alan chafes at his first experience with the think tank model.

0433309.title: Trouble in Chinatown
0433309.description: The abduction of an undercover agent brings ex-CIA psychic Simon Kraft back into the Eppes' lives, and while Charlie pursues a scientific solution and Don a procedural one, Kraft's visions lead them toward an ancient ceremony and the loss of another life.

0433309.title: Sneakerhead
0433309.description: The team chases after a pair of rare sneakers that just keep disappearing, leaving death and injuries in their wake. Liz weighs her promotion against losing the team in the L.A. office.

0433309.title: Guilt Trip
0433309.description: When Robin Brooks loses a case involving the murder of an informant, the team takes it very personally. Launching an investigation to get around double jeopardy, and bring justice down on an international arms dealer.

0433309.title: Cover Me
0433309.description: An old friend who's a DEA agent agrees to assist Liz in an undercover operation when Charlie uses math to affect the city's drug traffic, but a miscalculation and an addiction endangers both her life and the operation.

0433309.title: First Law
0433309.description: When an AI kills the scientist who created her it opens a career door for Charlie, but first he and Amita must determine what happened, putting Amita's life in jeopardy.

0433309.title: 12:01 AM
0433309.description: Charlie is distracted from applying math to his first basketball-coaching job when a doctor claims to have evidence that clears a death-row inmate, leaving him and the team very little time to be sure real justice occurs.

0433309.title: Animal Rites
0433309.description: Charlie takes a very personal interest when one of CalSci's professors is murdered during a raid by animal rights advocates, and once the murderer is found Nikki's actions put the operation and civilians at risk.

0433309.title: The Fifth Man
0433309.description: Charlie once again questions his involvement with the FBI when a miscalculation leaves Don in the hospital and his team searching for the reason behind atypical home invasion robberies.

0433309.title: Disturbed
0433309.description: Charlie, still feeling guilty about Don's injury, focuses on finding a frighteningly intelligent serial killer who is meticulous about eliminating all witnesses to his crimes.

0433309.title: Greatest Hits
0433309.description: Disgraced agent Roger Bloom appears to be involved in a string of bank robberies, Charlie resists becoming part of his new office's legacy, and an abduction will forever change the Eppes's lives.

0433309.title: Angels and Devils
0433309.description: Wracked by fear and self-doubt after Amita's abduction, Charlie must somehow focus when she reaches out to him in order to save her before it's too late.

0433309.title: Hangman
0433309.description: The team tries to protect an activist from a sniper, while Charlie and Amita try to keep his proposal and her answer a secret.

0433309.title: Friendly Fire
0433309.description: Charlie and the team investigate a shootout involving a bank robber, but when the science doesn't match the stories suspicion falls on one of Don's mentors.

0433309.title: 7 Men Out
0433309.description: A rash of apparent suicides takes a sinister turn when a gambling connection is uncovered. Elsewhere, Charlie worries when Alan's retirement disappears, and Larry flounders trying to find his new path.

0433309.title: Where Credit's Due
0433309.description: The team gets a close-up look at the movie business when a producer's desiccated body is found in the desert. Elsewhere, Larry knows that he's leaving but not his destination, and Alan struggles with technology.

0433309.title: Hydra
0433309.description: What starts as a kidnapping becomes more complicated when the team learns the child may be a clone and her guardians may not have her best interests in mind.

0433309.title: Dreamland
0433309.description: The team explores an odd death by some kind of electricity at a decommissioned airbase, finding themselves teamed with an odd character from the Pentagon's Department 44. Elsewhere, David ponders his future and Alan celebrates a birthday.

0433309.title: Shadow Markets
0433309.description: The team finds themselves protecting a hacker who has exposed their sting site when he's targeted by assassins.

0433309.title: Ultimatum
0433309.description: The team gets into a turf war with a prison warden, and the casualty may be Ian Edgerton and the member of Don's team that he's taken hostage in a desperate attempt to prove himself innocent of murder charges.

0433309.title: Con Job
0433309.description: When robbers hit a diamond exchange and take hostages, Don and the team find an unlikely ally in convict John Buckley, who may help the team's investigation when they believe the men are copying Buckley's criminal strategies.

0433309.title: Old Soldiers
0433309.description: When the team foils a robbery of an armored car full of Federal Reserve money and recover bills that trace back to the infamous D.B. Cooper heist, they call on Agent Roger Bloom, who worked on the Cooper case, for help with the investigation.

0433309.title: Scratch
0433309.description: Don and the team try their luck at investigating the theft of scratch-off lottery tickets, but the stakes are raised when one of the culprits killed at a botched robbery turns out to be a former lottery winner.

0433309.title: Arm in Arms
0433309.description: The team searches for a lost shipment of high-caliber firearms when one of the weapons is responsible for random killings throughout the city. Also, Charlie and Amita disagree on a wedding date while Don re-evaluates his relationship with Robin.

0433309.title: Devil Girl
0433309.description: The team searches for a serial killer who is targeting men who solicit prostitutes. Also, Colby and Nikki deal with the aftermath of a car crash when they have an accident during the investigation.

0433309.title: And the Winner Is...
0433309.description: Larry turns up again after having wandered the desert for quite some time, while the FBI works to solve jewelry heist at an awards show, while dealing with celebrities...and their egos.

0433309.title: Growin' Up
0433309.description: The team investigates the deaths of two men who were part of a group of friends that had been sexually assaulted by a teacher when they were young boys. Also, Charlie and Amita get a fantastic job opportunity that could put a wrinkle in their wedding plans.

0433309.title: Cause and Effect
0433309.description: Charlie and Amita are getting married at last. While making an arrest, Don's gun is stolen from him and is subsequently used in a series of crimes. Lou Diamond Phillips' character, Agent Ian Edgerton, appears in the series finale.

0436992.title: Rose
0436992.description: When ordinary shop-worker Rose Tyler meets a mysterious stranger called the Doctor she is drawn into his strange and dangerous world; her life will never be the same again.

0436992.title: The End of the World
0436992.description: The Doctor takes Rose to the year 5 billion to witness the destruction of the Earth.

0436992.title: The Unquiet Dead
0436992.description: The Doctor has great expectations for his latest adventure when he and Rose join forces with Charles Dickens to investigate a mysterious plague of zombies.

0436992.title: Aliens of London
0436992.description: The Doctor returns Rose to her own time - well, sort of - but her family reunion is ruined when a spaceship crashes in the middle of London. What is the origin of the spaceship, and where has the Prime Minister gone in this time of crisis?

0436992.title: World War Three
0436992.description: The Slitheen have infiltrated Parliament and have the Doctor and his friends trapped as the Doctor works to prevent them from starting World War Three.

0436992.title: Dalek
0436992.description: The TARDIS is drawn to an alien museum deep below the Utah desert, where a ruthless billionaire keeps prisoner the last of the Doctor's most fearsome enemies.

0436992.title: The Long Game
0436992.description: In the year 200,000 the Doctor discovers that a satellite with a dark secret is controlling humanity and slowing its development.

0436992.title: Father's Day
0436992.description: Rose asks The Doctor to take her to 1987, on the day her father was killed.

0436992.title: The Empty Child
0436992.description: When a spaceship crashes in the middle of the London Blitz the Doctor, Rose and the enigmatic Captain Jack Harkness find themselves investigating a plague of physical injuries and a little boy in a gas mask.

0436992.title: The Doctor Dances
0436992.description: The gas mask zombies are on the rise as the plague spreads across war-torn London.

0436992.title: Boom Town
0436992.description: Stopping off in present-day Cardiff to recharge the TARDIS, The Doctor, Rose and Jack meet up with Mickey and encounter an old foe in the midst of hatching a scheme that could destroy the entire planet.

0436992.title: Bad Wolf
0436992.description: The Doctor, Rose and Jack are separated and forced to compete in twisted and deadly games on the Game Station.

0436992.title: The Parting of the Ways
0436992.description: As the Dalek fleet begin their attack on the Earth, the Doctor and his allies make one final stand.

0436992.title: The Christmas Invasion
0436992.description: It's Christmas Eve, but this is to be a far from silent night - the cruel Sycorax have come to Earth to enslave mankind and, as ever, only The Doctor can stop them. Unfortunately, he's lying in a coma in Jackie's home...

0436992.title: New Earth
0436992.description: The Doctor and Rose arrive on New Earth and meet old friends and enemies in a hospital which can cure every disease. But the cures come at a terrible cost.

0436992.title: Tooth and Claw
0436992.description: The Doctor and Rose are transported to 19th Century Scotland, where they meet Queen Victoria, and try to protect her from a ravenous werewolf and a band of assassinating warrior-monks

0436992.title: School Reunion
0436992.description: The Krillitanes - aliens with a mix-and-match physiology - are trying to crack the 'God-Maker', a paradigm to give them ultimate power. They are using children as a computer, and only the Doctor and Rose, re-united with Sarah Jane Smith and K9 can prevent them from becoming masters of time and space.

0436992.title: The Girl in the Fireplace
0436992.description: The Doctor, Mickey and Rose land on a spaceship in the 51st century only to find 18th century Versailles on board, the time of Madame De Pompadour! To find out what's going on the Doctor must enter Versailles and save Madame De Popmpadour but it turns into an emotional roller coaster for the Doctor.

0436992.title: Rise of the Cybermen
0436992.description: The TARDIS crash lands in London on a parallel world, where Rose's dad is still alive, people are disappearing off the streets and one of the Doctor's deadliest enemies is about to be reborn.

0436992.title: The Age of Steel
0436992.description: The Cybermen take control of London as the population is enslaved and the Doctor and his friends become fugitives.

0436992.title: The Idiot's Lantern
0436992.description: As the coronation of Elizabeth II nears, the streets of London live in fear. Faceless people are stolen from their homes in the night and something evil is lurking in the television.

0436992.title: The Impossible Planet
0436992.description: When the Doctor and Rose become stranded on a planet orbiting a black hole, they find a human expedition crew and their servants, the Ood, being terrorised by the Devil.

0436992.title: The Satan Pit
0436992.description: The Doctor risks his life to investigate the pit and is forced to make a terrible decision, while Rose and the crew fend for their lives against the Legion of the Beast.

0436992.title: Love & Monsters
0436992.description: Elton Pope is an ordinary man intrigued by the world of the Doctor. When he and fellow enthusiasts - L.I.N.D.A. - meet the mysterious Victor Kennedy, their lives will never be the same again.

0436992.title: Fear Her
0436992.description: When children vanish into thin air in 2012 London, the Doctor and Rose find the answers in a seemingly ordinary household and a girl whose drawings can come to life.

0436992.title: Army of Ghosts
0436992.description: When ghosts of loved ones appear all over the world the Doctor traces the phenomena to the Torchwood Tower, where some old friends and enemies are waiting.

0436992.title: Doomsday
0436992.description: Earth becomes a battleground for the Daleks and the Cybermen. With the whole planet at stake and the Genesis Ark activated, how much will the Doctor sacrifice in order to end the war?

0436992.title: The Runaway Bride
0436992.description: The Doctor is baffled when a young woman is transported to the TARDIS on her wedding day, and attempts to find out how she is connected to an alien plot to destroy Earth.

0436992.title: Smith and Jones
0436992.description: When the hospital she works at is transported to the moon, medical student Martha Jones joins forces with The Doctor to hunt down an alien fugitive before the oxygen runs out.

0436992.title: The Shakespeare Code
0436992.description: The Doctor takes Martha to London in 1599, where William Shakespeare's new play is being used by three witches in an evil plan.

0436992.title: Gridlock
0436992.description: The Doctor takes Martha to New Earth, where she is kidnapped by two carjackers and taken to an underground Motorway, where the remainder of humanity on the planet live in perpetual gridlock.

0436992.title: Daleks in Manhattan
0436992.description: The Doctor and Martha travel to New York in 1930, where people have been mysteriously vanishing from the streets, and an old enemy resurfaces.

0436992.title: Evolution of the Daleks
0436992.description: Concluding part to Daleks in Manhattan. In 1930s New York, the Daleks' plan is in full force. Faced with the cyborgs' most evil and dangerous scheme yet, will the Doctor and Martha be able to defeat their greatest opponents?

0436992.title: The Lazarus Experiment
0436992.description: The famous Dr Lazarus has appeared to discover the secret of eternal youth - but do his experiments hide a sinister secret?
On a spaceship headed straight for the centre of the sun, the Doctor only has 42 minutes to save Martha and the ship's crew from an inevitable doom.

0436992.title: Human Nature
0436992.description: In 1913, Martha watches in jealousy from afar as The Doctor learns what it is to be human and to fall in love with the local school nurse, Joan Redfern.

0436992.title: The Family of Blood
0436992.description: The Doctor must deal with the repercussions of his decision to become human, as The Family Of Blood unveil themselves...

0436992.title: Blink
0436992.description: Sally Sparrow receives a cryptic message from the Doctor about a mysterious new enemy species that is after the TARDIS.

0436992.title: Utopia
0436992.description: Soon after bumping into old friend Jack Harkness, Martha and The Doctor head off to Malcassairo, a distant planet where an old professor will do anything he can to keep his people alive...

0436992.title: The Sound of Drums
0436992.description: The Doctor, Martha and Jack return to the 21st Century eighteen months after the Doctor and Martha left. They find they've missed the election, and the new Prime Minister, Harold Saxon, is someone they've met before by another name.

0436992.title: Last of the Time Lords
0436992.description: It's been a year since The Master unleashed the mysterious Toclafane onto Earth. With the human race and The Doctor enslaved under The Master's control, Martha Jones is the only person that can help stop the evil Time Lord.

0436992.title: Voyage of the Damned
0436992.description: A spacecraft set on an apocalyptic collision course with Earth, a host of killer robot angels and an evil severed headed mastermind - it's just another Christmas for the Doctor... 2007 Christmas special guest starring Kylie Minogue.

0436992.title: Partners in Crime
0436992.description: With a new weight-loss pill tested in London by Adipose Industries, The Doctor goes to investigate the sinister truth behind the product, only to find out that his old friend Donna Noble is investigating as well.

0436992.title: The Fires of Pompeii
0436992.description: Instead of Rome, The Doctor and Donna Noble end up visiting Pompeii in AD 79, on the eve of the catastrophic eruption of Mount Vesuvius. Before anyone even knew it was actually a volcano, the entire city is doomed for destruction.

0436992.title: Planet of the Ood
0436992.description: Finding themselves on the Ood-Sphere planet in the 42nd century, The Doctor and Donna discover the truth over the Ood's willingness to serve humankind.

0436992.title: The Sontaran Stratagem
0436992.description: UNIT's newest recruit Martha Jones enlists The Doctor's help to investigate kid genius Luke Rattigan and his ATMOS system that is used in every car on Earth.

0436992.title: The Poison Sky
0436992.description: With planet Earth choking under the poison sky, the Doctor must stop the Sontarans' threat to the planet.

0436992.title: The Doctor's Daughter
0436992.description: Caught in the middle of a war between the Humans and the Hath in the planet Messaline, the Doctor finds himself once again a father.

0436992.title: The Unicorn and the Wasp
0436992.description: With a 1926 dinner party turning into a murder mystery, The Doctor and Donna Noble get the chance to meet Agatha Christie on the eve of her well-known 9-days disappearance.

0436992.title: Silence in the Library
0436992.description: The Doctor and Donna join a group of archaeologists at a 51st century library. What caused the library to become abandoned? What are the Nodes? And what links the library to one little girl? All they have is one warning - count the shadows.

0436992.title: Forest of the Dead
0436992.description: With the library darkening, the Doctor takes on the Vashta Nerada while figuring out what links River Song to his future. Meanwhile, Donna finds out the mystery of Dr. Moon and the Girl.

0436992.title: Midnight
0436992.description: As part of a well-deserved holiday, the Doctor takes a tour on a planet called Midnight. Little does he know that something is knocking on the walls, although the planet shouldn't be inhabited. Soon the passengers begin to panic when one of them is possessed.

0436992.title: Turn Left
0436992.description: What would happen if Donna never met the Doctor? How would Earth handle the Racnoss, the falling Titanic or the Sontarans? Aided by a familiar blonde time traveler, Donna corrects the alternate time line from happening.

0436992.title: The Stolen Earth
0436992.description: The return of an old enemy leaves Earth along with 26 other planets stolen from their places. As the Doctor and Donna look for the whereabouts of Earth, former companions of the Doctor assemble a resistance against the new Dalek Empire.

0436992.title: Journey's End
0436992.description: In the wake of Davros' threat to destroy the existence of the Universe itself, the Doctor's companions unite to stop the Dalek empire. Which one will die by the prophecies and what will the fate be for the Doctor?

0436992.title: The Eleventh Hour
0436992.description: With his TARDIS in ruins, the newly-regenerated Doctor with the help of Amy Pond must save the world in less than twenty minutes from galactic policemen known as the Atraxi.

0436992.title: The Beast Below
0436992.description: The Doctor takes Amy to the future inside Starship UK, which contains in addition to British explorers, an intimidating race known as the Smilers.

0436992.title: Victory of the Daleks
0436992.description: The TARDIS takes The Doctor and Amy to war-torn Britain in the middle of World War Two. Not only do they meet Winston Churchill himself, but the Doctor comes face to face once again with his greatest enemy of all.

0436992.title: The Time of Angels
0436992.description: The Doctor and Amy emerge from the TARDIS to find the wreck of the Byzantium spaceship. Down below the Weeping Angels are stirring, but the Doctor has someone else to contend with; none other than the mysterious Professor River Song.

0436992.title: Flesh and Stone
0436992.description: The Doctor, Amy, Dr. Song and the remaining soldiers manage to escape from the crashed ship and into the forest. The Angels attempt to create a rift in time and space much as the Doctor had found in Amy's room when they first met. Amy meanwhile is counting down from 10 minutes and the Doctor has determined that an Angel has taken over her mind.

0436992.title: The Vampires of Venice
0436992.description: The Doctor and Amy cross swords in more ways than one with a horde of blood-sucking vampires in 16th century Venice.

0436992.title: Amy's Choice
0436992.description: Five years after finally leaving the TARDIS Amy and Rory now married, live in the quiet little village of Leadworth. But everything is not what it would seem.

0436992.title: The Hungry Earth
0436992.description: When a drill drills to deep into the earth, something that had been hibernating beneath the earth's crust is woken, and it's hungry for revenge.

0436992.title: Cold Blood
0436992.description: The Silurians are awake, and Angry. The Silurians are preparing for war, A war that could decide who gets to live on earth, The Silurians or-the humans..

0436992.title: Vincent and the Doctor
0436992.description: The Doctor and Amy travel back in time to meet Vincent Van Gogh and face an invisible monster that only the painter can see.

0436992.title: The Lodger
0436992.description: After the TARDIS teleports without him, the doctor tries to find out what is stopping it from landing and traces it to a seemingly ordinary, two story house.

0436992.title: The Pandorica Opens
0436992.description: River Song returns to deliver The Doctor a serious warning from his allies: the mythical Pandorica, said to contain the most feared creature in the entire Universe, is opening.

0436992.title: The Big Bang
0436992.description: The Pandorica opened, silence fell, and now planet Earth is left alone in the universe. Jumping through time, the doctor must figure out a way to bring back those who never were and save his friends from the collapse of reality.

0436992.title: A Christmas Carol
0436992.description: on Christmas eve, The doctor travels into the past of a bitter old man who has the power to save Amy and Rory but doesn't want to save them, so that he doesn't grow up to be mean and bitter.

0436992.title: The Impossible Astronaut
0436992.description: The Doctor, Amy, Rory and River Song are reunited in the Utah desert.

0436992.title: Day of the Moon
0436992.description: The Doctor and his allies mount a rebellion against invaders who have been controlling humanity from the very beginning.

0436992.title: The Curse of the Black Spot
0436992.description: The Doctor, Amy and Rory find themselves aboard a marooned pirate ship whose crew is being picked off one by one by a beautiful - and deadly - Siren.

0436992.title: The Doctor's Wife
0436992.description: The Doctor is lured to a sentient asteroid outside of the Universe by a Time Lord distress signal and soon realises his TARDIS is in grave danger.

0436992.title: The Rebel Flesh
0436992.description: A solar tsunami sends the TARDIS crew to an acid mining factory in the 22nd century, where a small team of workers come under attack from their doppelgangers.

0436992.title: The Almost People
0436992.description: The gangers and humans battle for their lives as the factory crumbles and the Doctor tries to keep the peace - can everyone make it off the island alive?

0436992.title: A Good Man Goes to War
0436992.description: A member of The Doctor's team has been abducted and he will call in every favor and maybe even go to war to get them back.

0436992.title: Let's Kill Hitler
0436992.description: The search for Melody Pond brings the Doctor and his friends to Berlin in 1938, face-to-face with Adolf Hitler, River Song and a justice-serving, shapeshifting robot.

0436992.title: Night Terrors
0436992.description: Receiving a powerful distress call from a terrified little boy, the Doctor and his friends soon find that the monsters in his cupboard are real - and deadly.

0436992.title: The Girl Who Waited
0436992.description: Amy is trapped in a quarantine facility where time moves faster than in reality, while the Doctor is confined to the TARDIS. Can Rory save his wife in time?

0436992.title: The God Complex
0436992.description: The Doctor, Amy and Rory become trapped in a hotel of horrors unable to escape and unable to find the TARDIS. The Doctor must save as many people as he can taking many twists and seeing his own worst fear.

0436992.title: Closing Time
0436992.description: The Doctor makes one last stop before his death to see an old friend. But people are disappearing, there are reports of a silver rat and metal men are lurking in the shadows.

0436992.title: The Wedding of River Song
0436992.description: April 22nd, 2011; 5:02pm. Having finally accepted his fate the Doctor travels to Lake Silencio for his final day. But one woman refuses to let time take its course.

0436992.title: The Doctor, the Widow and the Wardrobe
0436992.description: It's Christmas Eve, 1938, when Madge Arwell comes to the aid of an injured Spaceman Angel as she cycles home. He promises to repay her kindness - all she has to do is make a wish. Three years later, a devastated Madge escapes war-torn London with her two children for a dilapidated house in Dorset. She is crippled with grief at the news her husband has been lost over the channel, but determined to give Lily and Cyril the best Christmas ever. The Arwells are surprised to be greeted by a madcap caretaker whose mysterious Christmas gift leads them into a magical wintry ...

0436992.title: Asylum of the Daleks
0436992.description: Amy, Rory and the Doctor are reunited when they are kidnapped by the Daleks, who send them on a mission to destroy the most horrifying place in the universe- the asylum of the Daleks.

0436992.title: Dinosaurs on a Spaceship
0436992.description: The doctor gathers some of his old friends to help him investigate an unmanned spaceship on a crash course to earth that when it collides, will destroy it, they soon discover the ship's precious and dangerous cargo- dinosaurs.

0436992.title: A Town Called Mercy
0436992.description: The Doctor gets a Stetson (and a gun), and finds himself the reluctant Sheriff of a Western town under siege by a relentless cyborg who goes by the name of The Gunslinger. But who is he and what does he want?

0436992.title: The Power of Three
0436992.description: Earth is suddenly visited by millions of small black cubes of unknown origin. The Doctor joins Amy, Rory and Rory's father, Brian, to help discover what these cubes bring for humanity.

0436992.title: The Angels Take Manhattan
0436992.description: After Rory has an encounter with a weeping angel, the doctor and Amy travel to 1930's New York to save him, but they soon discover that the weeping angels have taken over Manhattan, and soon, maybe, the world.

0436992.title: The Snowmen
0436992.description: London, 1892. Snow is evolving, turning into icy monstrosities, but this is no concern for the Doctor whose given up trying to save the universe, leaving it to a clever young governess named Clara to save the day.

0436992.title: The Bells of Saint John
0436992.description: The doctor finds Clara in present day, where they work together to solve the mystery of people disappearing which as it turns out, has a sinister link to WiFi.

0436992.title: The Rings of Akhaten
0436992.description: The doctor takes Clara to the rings of Akheten, A partly destroyed planet, where a religious ceremony is about to be carried out, but a darkness is stirring, a hungry darkness that could consume the rings of Akhetan and the universe.

0436992.title: Cold War
0436992.description: The doctor and Clara find themselves on a Russian cold war submarine that is falling to the bottom of the ocean because of an attack by a rogue Martian warrior, that 's still aboard.

0436992.title: Hide
0436992.description: The Doctor and Clara arrive at a supposedly haunted mansion where they find a ghost hunter and a psychic who are on the search for a legendary ghost known as 'the witch of the well'

0436992.title: Journey to the Centre of the TARDIS
0436992.description: After the TARDIS is caught accidentally by an outer space trash collector, Clara is trapped deep inside of it where she finds herself on a journey through the doctor's past and her future.

0436992.title: The Crimson Horror
0436992.description: When they find a picture of the Doctor in a recently dead man's eye, it's up to Madame Vastra, Jenny and Strax to save The Doctor and find out what sinister secrets are going on at Sweetsville, Yorkshire.

0436992.title: Nightmare in Silver
0436992.description: the doctor takes Clara and the children she babysits to a rundown amusement park in space where Cybermen are hiding, and ready to invade the most precious place in the universe, The Doctor's mind.

0436992.title: The Name of the Doctor
0436992.description: The Doctor's friends are being kidnapped, which leads him to the fields of Trenzalore, where his greatest secret will be revealed and Clara's mystery will be solved.

0436992.title: The Time of the Doctor
0436992.description: The Doctor's worst enemies, The Daleks, The Cybermen, The Angels and The Silence, return, as the doctor's eleventh life comes to a close, and his twelfth life begins.

0436992.title: Deep Breath
0436992.description: When the newly-regenerated doctor arrives in Victorian London, he finds a dinosaur rampant in the Thames and a spate of deadly spontaneous combustions.

0436992.title: Into the Dalek
0436992.description: a rebel ship, surrounded by Daleks, the crew's only hope? The Doctor and Clara, who are on a mission, a mission that will send them deep inside the heart of the most dangerous place on earth- The Inside, of a Dalek.

0436992.title: Robot of Sherwood
0436992.description: In Sherwood Forest, the Doctor uncovers a sinister alien plot and forms an alliance with Robin Hood. With Nottingham at stake, the Doctor must decide who is real and who is fake.

0436992.title: Listen
0436992.description: When ghosts of past and future crowd into their lives, The Doctor and Clara are thrown into an adventure that takes them to the very end of the universe.

0436992.title: Time Heist
0436992.description: The Doctor and Clara wake up in a room with two other people, unable to remember how they got there. As it turns out Someone known as the Architect has employed them to Break into the Universe's most secure bank.

0436992.title: The Caretaker
0436992.description: The terrifying Skovox Blitzer is ready to destroy all humanity - but worse, and any second now, Danny Pink and the Doctor are going to meet.

0436992.title: Kill the Moon
0436992.description: In the near future, the Doctor and Clara find themselves on a space shuttle making a suicide mission to the Moon. Crash-landing on the lunar surface they find the most terrible things.

0436992.title: Mummy on the Orient Express
0436992.description: On the most beautiful train in history, speeding amongst the stars of the future, a deadly and immortal creature is stalking the passengers.

0436992.title: Flatline
0436992.description: A problem happens with the Tardis, trapping the Doctor inside and leaving Clara to fend for herself against a two dimensional enemy.

0436992.title: In the Forest of the Night
0436992.description: One morning in London, and every city and town in the world, the human race wakes up to the most surprising invasion yet: the trees have moved back in. Everywhere, in every land, a forest has grown and taken back the Earth.

0436992.title: Dark Water
0436992.description: In the mysterious world of the Nethersphere, plans have been drawn. Old friends and old enemies manoeuvre around the Doctor, and an impossible choice is looming over him.

0436992.title: Death in Heaven
0436992.description: With Cybermen on the streets of London, old friends unite against old enemies and the Doctor takes to the air in a startling new role. As the Doctor faces his greatest challenge, sacrifices must be made before the day is won.

0436992.title: Last Christmas
0436992.description: The Doctor and Clara face their Last Christmas. Trapped on an Arctic base, under attack from terrifying creatures, who are you going to call? Santa Claus!

0436992.title: The Magician's Apprentice
