Hank isn't so sure. Gus realizes how close he's come to being caught and in flashbacks, his entry into a world of crime and his work with the Mexican drug cartel is revealed. Hank involves Walt in his plan to track Gus' movements putting Walt ...

0903747.title: Bug
0903747.description: Hank is like a dog with a bone and keeps digging into Gus Fring's business dealings despite Walt's attempts to get him to stop. When Hank learns that Gus has a warehouse operation, Mike and a crew have to get rid of any trace of drugs on the premises. The Cartel however is lying in wait. When Jesse expresses concern over his future well-being Gus asks him over for dinner and asks him one question: can he cook Walt's recipe without Walt's assistance. Skyler meanwhile gets a visit from her old boss who reveals that he's about to undergo an IRS audit. She has to be quick...

0903747.title: Salud
0903747.description: Jesse, Gus, and Mike fly down to Mexico, and Jesse cooks the blue meth for the cartel. Walt misses his son's 16th birthday after his fight with Jesse.

0903747.title: Crawl Space
0903747.description: Hank asks Walt to drive him to the laundry where the meth lab is hidden. Ted still won't pay the IRS so Skyler asks Saul for help, and Saul sends in his A-Team. Gus and Jesse return from Mexico, and Walt fears he is in trouble with Gus.

0903747.title: End Times
0903747.description: The DEA is putting Hank and his family in protective custody, however, Walt refuses and awaits his fate in his house. Meanwhile, Brock has fallen terribly ill and Jesse suspects Walt may be behind it.

0903747.title: Face Off
0903747.description: Jesse is brought to the FBI for questioning on his knowledge of Ricin. In a last effort to kill Gus, Walt must ask for help from an old enemy.

0903747.title: Live Free or Die
0903747.description: Now that Gus is dead, Walt, Jesse, and Mike work to cover their tracks. Skyler panics when Ted Beneke wakes up.

0903747.title: Madrigal
0903747.description: Walt and Jesse decide to start things up again. Mike meets an old friend, who is worried about the outcome of the DEA's investigation on Gus and how it will affect them all.

0903747.title: Hazard Pay
0903747.description: Walt, Jesse and Mike start up business together.

0903747.title: Fifty-One
0903747.description: It's Walt's 51st birthday. His return to the drug business causes Skyler to go into depression.

0903747.title: Dead Freight
0903747.description: The boys plan on robbing a train, that has an entire car of methylamine.

0903747.title: Buyout
0903747.description: Jesse and Mike want out. They decide to sell the stolen methylamine to a competitor. That doesn't sit too well with Walt.

0903747.title: Say My Name
0903747.description: Mike and Jesse are out. Now Walt has to handle things on his own. Hank finally finds a rat in Mike's gang.

0903747.title: Gliding Over All
0903747.description: Walt expands his business overseas, and the money is pouring in.

0903747.title: Blood Money
0903747.description: Walt is out of the meth business and trying to move on with his life. Jesse tries to get rid of his money. Hank now knows that Walt is the famous Heisenberg.

0903747.title: Buried
0903747.description: Hank is determined to bring down Walt. Walt scrambles to hide evidence before Hank gets to it, and Skyler tries to stop Hank and Marie from taking away the kids.

0903747.title: Confessions
0903747.description: Walt makes his next move against Hank, putting Hank in a tough position. Hank confronts Jesse and attempts to turn him against Walt, and Jesse decides it's time to move on. Meanwhile, Todd has taken over the business.

0903747.title: Rabid Dog
0903747.description: Walt discovers Jesse broke into his house and attempted to burn it down. Walt wants to protect his family so he moves them into a hotel for a few nights. Jesse decides to work with Hank in order to take down Walt.

0903747.title: To'hajiilee
0903747.description: Jesse and Hank come up with an idea to take Walt down. Walt hires Todd's uncle to kill Jesse.

0903747.title: Ozymandias
0903747.description: Walt goes on the run. Jesse is taken hostage. Skyler believes it's time to tell Flynn the truth.

0903747.title: Granite State
0903747.description: Walt struggles as he adapts to aspects of his new identity. Jesse plans an escape against Jack and his crew.

0903747.title: Felina
0903747.description: Walt ties up whatever loose ends are left as the end draws near.

0932071.title: The Country and the City - 1609-1825
0932071.description: Episode one begins in 1609 and chronicles the arrival of the Dutch.

0932071.title: Order and Disorder - 1825-1865
0932071.description: Episode two looks at New York's rise as a burgeoning cultural center and multi-ethnic port.

0932071.title: Sunshine and Shadow - 1865-1898
0932071.description: Episode three turns the spotlight on greed and wealth.

0932071.title: The Power and the People - 1898-1918
0932071.description: Episode four follows New York into a new century.

0932071.title: Cosmopolis - 1919-1931
0932071.description: Episode five tells the African-American experience and the birth of the new media industries.

0932071.title: City of Tomorrow - 1929-1941
0932071.description: Episode six chronicles the dramatic and increasingly fateful events following the crash of 1929.

0932071.title: The City and the World - 1945-2000
0932071.description: Episode seven follows the turbulent and often harrowing years from 1945 to 2000.

0932071.title: The Center of the World - 1946-2003
0932071.description: Episode eight describes the rise and fall of the Twin Towers, from their construction in the 1960's to 9/11/2001.

0944947.title: Winter Is Coming
0944947.description: Eddard Stark is torn between his family and an old friend when asked to serve at the side of King Robert Baratheon; Viserys plans to wed his sister to a nomadic warlord in exchange for an army.

0944947.title: The Kingsroad
0944947.description: While Bran recovers from his fall, Ned takes only his daughters to King's Landing. Jon Snow goes with his uncle Benjen to the Wall. Tyrion joins them.

0944947.title: Lord Snow
0944947.description: Jon begins his training with the Night's Watch; Ned confronts his past and future at King's Landing; Daenerys finds herself at odds with Viserys.

0944947.title: Cripples, Bastards, and Broken Things
0944947.description: Eddard investigates Jon Arryn's murder. Jon befriends Samwell Tarly, a coward who has come to join the Night's Watch.

0944947.title: The Wolf and the Lion
0944947.description: Catelyn has captured Tyrion and plans to bring him to her sister, Lysa Arryn, at the Vale, to be tried for his, supposed, crimes against Bran. Robert plans to have Daenerys killed, but Eddard refuses to be a part of it and quits.

0944947.title: A Golden Crown
0944947.description: While recovering from his battle with Jaime, Eddard is forced to run the kingdom while Robert goes hunting. Tyrion demands a trial by combat for his freedom. Viserys is losing his patience with Drogo.

0944947.title: You Win or You Die
0944947.description: Robert has been injured while hunting and is dying. Jon and the others finally take their vows to the Night's Watch. A man, sent by Robert, is captured for trying to poison Daenerys. Furious, Drogo vows to attack the Seven Kingdoms.

0944947.title: The Pointy End
0944947.description: The Lannisters press their advantage over the Starks; Robb rallies his father's northern allies and heads south to war; The White Walkers attack the Wall; Tyrion returns to his father with some new friends.

0944947.title: Baelor
0944947.description: Robb goes to war against the Lannisters. Jon finds himself struggling on deciding if his place is with Robb or the Night's Watch. Drogo has fallen ill from a fresh battle wound. Daenerys is desperate to save him.

0944947.title: Fire and Blood
0944947.description: Robb vows to get revenge on the Lannisters. Jon must officially decide if his place is with Robb or the Night's Watch. Daenerys says her final goodbye to Drogo.

0944947.title: The North Remembers
0944947.description: Tyrion arrives at King's Landing to take his father's place as Hand of the King. Stannis Baratheon plans to take the Iron Throne for his own. Robb tries to decide his next move in the war. The Night's Watch arrive at the house of Craster.

0944947.title: The Night Lands
0944947.description: Arya makes friends with Gendry. Tyrion tries to take control of the Small Council. Theon arrives at his home, Pyke, in order to persuade his father into helping Robb with the war. Jon tries to investigate Craster's secret.

0944947.title: What Is Dead May Never Die
0944947.description: Tyrion tries to see who he can trust in the Small Council. Catelyn visits Renly to try and persuade him to join Robb in the war. Theon must decide if his loyalties lie with his own family or with Robb.

0944947.title: Garden of Bones
0944947.description: Lord Baelish arrives at Renly's camp just before he faces off against Stannis. Daenerys and her company are welcomed into the city of Qarth. Arya, Gendry, and Hot Pie find themselves imprisoned at Harrenhal.

0944947.title: The Ghost of Harrenhal
0944947.description: Tyrion investigates a secret weapon that King Joffrey plans to use against Stannis. Meanwhile, as a token for saving his life, Jaqen H'ghar offers to kill three people that Arya chooses.

0944947.title: The Old Gods and the New
0944947.description: Theon seizes control of Winterfell. Jon captures a wildling, named Ygritte. The people of King's Landing begin to turn against King Joffrey. Daenerys looks to buy ships to sail for the Seven Kingdoms.

0944947.title: A Man Without Honor
0944947.description: Bran and Rickon have escaped Winterfell. Theon tries to hunt them down. Daenerys' dragons have been stolen. Jon travels through the wilderness with Ygritte as his prisoner. Sansa has bled and is now ready to have Joffrey's children.

0944947.title: The Prince of Winterfell
0944947.description: Stannis is just days from King's Landing. Tyrion prepares for his arrival. Jon and Qhorin are taken prisoner by the wildlings. Catelyn is arrested for releasing Jaime. Arya, Gendry, and Hot Pie plan to escape from Harrenhal.

0944947.title: Blackwater
0944947.description: Stannis Baratheon's fleet and army arrive at King's Landing and the battle for the city begins. Cersei plans for her and her children's future.

0944947.title: Valar Morghulis
0944947.description: Joffrey puts Sansa aside for Margaery Tyrell. Robb marries Talisa Maegyr. Jon prepares to meet Mance Rayder. Arya says farewell to Jaqen H'ghar. Daenerys tries to rescue her dragons.

0944947.title: Valar Dohaeris
0944947.description: Jon is brought before Mance Rayder, the King Beyond the Wall, while the Night's Watch survivors retreat south. In King's Landing, Tyrion asks for his reward. Littlefinger offers Sansa a way out.

0944947.title: Dark Wings, Dark Words
0944947.description: Bran and company meet Jojen and Meera Reed. Arya, Gendry, and Hot Pie meet the Brotherhood. Jaime travels through the wilderness with Brienne. Sansa confesses her true feelings about Joffery to Margaery.

0944947.title: Walk of Punishment
0944947.description: Robb and Catelyn arrive at Riverrun for Lord Hoster Tully's funeral. Tywin names Tyrion the new Master of Coin. Arya says goodbye to Hot Pie. The Night's Watch returns to Craster's. Brienne and Jaime are taken prisoner.

0944947.title: And Now His Watch Is Ended
0944947.description: Jaime mopes over his lost hand. Cersei is growing uncomfortable with the Tyrells. The Night's Watch is growing impatient with Craster. Daenerys buys the Unsullied.

0944947.title: Kissed by Fire
0944947.description: Robb's army is falling apart. Jaime reveals a story, to Brienne, that he has never told anyone. Jon breaks his vows. The Hound is granted his freedom. The Lannisters hatch a new plan.

0944947.title: The Climb
0944947.description: Jon and the wildlings scale the Wall. The Brotherhood sells Gendry to Melisandre. Robb does what he can to win back the Freys. Tyrion tells Sansa about their engagement.

0944947.title: The Bear and the Maiden Fair
0944947.description: Jon and the wildlings travel south of the Wall. Talisa tells Robb that she's pregnant. Arya runs away from the Brotherhood. Daenerys arrives at Yunkai. Jaime leaves Brienne behind at Harrenhal.

0944947.title: Second Sons
0944947.description: Daenerys tries to persuade the Second Sons to join her against Yunkai. Stannis releases Davos from the dungeons. Sam and Gilly are attacked by a White Walker. Sansa and Tyrion wed.

0944947.title: The Rains of Castamere
0944947.description: Robb and Catelyn arrive at the Twins for the wedding. Jon is put to the test to see where his loyalties truly lie. Bran's group decides to split up. Daenerys plans an invasion of Yunkai.

0944947.title: Mhysa
0944947.description: Bran and company travel beyond the Wall. Sam returns to Castle Black. Jon says goodbye to Ygritte. Jaime returns to King's Landing. The Night's Watch asks for help from Stannis.

0944947.title: Two Swords
0944947.description: Tyrion welcomes a guest to King's Landing. At Castle Black, Jon stands trial. Daenerys is pointed to Meereen, the mother of all slave cities. Arya runs into an old enemy.

0944947.title: The Lion and the Rose
0944947.description: Joffrey and Margaery's wedding has come. Tyrion breaks up with Shae. Ramsay tries to prove his worth to his father. Bran and company find a Weirwood tree.

0944947.title: Breaker of Chains
0944947.description: Tyrion is arrested for the murder of Joffrey and awaits trial. Sansa escapes King's Landing. Sam sends Gilly to Mole's Town as the Night's Watch finds itself in a tight spot. Meereen challenges Daenerys.

0944947.title: Oathkeeper
0944947.description: Jaime entrusts a task to Brienne. Daenerys frees Meereen. Jon is given permission to lead a group of Night's Watchmen to Craster's Keep. Bran and company are taken hostage.

0944947.title: First of His Name
0944947.description: Tommen is crowned King of the Seven Kingdoms. Cersei builds her case against Tyrion. Sansa and Lord Baelish arrive at the Eyrie. The Night's Watch attacks Craster's Keep.

0944947.title: The Laws of Gods and Men
0944947.description: Tyrion's trial has come. Yara and her troops storm the Dreadfort to free Theon. Daenerys meets Hizdar zo Loraq. Stannis makes a deal with the Iron Bank of Braavos.

0944947.title: Mockingbird
0944947.description: Tyrion tries to find a champion. Daenerys sleeps with Daario. The Hound becomes wounded. Jon's advice is ignored at Castle Black. Brienne and Podrick receive a tip on Arya's whereabouts.

0944947.title: The Mountain and the Viper
0944947.description: Theon helps Ramsay seize Moat Cailin. The wildlings attack Mole's Town. Sansa comes up with a story to protect Lord Baelish. Daenerys finds out a secret about Jorah Mormont. Oberyn Martell faces Gregor Clegane, the Mountain.

0944947.title: The Watchers on the Wall
0944947.description: The battle between the Night's Watch and the wildlings has come.

0944947.title: The Children
0944947.description: Jon makes an important decision. Daenerys experiences new consequences. Brienne and Podrick have an unexpected encounter. Bran achieves a goal, while Tyrion makes an important discovery.

0944947.title: The Wars to Come
0944947.description: Cersei and Jaime adjust to a world without Tywin. Tyrion and Varys arrive at Pentos. In Meereen, a new enemy emerges. Jon is caught between two kings.

0944947.title: The House of Black and White
0944947.description: Arya arrives in Braavos. Jaime takes on a secret mission. Ellaria Sand seeks revenge for Oberyn's death. Stannis makes Jon a generous offer as the Night's Watch elects a new Lord Commander. Daenerys is faced with a difficult decision.

0944947.title: High Sparrow
0944947.description: Tommen and Margaery wed. Arya has trouble adapting to her new life. Littlefinger reveals his plans to Sansa. Jon gives his first orders as Lord Commander. Tyrion and Varys arrive in Volantis.

0944947.title: Sons of the Harpy
0944947.description: Jorah Mormont sets sail alongside his prisoner, Tyrion. Cersei makes a move against the Tyrells. Jaime and Bronn sneak into Dorne. Ellaria and the Sand Snakes make their plans. Melisandre tempts Jon. The Harpies attack.

0944947.title: Kill the Boy
0944947.description: Daenerys arrests the heads of Meereen's great families. Jon makes a difficult decision. Theon is forced to face Sansa. Stannis rides south. Tyrion and Jorah enter the ruins of Old Valyria.

0944947.title: Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken
0944947.description: Arya is put to the test. Tyrion and Jorah are captured by slavers. Loras Tyrell is judged by the Sparrows. Jaime and Bronn face the Sand Snakes. Sansa marries Ramsay Bolton.

0944947.title: The Gift
0944947.description: Jon heads east as trouble begins to stir for Sam and Gilly at Castle Black. Sansa asks Theon for help. Tyrion and Jorah are sold as slaves. Cersei savors her triumph over the Tyrells as new plots are developed in the shadows.

0944947.title: Hardhome
0944947.description: Tyrion advises Daenerys. Sansa forces Theon to tell her a secret. Cersei remains stubborn. Arya meets her first target. Jon and Tormund meet with the wildling elders.

0944947.title: The Dance of Dragons
0944947.description: Jon and the wildlings return to Castle Black. Jaime meets with Doran Martell. Stannis makes a hard choice. Arya runs into Meryn Trant. Daenerys attends the grand reopening of the fighting pits.

0944947.title: Mother's Mercy
0944947.description: Stannis arrives at Winterfell. Tyrion runs Meereen as Daario and Jorah go after Daenerys. Jaime and Myrcella leave Dorne. Jon sends Sam and Gilly to Oldtown. Arya challenges the Many-Faced God. Cersei confesses her sins.

0944947.title: The Red Woman
0944947.description: The fate of Jon Snow is revealed. Daenerys is brought before Khal Moro. Tyrion gets used to living in Meereen. Ramsay sends his dogs after Theon and Sansa. Ellaria and the Sand Snakes make their move. Cersei mourns for Myrcella.

0944947.title: Home
0944947.description: Bran trains with the Three-Eyed Raven. Tommen meets with Cersei. Tyrion makes a bold move. Theon leaves while at Pyke new issues arise. Ramsay's brother is born. Davos asks Melisandre for a miracle.

0944947.title: Oathbreaker
0944947.description: Daenerys arrives at Vaes Dothrak. Sam and Gilly sail for Horn Hill. Arya trains as No One. Varys finds information on the Sons of the Harpy. Ramsay receives a gift. Tommen meets with the High Sparrow. At Castle Black, a miracle occurs.

0944947.title: Book of the Stranger
0944947.description: Sansa arrives at Castle Black. Tyrion makes a deal with the slave masters. Jorah and Daario sneak into Vaes Dothrak. Ramsay sends a letter to Jon. Theon arrives at Pyke. Cersei and Olenna Tyrell plot against the High Sparrow.

0944947.title: The Door
0944947.description: Sansa and Jon make plans. Arya is given another chance to prove herself. Jorah confesses a secret to Daenerys. Tyrion meets with a red priestess. Yara finds her rule tested. Bran discovers the origin of the White Walkers.

0944947.title: Blood of My Blood
0944947.description: Bran and Meera find a new ally. Gilly meets Sam's family. Arya makes a difficult choice. The Lannisters and Tyrells march against the High Sparrow.

0944947.title: The Broken Man
0944947.description: Jon and Sansa gather troops. Jaime arrives at Riverrun. Olenna Tyrell plans to leave King's Landing. Theon and Yara plan a destination. Arya makes plans to leave.

0944947.title: No One
0944947.description: Brienne arrives at Riverrun. Arya seeks shelter. Jaime meets with Edmure Tully. Cersei challenges the Faith. Sandor Clegane hunts for revenge. Tyrion faces the consequences of earlier decisions.

0944947.title: Battle of the Bastards
0944947.description: Jon and Sansa face Ramsay Bolton on the fields of Winterfell. Daenerys strikes back at her enemies. Theon and Yara arrive in Meereen.

0944947.title: The Winds of Winter
0944947.description: Cersei and Loras Tyrell stand trial by the gods. Daenerys prepares to set sail for Westeros. Davos confronts Melisandre. Sam and Gilly arrive in the Citadel. Bran discovers a long-kept secret. Lord Frey has an uninvited guest.

0944947.title: Dragonstone
0944947.description: Jon organizes the North's defenses. Cersei tries to even the odds. Daenerys comes home. Arya reminds the Freys "the North remembers." Sam adapts to life in Oldtown. The Night King makes his way south.

0944947.title: Stormborn
0944947.description: Daenerys receives an unexpected visitor. Jon faces resistance. Tyrion plans the conquest of Westeros. Cersei gathers her allies. Arya has a reunion with old friends. Sam risks his career and life.

0944947.title: The Queen's Justice
0944947.description: Jon and Daenerys finally meet. Cersei gains a new ally. Sansa receives an unexpected visitor. Sam is confronted for his actions.

0944947.title: The Spoils of War
0944947.description: Daenerys takes matters into her own hands. Arya reaches her destination. Jaime and Bronn collect the spoils from the war with the Tyrells.

0944947.title: Eastwatch
0944947.description: Daenerys demands loyalty from the surviving Lannister soldiers; Jon heeds Bran's warning about White Walkers on the move; Cersei vows to vanquish anyone or anything that stands in her way.

0944947.title: Beyond the Wall
0944947.description: Jon and his team go beyond the wall to capture a wight. Daenerys has to make a tough decision.

0944947.title: The Dragon and the Wolf
0944947.description: Everyone meets in King's Landing to discuss the fate of the realm. In Winterfell, Sansa confronts Arya. Sam reaches Winterfell, where he and Bran discover a shocking secret about Jon Snow.

0944947.title: Winterfell
0944947.description: Jon and Daenerys arrive in Winterfell and are met with skepticism. Sam learns about the fate of his family. Cersei gives Euron the reward he aims for. Theon follows his heart.

0944947.title: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
0944947.description: Jaime faces judgment and Winterfell prepares for the battle to come.

0944947.title: The Long Night
0944947.description: The Night King and his army have arrived at Winterfell and the great battle begins.

0944947.title: The Last of the Starks
0944947.description: The Battle of Winterfell is over and a new chapter for Westeros begins.

0944947.title: The Bells
0944947.description: Forces have arrived at King's Landing for the final battle.

0944947.title: The Iron Throne
0944947.description: In the aftermath of the devastating attack on King's Landing, Daenerys must face the survivors.

0965394.title: Sanctuary for All: Part 1
0965394.description: When called to the scene of a horrendous crime Will sees that the police are not being told the whole truth. His insights into the case attract the interest of Dr. Helen Magnus who introduces him to her sanctuary for 'abnormals,' creatures that have remained hidden from most of the world only appearing occasionally as characters in stories and myths.

0965394.title: Sanctuary for All: Part 2
0965394.description: While Will continues to work with Alexei, Dr. Magnus has a visitor from her past with a terrible secret.

0965394.title: Fata Morgana
0965394.description: When Dr. Magnus, Will and Ashley rescue three entombed women Will struggles to accept that the women are suffering from anything more than a group delusion, Dr. Magnus suspects that the women are much more than they appear.

0965394.title: Folding Man
0965394.description: After thieves make a dramatic escape that baffles police Dr. Magnus suspects an abnormal's involvement. The robbery reminds Will of an old FBI case he could not solve; but this time he will.

0965394.title: Kush
0965394.description: After capturing a particularly elusive abnormal the plane carrying Dr. Magnus and Will crashes while transporting the creature. Dr. Magnus and Will soon discover why this abnormal has never been captured before.

0965394.title: Nubbins
0965394.description: Dr. Magnus, Ashley and Will retrieve two species of abnormal that have the ability to camouflage so well that they are near invisible. One appears to be a vicious predator, the other a cute, furry animal but nothing is as it appears.

0965394.title: The Five
0965394.description: Dr. Magnus learns that the Cabal are planning revenge for the kidnap of the Morrigan while something has come between Dr. Magnus, Ashley and Will.

0965394.title: Edward
0965394.description: Henry comes to terms with his abnormal side, Ashley works through her feelings about her parents, and Will helps a young autistic man whose father possibly shot himself.

0965394.title: Requiem
0965394.description: Dr. Magnus' life is put in jeopardy when the team answers a call for help from within the Bermuda Triangle.

0965394.title: Warriors
0965394.description: When an old friend of Will's goes missing his wife contacts him for help. With the help of Helen and Ashley, Will finds that his friend has been taken and forced to fight underground. But as they continue to search, things start to become quite familiar to Helen.

0965394.title: Instinct
0965394.description: Desperate to get her first exclusive story, a reporter and her cameraman sneak inside an evacuated building. Inside they find Dr. Magnus and her team, and a creature greater than any of them were prepared for.

0965394.title: Revelations, Part 1
0965394.description: In an unprecedented alliance Druitt and Sherlock Holmes work with Sanctuary to deduce why normally placid abnormals are running amok. Their plan, infiltrate their prime suspect, The Cabal.

0965394.title: Revelations, Part 2
0965394.description: With Ashley and Henry in the hands of the Cabal the rest of the team venture to a remote vampire enclave to recover the last known sample of vampire blood; the power they need to defeat the Cabal.

0965394.title: End of Nights: Part 1
0965394.description: In the wake of an unexpected betrayal, the Sanctuary must pull together to figure out the Cabal's master scheme in time to save those closest to them and the whole world.

0965394.title: End of Nights: Part 2
0965394.description: The Cabal's new "Super-Abnormals" begin destroying Sanctuaries around the world. It won't be long before they launch their attack on the Old City Sanctuary, and Magnus must choose between saving Ashley and saving the Sanctuary Network.

0965394.title: Eulogy
0965394.description: Kate accidentally sets loose a baby Abnormal that she and Henry discover grows very quickly. Meanwhile, Magnus searches desperately for a way to bring back Ashley.

0965394.title: Hero
0965394.description: The Sanctuary team hunts down a man who seems to have superpowers, calling himself "The Adjuster." But they discover that his suit is the source of his power, and it is slowly killing him. But he can't get it off.

0965394.title: Pavor Nocturnus
0965394.description: When Dr. Magnus awakes to darkness, she must face a destroyed Sanctuary, city, and even world. But beneath the apocalypse, something deeper awaits her discovery if she can find it in time.

0965394.title: Fragments
0965394.description: A research scientist working for the Sanctuary Network is brutally attacked by an abnormal. While Helen Magnus tries to save the life of the scientist, the team investigates the origin of the attacker's uncharacteristically brutal behavior.

0965394.title: Veritas
0965394.description: When Bigfoot is discovered dead, all of the evidence points to Magnus. Will, Henry, and Kate must find a way to clear her name and find out who actually committed the crime before she is replaced.

0965394.title: Next Tuesday
0965394.description: While transporting a usually docile abnormal, Magnus's helicopter crashes, leaving her and Will stranded in the shaft of an abandoned oil rig. They soon find they are not alone in the water.

0965394.title: Penance
0965394.description: While an old friend of Magnus', a pouched abnormal named Jimmy, is handing over a fire elemental to the Sanctuary team, they are attacked by a gang of criminal abnormals from Chicago. The situation presents a lot of mysteries to be solved and quickly.

0965394.title: Sleepers
0965394.description: When rich youngsters begin to disappear after an apparent death and then come back to life, the trail leads Will & Magnus to a drug clinic in Mexico run by Nicola Tesla. Knowing his all-times plans, big trouble to be expected.

0965394.title: Haunted
0965394.description: When a ship full of Zulu empaths suddenly goes to wreck, John Duitt rescues them as a favor to Magnus. However a bitter discovery awaits her: his dark side is alive again and can even have a life of its own!

0965394.title: Kali: Part I
0965394.description: After peaceful Abnormals worldwide act up at the same moment, the incident is linked to an EM pulse originating in Mumbai. Will and Kate go to investigate, and they soon discover that the event may relate to a dangerously-powerful Abnormal.

0965394.title: Kali: Part II
0965394.description: Will begins to experience strange visions that are connected to the Cult of Kali. Magnus has difficulty with finding the solution to their problems.

0965394.title: Kali: Part III
0965394.description: Big Bertha is not happy, but Dr. Magnus has a suggestion for how Will might once again be able to contact her, through her Kali avatar. Third and final installment of the Kali trilogy.

0965394.title: Firewall
0965394.description: Will is having trouble recovering after his experience with Kali, but the team soon finds that insomnia is the least of his problems. Helen discovers an unbelievable gift from an equally unbelievable source.

0965394.title: Bank Job
0965394.description: When a deadly Abnormal hatches prematurely inside a bank vault and escapes, Kate, Will, and Helen must stage a hold-up to buy themselves time to search for the Abnormal before somebody dies.

0965394.title: Trail of Blood
0965394.description: The team gets a cryptic distress call that could only come from one person...Nikola Tesla (JONATHAN YOUNG).

0965394.title: Hero II: Broken Arrow
0965394.description: During an attempt by the creator of the suit to get the suit back, it latches onto Kate, who runs away to use it for her own purposes. Magnus turns to Walter to help get the suit, and Kate, back before the creator does.

0965394.title: Animus
0965394.description: While Magnus and Nikola Tesla are busy experimenting with the holographic map Henry and Will go to England to investigate werewolf sightings.

0965394.title: Breach
0965394.description: Another abnormal rendezvous goes awry, this time in a way no one could have ever seen coming.

0965394.title: For King and Country
0965394.description: With an old foe of Helen's in need of lifesaving treatment, Will learns more about the Five than he ever imagined could be true.

0965394.title: Vigilante
0965394.description: With Helen growing sicker by the day, Will must make some tough decisions; first about Adam, then about finding the real puppet master behind Father Jensen's death.

0965394.title: Hollow Men
0965394.description: The expedition to Hollow Earth is on, as the team searches for a way to cure Dr. Magnus. But instead of salvation, they may find something more sinister waiting below. Special appearance by Polly Walker from Caprica.

0965394.title: Pax Romana
0965394.description: When Hollow Earth faces much bigger threats than intruders from the surface, they must choose unlikely allies for help.

0965394.title: Hangover
0965394.description: Magnus (AMANDA TAPPING) returns home from an overnight trip to find the Sanctuary in a state of confounding chaos: Battle debris everywhere, no one in sight, and a scheduled UN Security Team inspection just hours away.

0965394.title: One Night
0965394.description: What started as an innocent first date for Will (ROBIN DUNNE) and Abby (PASCALE HUTTON), turns into a dangerous kidnapping by a gang whose leader faces certain death without their help.

0965394.title: Metamorphosis
0965394.description: Something is happening to Will, and it's up to the rest of the team to figure out what and how to stop it. Help may come from a surprising source.

0965394.title: Wingman
0965394.description: Will and Henry have dates, but fate (and a lepidoptera hominid) has other plans.

0965394.title: Awakening
0965394.description: Helen and Nikola explore an ancient Praxian stronghold, and find a little more than they were expecting. Meanwhile, Kate's past comes back to haunt her.

0965394.title: Normandy
0965394.description: Look back on younger days with the Five as they take on Nazis in 1944.

0965394.title: Carentan
0965394.description: The Sanctuary receives reports of unexplained disappearances in Carentan in the Normandy region of France and sets off to investigate the strange occurrences.

0965394.title: Out of the Blue
0965394.description: Helen and Will seem to have the perfect lives, careers, and marriages? Underneath suburbia, something lurks.

0965394.title: Into the Black
0965394.description: The exodus from Hollow Earth begins, and time is of the essence as the Sanctuary stands between the abnormal refuges and the demanding UN. As they try to maintain peace, Helen receives a surprising warning from an unexpected source.

0965394.title: Tempus
0965394.description: Adam Worth destroys Praxis and travels back in time to the 1890s to save his daughter. Dr. Magnus travels back in time to stop him before he damages the time line and destroys her future with it.

0965394.title: Uprising
0965394.description: With Magnus gone, Will is appointed the head of the Sanctuary Network. The abnormal uprising continues to get worse. Biggie and Kate are kidnapped. As expected the surface governments respond to the uprising with deadly force.

0965394.title: Untouchable
0965394.description: The UN Security Council sends a task force headed by a weasel of a man, Greg Addison, to investigate the Sanctuary. His disdain for abnormals is matched by the disdain that Magnus and team have for him.

0965394.title: Monsoon
0965394.description: Since the UN no longer backs the Sanctuary, Magnus makes other arrangements for her finances. A planned meeting in Africa with a potential banker turns into a hostage situation. Will and Henry search for an abnormal in the Old City tunnels.

0965394.title: Resistance
0965394.description: Helen and Henry break into a government abnormal research facility called SCIU - only to find it is run by Tesla. Biggie and Will deal with an annoying abnormal named Galvo.

0965394.title: Homecoming
0965394.description: Will's trip to Liberia turns bad when he suffers a head trauma from an attack. The trauma brings up powerful memories about his mothers death and the inadequacies of his father. Magnus deals with be-winged scam artist.

0965394.title: Icebreaker
0965394.description: Henry and Declan lead a team to rescue a crew of a Russian icebreaker and the abnormal passengers.

0965394.title: Fugue
0965394.description: FBI Agent Abby Corrigan's life is endangered after she is suddenly attacked by an unfamiliar abnormal during an investigation; Magnus and Will's heated debate over the best way to help Abby threatens to permanently alter their relationship.

0965394.title: Chimera
0965394.description: There is a sentient organic nanite causing havoc in the computer system in the Sanctuary. Magnus and Tesla connect their minds to the system in an effort to isolate the nanite. They find Adam Worth instead.

0965394.title: Acolyte
0965394.description: A radical group of abnormal beings plan a terrorist attack with the goal of starting a war between surface dwellers and hollow Earth inhabitants. To Magnus' disbelief, Addison, at the NSA, has proof of Biggie's leadership of the group.

0965394.title: The Depths
0965394.description: When Magnus and Will learn of a plan to capture very rare and dangerous Abnormal, they travel to a remote cave to prevent then hunt.

0965394.title: Sanctuary for None - Part I
0965394.description: When the Sanctuary is approached by an abnormal leader about a radical plan for peace, Magnus goes all in and pledges her full support. However, when Will is forced to leave the Sanctuary, his decision may just put everyone at risk.

0965394.title: Sanctuary for None: Part II
0965394.description: SCIU has surrounded the 5th Ward with troops and an electric shield that prevents them from leaving. Caleb has a virus that can turn the human population into abnormals. Magnus enacts her ultimate plan for the Sanctuary network.

0995055.title: Native American Healing in the 21st Century
Our Spirits Don't Speak English: Indian Boarding School

0996994.title: A Necessary War: December 1941 - December 1942
0996994.description: This series profiles World War II as seen primarily through the eyes of people living in just four U.S. Cities. This episode details an antebellum period before the attack on Pearl Harbor, that attack, the fall of the Phillipines, the Bataan Death March and the fighting at Guadalcanal.

0996994.title: When Things Get Tough: January 1943 - December 1943
0996994.description: Americans mobilize for total war at home and overseas. Factories hum around the clock, while in North Africa and then Italy, inexperienced GIs learn how to fight. Meanwhile, in the skies over Europe, thousands of American airmen gamble their lives against preposterous odds on daylight bombing missions.

0996994.title: A Deadly Calling: November 1943 - June 1944
0996994.description: Americans are shocked by terrible losses on the Pacific atoll of Tarawa, while in Italy Allied forces are stalled for months at Monte Cassino and a risky landing at Anzio fails utterly. At home, as overcrowded "war towns" boom, economic transformation leads to confrontation and ugly racial violence.

0996994.title: Pride of Our Nation: June 1944 - August 1944
0996994.description: On June 6, 1944, D-Day, 1.5 million Allied troops take part in the greatest invasion in history, but then bog down in the Norman hedgerows for weeks. Saipan proves the costliest Pacific battle to date, while back home dreaded telegrams from the War Department begin arriving at an inconceivable rate.

0996994.title: FUBAR: September 1944 - December 1944
0996994.description: Victory in Europe seems imminent, but in Holland, the Vosges Mountains, and the Hurtgen Forest, GIs learn painful lessons as old as war itself--that generals make plans, plans go wrong and soldiers die. Meanwhile, on the island of Peleliu, the Marines fight one of the most brutal, and unnecessary, battles of the Pacific.

0996994.title: The Ghost Front: December 1944 - March 1945
0996994.description: Americans are shocked by Hitler's massive counterattack in the Ardennes Forest--but by mid March, 1945, they are across the Rhine, while the Russians are 50 miles from Berlin. In the Pacific, after weeks of desperate fighting, Iwo Jima is secured, and American bombers begin a full-fledged air assault on Japan.

0996994.title: A World Without War: March 1945 - September 1945
0996994.description: A few weeks after the death of President Roosevelt shocks the country, Germany surrenders. Meanwhile, American sailors, soldiers and Marines endure the worst battle of the Pacific--Okinawa. In August, American planes drop atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki, and the Japanese, too, surrender. Millions return home--to try to learn how to live in a world without war.

10313446.title: The telescope
10313446.description: Meet the brilliant minds throughout history, from Galileo to Edwin Hubble, responsible for creating the telescope. Today, their invention allows humanity to reach the furthest limits of seeing - 13 billion light-years out.

10313446.title: The airplane
10313446.description: Take to the sky with the dreamers whose work gave humans the ability to fly. From Leonardo da Vinci's 'flying machines' to the modern commercial plane, without these inventions, we may have never left the ground.

10313446.title: The Robot
10313446.description: Learn how robots were first conceptualized in ancient Rome and see how their use has evolved over the centuries, from the calculator to the Roomba. Then, take a sneak peek at what future robots will be able to do.

10313446.title: The Rocket
10313446.description: Learn the explosive history of the rocket, from its origin in ancient China, to its use as a weapon of war, to how adding hydrogen allowed it to carry astronauts all the way to the moon.

1051155.title: Secrets of the Sun
1051155.description: The physical processes driving the energetic dynamics of the Sun and the resulting impact on the earth are examined.

1051155.title: Mars: The Red Planet
1051155.description: Program recaps the basic knowledge about Mars normally covered in high school.

1051155.title: The End of the Earth
1051155.description: A few of the cosmic threats to life on earth reviewed include meteors, gamma ray bursts and, in the distant future, evolution of the sun.

1051155.title: Jupiter: The Giant Planet
1051155.description: The Universe examines the stormy gas giant Jupiter and its mini-solar system of over 60 moons.

1051155.title: The Moon
1051155.description: The unique features of Earth's moon and the processes that shaped it are described. Past theories of the Moon's formation are also presented.

1051155.title: Spaceship Earth
1051155.description: Take a high performance ride through the formation of the third planet from the Sun, Earth. A survivor of one of the most violent "neighborhoods" in the universe, learn how earth was created and discover what creatures hold clues to how life began.

1051155.title: Inner Planets
1051155.description: Contrasts the radical differences between Earth and the planets Venus and Mercury. Lessons for life on earth are presented.

1051155.title: Saturn
1051155.description: Program takes a brief look at the dynamics of Saturn's rings before exploring the unique and amazing features of the planet itself, including the curious behavior at the poles, and recent discoveries about Saturn's exotic moons.

1051155.title: Alien Galaxies
1051155.description: How the various structural types of galaxies form by merging with smaller galaxies is explained and simulated. The preliminary hints at the importance of dark matter in the process are mentioned.

1051155.title: Life and Death of a Star
1051155.description: Gravity plays a crucial role in both the birth and death of stars in this detailed review. Various types of stellar collisions are simulated.

1051155.title: The Outer Planets
1051155.description: New discoveries regarding the Outer Planets are creating a fundamental rethinking of our solar system. Uranus is a toxic combination of hydrogen, helium and methane. Scientists speculate that the planet was knocked on its side after colliding with another body. Neptune's largest moon, Triton, is cold and barren, but some scientists speculate that liquid water might exist under Triton's icy surface. If this is proven true, Triton could be the home to one of the biggest discoveries of all time. Cold and inhospitable, Pluto completes one orbit around the solar system ...

1051155.title: Most Dangerous Places
1051155.description: Scientist describe the current understanding of exotic stars; magnetars, black holes and quasars with an obsession about how they would kill you. Galaxy collisions are simulated.

1051155.title: Search for E.T.
1051155.description: In a galaxy filled with a billion stars, in a universe filled with a hundred billion galaxies--are we alone? SETI--the Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence--is a privately funded project using radio telescopes.

1051155.title: Beyond the Big Bang
1051155.description: The universe began with a massive expansion, billions and billions of years ago, and it continues to expand with every passing second. The idea that the universe, and man's very existence, began with a "Big Bang" is no longer a topic of debate among most scientists--it is essentially taken as fact.

1051155.title: Alien Planets
1051155.description: Astronomers who search for extrasolar planets were once thought of as crack-pots but are now at the forefront of astronomical research. The various methods used to locate and research these planets and the unexpected diversity of these bodies are described.

1051155.title: Cosmic Holes
1051155.description: Black holes, white holes and worm holes are all consistent with Einstein's theory of General Relativity. Of the three, actual evidence exists only for black holes. Their behavior is explained. Scientists speculate on on whether white holes and worm holes exist and how they would behave.

1051155.title: Mysteries of the Moon
1051155.description: Various phenomenon observed on earth, both real and perceived, are linked to the moon. Explanations for these phenomenon are presented.

1051155.title: The Milky Way
1051155.description: Our home galaxy, the Milky Way, consists of more than stars and planets. The wide variety of other celestial objects that call the Milk Way home are described. And the Milky Way is not alone but has some nearby companions.

1051155.title: Alien Moons
1051155.description: The number of known moons of the outer planets have exploded in recent years. Each has it own story to tell regarding its composition, geological activity and origin.

1051155.title: Dark Matter
1051155.description: Scientists hunt for dark matter in the strangest of places. They know where it is, what it does and can sort of see it if they look in the right way. They just can't quite figure out what it is or how to get their hands on it even though it's everywhere. But it is well understood compared to dark energy which is an even bigger mystery.

1051155.title: Astrobiology
1051155.description: Scientists speculate on how life originated on earth based on the range of conditions where life survives today and the conditions that existed on the early earth. They then look for those conditions, past or present, that may exist on other planets or moons.

1051155.title: Space Travel
1051155.description: The many and various hazards to space travel are explained. But solving that problem better propulsion systems are need to travel anywhere beyond the moon. Some possibilities, both realistic and speculative, are described.

1051155.title: Supernovas
1051155.description: Although supernovas are associated with the death of stars they also seed the universe with heavy elements that comprise rocky planets like Earth and living creatures. Due to their extraordinary brightness supernovas have a recorded history dating back 2,000 years. Although closely studied for decades their infrequency has permitted only a general understanding of their behavior until very recently. New computer models can model the major details of the explosion while new exploratory techniques reveal many more events including some truly super supernovas.

1051155.title: Constellations
1051155.description: In this program the constellations serve as a backdrop for the diversity of stellar objects and for a few very special stars that serve as navigation aids for sailors, seasonal markers for farmers or distance milestones for astronomers.

1051155.title: Unexplained Mysteries
1051155.description: A few of the astronomical mysteries that bother scientists and the progress toward understanding them are described.

1051155.title: Cosmic Collisions
1051155.description: Collisions between relatively minor bodies in the solar system can have far reaching effects. Astronomers are trying to trace meteors that caused mass extinctions back to the event that cause them to cross Earth's path in case they have relatives waiting to pay a visit.

1051155.title: Colonizing Space
1051155.description: Many considerations come to the forefront when planning space travel beyond the moon. Scientists are currently working on overcoming the many challenges and testing their solutions.

1051155.title: Nebulas
1051155.description: They are the crown jewels of the galaxy. Neither stars, planets, moons or asteroids, they are the mysterious clouds of gas we call NEBULAS. Nearly invisible to the naked eye, astronomers use the most sophisticated techniques to tease images of these fascinating phenomena from the dark sky. When revealed in their full glory, they glow, reflect or obscure the galaxy's light.

1051155.title: Wildest Weather in the Cosmos
1051155.description: If a planet has an atmosphere it has weather. And where there is weather there are storms. Our solar system is chock full of them. And the bigger the temperature extreme the bigger the storm. Which makes Earth hurricanes and thunderstorms seem rather uninteresting.

1051155.title: Biggest Things in the Universe
1051155.description: Compared to the largest things in the universe galaxies are trifles compared to super clusters, voids, lyman alpha blobs, and the cosmic web. But even among the smaller objects such as stars and planets, some are mind boggling by human standards.

1051155.title: Gravity
1051155.description: Program presents scientists current understanding of gravity and some of the phenomenon it causes.

1051155.title: Cosmic Apocalypse
1051155.description: Program examines the possible ways the universe could come to an end. The most likely scenario, eternal expansion, is expected to be rather eventful in the long term.

10602236.title: The Nile
10602236.description: The Nile is the world's longest river. From elephants and leopards to extreme kayakers and ancient wonders, its great length provides a lifeline for Africa's wildest beasts and for some of the world's most incredible cultures.

10602236.title: The Amazon
10602236.description: The Amazon amasses one-fifth of Earth's freshwater as it flows east from the Andes to the Atlantic. Boiling streams, crystal clear lagoons, pink river dolphins and a strange new reef are some of its many secret and extreme worlds.

10602236.title: The Mississippi
10602236.description: From the frozen north--where coyotes learn to fish in icy water--down through the nation's agricultural heart and to the mysterious, steamy southern swamps where alligators still rule, the many faces of the Mississippi unite a nation.

10691858.title: Inner Worlds
10691858.description: The rocky planets Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars all have similar origins, but only one supports life. Was it always this way?

10691858.title: Mars
10691858.description: The dry, red planet Mars was once a blue water world studded with active volcanoes. But if it once had many of the ingredients necessary to form life, how far along might that process have gotten?

10691858.title: Jupiter
10691858.description: Jupiter's gravitational force made it a wrecking ball as it barreled through the early solar system, but it also helped shape life on Earth as it brought comets laden with water and possibly the asteroid that put an end to the dinosaurs.

10691858.title: Saturn
10691858.description: NASA's Cassini probe explores Saturn's icy rings and moons, capturing ring-moon interactions and revealing ingredients for life on the moon Enceladus.

10691858.title: Ice Worlds
10691858.description: Uranus and Neptune's unexpected rings, supersonic winds and dozens of moons; an up-close view of Pluto before exploring the Kuiper belt.

10738752.title: Breaking Ground
10738752.description: In an era of exclusion and U.S. empire, new immigrants arrive from China, India, Japan, the Philippines and beyond. Barred by anti-Asian laws they become America’s first 'undocumented immigrants', yet they build railroads, dazzle on the silver screen, and take their fight for equality to the U.S. Supreme Court.

10738752.title: A Question of Loyalty
10738752.description: An American-born generation straddles their country of birth and their parents’ homelands in Japan and Korea. Those loyalties are tested during World War II, when families are imprisoned in detention camps, and brothers find themselves on opposite sides of the battle lines.

10738752.title: Good Americans
10738752.description: During the Cold War years, Asian Americans are simultaneously heralded as a Model Minority, and targeted as the perpetual foreigner. It is also a time of bold ambition, as Asian Americans aspire for the first time to national political office and a coming culture-quake simmers beneath the surface.

10738752.title: Generation Rising
10738752.description: During a time of war and social tumult, a young generation fights for equality in the fields, on campuses and in the culture, and claim a new identity: Asian Americans. The war’s aftermath brings new immigrants and refugees who expand the population and the definition of Asian America.

10738752.title: Breaking Through
10738752.description: At the turn of the new millennium, the national conversation turns to immigration, race, and economic disparity.  As the U.S becomes more diverse, yet more divided, a new generation of Asian Americans tackle the question, how do we as a nation move forward together?

1103987.title: The Nigerian Job
1103987.description: When Nathan Ford, a former insurance company investigator, is approached by a man asking him to help retrieve some stolen property, he is dubious. When he finds out that the job requires him to supervise and maintain control of three known thieves that he himself caught in the course of his insurance investigations, he's more than dubious. However, the job offers him the opportunity to get some of his own back from the insurance company that allowed his son to die, so he takes it despite his misgivings. When his doubts prove to be well-founded, he persuades his ...

1103987.title: The Homecoming Job
1103987.description: Corporal Robert Perry, an Army reservist who fought in Iraq, was severely injured in an apparent error by Castleman Security, government contractors working in Iraq. The Army investigation clears Castleman of involvement, thus freeing them of any monetary obligation, and Perry lives too far from veteran's resources to allow him to receive government funded treatment that would allow him to work. He contacts Nathan Ford for help. What Nathan Ford and the rest of the Leverage team find is far more than a simple error.

1103987.title: The Two-Horse Job
1103987.description: After a Wall Street broker sets fire to his stable-killing his underachieving racehorses in the process-the team visits Kentucky to help the heartsick trainer, Eliot's high school love.

1103987.title: The Miracle Job
1103987.description: The team helps an old friend of Nate's, now a priest, save his church from the hands of a shady developer.

1103987.title: The Bank Shot Job
1103987.description: While Nate and Sophie try to con a corrupt Judge, they are taken hostage during a botched bank robbery.

1103987.title: The Stork Job
1103987.description: A job where the team tries to recover a war orphan for a grieved couple hits close to home for Parker.

1103987.title: The Wedding Job
1103987.description: A job for the wife of a wrongly-jailed restaurateur lands the team between the FBI and rival mob families.

1103987.title: The Mile High Job
1103987.description: The team traces incriminating evidence about a corporation's misdeeds to two witnesses on a plane to the Cayman Islands, not knowing what the corporation has planned for the flight.

1103987.title: The Snow Job
1103987.description: Nate complicates a simple con regarding a sleazy contractor and the recovery of a family's house.

1103987.title: The 12-Step Job
1103987.description: When the team cons an addicted embezzler into entering rehab, Nate confronts some of his own issues regarding alcoholism.

1103987.title: The Juror #6 Job
1103987.description: When one of Parker's aliases receives jury duty, Nate forces her to go, resulting in a showdown between the team and a corporation tampering with the jury.

1103987.title: The First David Job
1103987.description: The team goes after the CEO of Nate's former insurance company, responsible for denying his late son's medical care, but the situation causes conflict among the crew.

1103987.title: The Second David Job
1103987.description: In order to take down his former boss, Nate must reunite the splintered team to help him.

1103987.title: The Beantown Bailout Job
1103987.description: Now sober, Nathan Ford reunites Sophie, Hardison, Parker, and Eliot to help him con members of an Irish mob.

1103987.title: The Tap-Out Job
1103987.description: When a scheme against a crooked fight promoter goes awry, Eliot is forced to step into the ring.

1103987.title: The Order 23 Job
1103987.description: To swindle a felon, the team must use a hospital and stage a virus outbreak.

1103987.title: The Fairy Godparents Job
1103987.description: To recover funds from an incarcerated investment banker, the team tries to help his introverted stepson.

1103987.title: The Three Days of the Hunter Job
1103987.description: The team cons a sleazy tabloid newscaster with the story of a government cover-up.

1103987.title: The Top Hat Job
1103987.description: The team employs very unusual methods to infiltrate a corporation that has been selling tainted food to the public.

1103987.title: The Two Live Crew Job
1103987.description: The team must recover priceless artwork from a band of thieves.

1103987.title: The Ice Man Job
1103987.description: With Sophie gone, Parker and Hardison must assume new roles to recover a cache of stolen diamonds and help an innocent man accused of the crime.

1103987.title: The Lost Heir Job
1103987.description: Nathan leads a con against a corrupt lawyer trying to swindle a client's estate.

1103987.title: The Runway Job
1103987.description: To bring down an oppressive sweatshop owner, Nate and the team crash a fashion show.

1103987.title: The Bottle Job
1103987.description: To save the bar in Nathan's building from being lost to an avaricious loan shark, the team tries an old-school con.

1103987.title: The Zanzibar Marketplace Job
1103987.description: When Nate's ex-wife, Maggie, is thrown into a Ukranian jail for a crime she didn't commit, Nate and the team are forced to partner with an old nemesis to get her out.

1103987.title: The Future Job
1103987.description: The team must shut down the scams of a phony psychic.

1103987.title: The Three Strikes Job
1103987.description: The team uses a crooked politician's love of baseball to take him down but end up with more than they expect.

1103987.title: The Maltese Falcon Job
1103987.description: The team is trying to take down a corrupt local mayor, even with the stakes rising to dangerous levels.

1103987.title: The Jailhouse Job
1103987.description: As the team works to free Nate from jail, he must take on a corrupt warden and free an innocent man.

1103987.title: The Reunion Job
1103987.description: To uncover a password, the team infiltrates the high school reunion of an amoral software magnate who's the IT department for the Axis of Evil.

1103987.title: The Inside Job
1103987.description: When Parker is trapped in an unknown location while working a theft for her mentor, the LEVERAGE team must race the clock to find her and free her.

1103987.title: The Scheherazade Job
1103987.description: To rob an African kleptocrat's Boston vault, the LEVERAGE team has to time their heist to a symphony concert nearby, where amateur violinist Hardison must play a solo for a sell-out crowd.

1103987.title: The Double Blind Job
1103987.description: Nate and the team runs a con against a corrupt CEO of a pharmaceuticals company who is marketing a product which could kill thousands.

1103987.title: The Studio Job
1103987.description: When Eliot poses as a country music singer to help run a con against a corrupt recording studio executive, things get complicated when he becomes a bona fide star.

1103987.title: The Gone Fishin' Job
1103987.description: The team takes on a debt collector scamming innocent taxpayers, not knowing he is backed by a private militia.

1103987.title: The Boost Job
1103987.description: Nate and the team infiltrate a crew of top-flight car thieves to bring down a greedy car dealer.

1103987.title: The Three-Card Monte Job
1103987.description: An old enemy complicates matters for Nate and his crew as they try to help several small-time business people who were conned into committing crimes.

1103987.title: The Underground Job
1103987.description: Nate and the team investigate a fatal explosion in a coal mine and uncover far more than the negligent practices they suspected.

1103987.title: The Rashomon Job
1103987.description: Each member of the team recalls the story of an artifact all of them tried to steal on the same night five years ago.

1103987.title: The King George Job
1103987.description: Pieces of Sophie's past complicate a job in London where the team tries to expose an unscrupulous antiques trafficker who is using children as slave labor.

1103987.title: The Morning After Job
1103987.description: A con against a dirty financier could be the key to the team finding Damien Moreau.

1103987.title: The Ho Ho Ho Job
1103987.description: The team runs into trouble while recovering Christmas gifts for a charity when an old enemy returns.

1103987.title: The Big Bang Job
1103987.description: The team infiltrates a Department of Defense research lab in order to stop Damien Moreau, the villain they have been working to catch all season, from murdering a brilliant engineer and auctioning her work off to international terrorists.

1103987.title: The San Lorenzo Job
1103987.description: The team follows Moreau to San Lorenzo only to find that Moreau is the chief advisor to the current President. In order to take Moreau down, the team must first take over the country.

1103987.title: The Long Way Down Job
1103987.description: The team must battle a treacherous mountain, dangerous conditions, and hired mercenaries to retrieve evidence to bring down a corrupt financial executive.

1103987.title: The 10 Li'l Grifters Job
1103987.description: When a mark is killed in the middle of a con and Nate is accused of the crime, the crew must find the real killer to prove Nate's innocence.

1103987.title: The 15 Minutes Job
1103987.description: The team uses a PR executive's own notoriety against him to bring him down.

1103987.title: The Van Gogh Job
1103987.description: Nate and the crew discover the history behind a Van Gogh painting from World War II they are attempting to recover.

1103987.title: The Hot Potato Job
1103987.description: The Leverage team tries to recover a rare agricultural object worth millions of dollars.

1103987.title: The Carnival Job
1103987.description: An innovative computer chip the team steals from an executive's home becomes the ransom when the executive's daughter is kidnapped.

1103987.title: The Grave Danger Job
1103987.description: The team goes after a funeral home director who is scamming bereaved families out of their money but quickly discover the scam involves a Mexican drug cartel.

1103987.title: The Boiler Room Job
1103987.description: Nate and the team take on one of their toughest assignments: a con man from a family with a long history of pulling off successful scams.

1103987.title: The Cross My Heart Job
1103987.description: While stuck at an airport, the team must retrieve a heart donated to a fifteen-year-old patient when it is intercepted by a sick defense contractor.

1103987.title: The Queen's Gambit Job
1103987.description: Sterling asks Nate to steal a nuclear reactor component which someone intends to use to produce uranium which will then be sold to terrorists. Nate thinks Sterling is holding something back but he decides to do it. They figure out that the man selling it will hand it off while his step-daughter is competing in a chess tournament in Dubai. They try to proceed as planned but Sterling shows complicating things.

1103987.title: The Experimental Job
1103987.description: When the team investigates the disappearance of homeless vets around Boston, they stumble across a sinister plot.

1103987.title: The Office Job
1103987.description: While Nate and the team try to uncover an embezzler by infiltrating an office, they get roped into participating in a documentary of the company.

1103987.title: The Girls' Night Out Job
1103987.description: A con to take down a cunning thief who is part of a larger conspiracy is told from the point-of-view of Sophie, Parker, and Tara Cole.

1103987.title: The Boys' Night Out Job
1103987.description: A con to take down a cunning thief who is part of a larger conspiracy is told from the point-of-view of Nate, Eliot, and Hardison.

1103987.title: The Lonely Hearts Job
1103987.description: While searching for a philanthropist's missing wife, the team comes up against a grifter ring running a web of sophisticated "Sweetheart Scams". Now, Nate must learn how to steal hearts... or risk losing Sophie's for good.

1103987.title: The Gold Job
1103987.description: The Leverage team hits the recession-driven Cash-for-Gold industry by targeting a corrupt brother-sister team and steering them through an elaborate treasure hunt.

1103987.title: The Radio Job
1103987.description: When Latimer hires Nate's father to pull off a heist in an ultra-secure government office, the Leverage team must stage a fake hostage stand-off when they're trapped inside and the feds lay siege to the building.

1103987.title: The Last Dam Job
1103987.description: The Leverage team must recruit old friends and rivals in order to take down Latimer and a foe from their past.

1103987.title: The (Very) Big Bird Job
1103987.description: Nate and the team go after the CEO of a shipping company whose cost-cutting measures were the cause of a tragic plane crash.

1103987.title: The Blue Line Job
1103987.description: The Leverage crew helps a veteran hockey player who thinks team management is trying to get him injured on purpose but discover their real intentions are far more ominous.

1103987.title: The First Contact Job
1103987.description: To take down a wealthy scientist who stole a colleague's work, Nate and the crew convinces him he's made contact with aliens.

1103987.title: The French Connection Job
1103987.description: Eliot goes undercover at a culinary arts school to take down an avaricious restaurateur.

1103987.title: The Gimme a K Street Job
1103987.description: To help students whose cheerleading school is putting them in danger, the team takes on its most corrupt adversary: Congress.

1103987.title: The D.B. Cooper Job
1103987.description: A flashback to the 1970s of an FBI agent's final regret, his failure to capture hijacker D.B. Cooper, becomes a mystery Nate must solve.

1103987.title: The Real Fake Car Job
1103987.description: Nate and the crew concoct a story about a vintage car to get a corrupt Wall Street businessman to break his immunity agreement with the government.

1103987.title: The Broken Wing Job
1103987.description: When a torn ACL leaves Parker behind on the crew's latest job, she spies on the Brew Pub's customers for fun and discovers a group of thieves planning a heist.

1103987.title: The Rundown Job
1103987.description: Eliot and the team assist his old partner, counter-terrorism specialist Colonel Michael Vance, in stopping a biological weapon from being released in Washington, D.C.

1103987.title: The Frame-Up Job
1103987.description: Nate must clear Sophie's name when she is framed for the theft of a priceless work of art.

1103987.title: The Low Low Price Job
1103987.description: The crew takes on a big-box retail chain who is bribing the city to run local mom-and-pop stores out of business.

1103987.title: The White Rabbit Job
1103987.description: The team attempts one of the most difficult cons ever devised to stop a businessman from bankrupting his business and the town that depends on it.

1103987.title: The Corkscrew Job
1103987.description: Nate and the crew take on the greedy owner of a winery.

1103987.title: The Toy Job
1103987.description: The team goes after a CEO who is selling dangerous toys to the public.

1103987.title: The Long Good-bye Job
1103987.description: Nate takes the team on one of its most dangerous missions, a con related to the death of his son.

1119644.title: Pilot
1119644.description: After a plane from Hamburg returns with no survivors, FBI agent Olivia Dunham goes after the only person that might shed some light on the incident - a scientist that has been in a mental hospital for the last 17 years.

1119644.title: The Same Old Story
1119644.description: A woman gives birth to a baby which ages 80 years in just a few minutes and Olivia soon finds connection between the incident and a serial killer she had been chasing.

1119644.title: The Ghost Network
1119644.description: Following a strange apparent terrorist attack on a bus, Olivia, Peter and Walter find a man who foresees future disasters before they happen.

1119644.title: The Arrival
1119644.description: A strange cylinder which is somehow connected to Walter and a man known as "the Observer" appears from the ground at a construction site.

1119644.title: Power Hungry
1119644.description: An elevator crashes, killing a number of people, leading Olivia and the Bishops to a man who appears to unknowingly be able to manipulate electricity.

1119644.title: The Cure
1119644.description: A number of people in a diner die of radiation exposure and Olivia and the Bishops believe a woman who disappeared two weeks earlier was the source.

1119644.title: In Which We Meet Mr. Jones
1119644.description: An FBI agent experiencing huge pain is brought to a hospital where it is discovered that there is a strange parasite wrapped around his heart.

1119644.title: The Equation
1119644.description: A young musical genius is kidnapped and Walter recalls a patient at St Clair's who might have been kidnapped by the same people and forced to try and figure out the solution to an equation.

1119644.title: The Dreamscape
1119644.description: The Fringe division investigate the questionable fall of a Massive Dynamic executive analyst. John helps Olivia crack the case. Peter meets up with an old girlfriend.

1119644.title: Safe
1119644.description: After a series of mysterious bank robberies, a suspect is found embedded into a wall, causing Walter to realize that they have not only found a way to literally walk through walls, but are looking for something he's made in the past.

1119644.title: Bound
1119644.description: Olivia has been abducted, and Broyles and the Fringe division must investigate her disappearance - while also undergoing an audit by an agent from Olivia's past who bears a major grudge against her.

1119644.title: The No-Brainer
1119644.description: Two men's brains are liquefied and their only apparent connection is that they both downloaded a huge file before dying.

1119644.title: The Transformation
1119644.description: A man undergoes a painful and ultimately fatal transformation aboard a plane. Meanwhile, Nina Sharp and Broyles reveal more information about John Scott to Olivia.

1119644.title: Ability
1119644.description: The team investigates a number of people who died faceless after their orifices are sealed while German agents investigating David Robert Jones' escape question Olivia.

1119644.title: Inner Child
1119644.description: A mysterious child is recovered from a secret chamber that has been sealed for more than a half-century.

1119644.title: Unleashed
1119644.description: A group of animal rights activists are killed in action when trying to flee from a lab animal which doesn't exist in nature.

1119644.title: Bad Dreams
1119644.description: FBI agent Dunham believes that she is killing random people in her dreams.

1119644.title: Midnight
1119644.description: Walter examines a number of dead bodies that had the spinal fluid removed. Olivia and Charlie go after the scientist who created the person behind the murders.

1119644.title: The Road Not Taken
1119644.description: The Fringe team investigate a case of spontaneous human combustion. Olivia starts experiencing visions of the alternate Universe. She uses this ability to solve the case.

1119644.title: There's More Than One of Everything
1119644.description: David Robert Jones comes out of hiding following an attempt on Nina Sharp's life while Walter leaves accompanied by the mysterious Observer.

1119644.title: A New Day in the Old Town
1119644.description: Olivia is in a car accident, an unusual person is looking for a member of the team, and Walter makes plans for celebrating Peter's birthday.

1119644.title: Night of Desirable Objects
1119644.description: Olivia and Peter investigate a series of strange disappearances. Olivia hears and sees things from the alternate Universe but fails to realize Charlie isn't really Charlie.

1119644.title: Fracture
1119644.description: The Fringe division investigates the explosion of a police officer. Olivia starts having visions about her experience on the other side.

1119644.title: Momentum Deferred
1119644.description: Walter analyzes the body of a shapeshifter and then reconnects with an old patient that has the ability to distinguish the people from the other world. Olivia finally recalls her encounter with Belly.

1119644.title: Dream Logic
1119644.description: People who once had sleeping problems but were cured by having a biochip inserted in their brain suddenly start to die. Walter suspects the chips were accessed by someone who used mind control.

1119644.title: Earthling
1119644.description: Strange deaths by a mysterious shadow leads the Fringe Team to the scene where they learn that a Russian astronaut was possessed by an alien and his brother is convincing Dr. Bishop to solve the equation to free him.

1119644.title: Of Human Action
1119644.description: The Fringe team investigate a child that is supposed to have mind control abilities. Peter is kidnapped and controlled by him. Walter is extremely worried and afraid he might lose Peter again.

1119644.title: August
1119644.description: Peter and Olivia look into the latest appearance of an observer, other than September, that kidnaps a young woman. August prevents her from getting on a plane that would crash.

1119644.title: Snakehead
1119644.description: Walter examines some bodies that have been infected with unusual worms. Olivia and Peter run an investigation after speaking with a survivor. Meanwhile Walter demands more independence from Peter.

1119644.title: Grey Matters
1119644.description: Olivia and Peter look into some patients of mental institutions that regain their mental state after having gone through a brain intervention performed by a shape-shifter named Newton. This is directly related to Walter and his brain.

1119644.title: Unearthed
1119644.description: A teenager comes back from the dead possessed by a military soldier who's gone missing. Walter does an experiment so that the Fringe team can find the soldier's murderer.

1119644.title: Johari Window
1119644.description: When the sheriff of a small town nearby Edina City gives a ride to a boy that is fleeing home, he finds at the police station that the boy has changed to a deformed child. Out of the blue, a group of deformed man slaughter the sheriff and two marshals and bring the boy with them. The Fringe Division is assigned to investigate the case and they head to Edina, here they are received by the local sheriff. They overhear a humming and the sheriff explains that it comes from a military base. Soon Olivia and Peter are attacked by a local in a truck but Peter succeeds to kill...

1119644.title: What Lies Below
1119644.description: After a man spreads a pathogen on the grounds of a company, the Fringe team start an investigation. While stuck inside the quarantine zone, Peter and Olivia try to identify the origin of the pathogen. Outside, Walter tries to find a cure.

1119644.title: The Bishop Revival
1119644.description: A man uses a toxin to target specific groups of people. Walter finds out that the toxin was created by his father in Berlin, long before DNA was even discovered.

1119644.title: Jacksonville
1119644.description: An earthquake from the other side is being felt on our Universe as well. Furthermore, the only survivor seems to be from the alternate Universe. Walter attempts to get Olivia "recover" her ability to make out things from the other side.

1119644.title: Peter
1119644.description: Walter flashes back to 1985 while explaining Peter's otherworldly origins to Olivia. Also, Peter's mother is introduced, and details of the neighboring world reaffirms that there is more than one of everything.

1119644.title: Olivia. In the Lab. With the Revolver
1119644.description: The Fringe team investigate a series of mysterious deaths caused by cancer that seems to have been transmitted by touch. Olivia realizes the perpetrator is after the kids who were part of the Coretexiphan trials.

1119644.title: White Tulip
1119644.description: The Fringe team investigate a train full of people who died in a mysterious way. Olivia and the others then meet the astrophysicist who was responsible for the "experiment" and who can reset the time.

1119644.title: The Man from the Other Side
1119644.description: The body of a female teenager is found along with shapeshifter marks. Walter examines the embryo of a shapeshifter, that came from the alternate Universe. The team try to anticipate the shapeshifters' next moves.

1119644.title: Brown Betty
1119644.description: Walter has just smoked a drug that he calls "Brown Betty" when Olivia arrives at the laboratory to leave Ella with Astrid. The girl asks Walter to tell a story and he creates a detective story where the Fringe Division are the characters.

1119644.title: Northwest Passage
1119644.description: Peters stumbles across Newton and his people while running away from Walter and the FBI. He teams up with the local sheriff to try and find Newton.

1119644.title: Over There: Part 1
1119644.description: Olivia and William Bell rescue Walter from the hospital. Then Olivia meets her double, who is a dangerous woman, trying to find Peter; however they fight but Olivia subdues her. Olivia poses as her double to lure Charlie and convinces Peter to return. Meanwhile Walter and William bring a piece of equipment from Walter's laboratory in Harvard to the theater to let them return to their universe. However, the FBI and the Fringe Division also arrive and there is a shootout. Will Olivia, Walter, Peter and William Bell return to their universe?

1119644.title: Over There: Part 2
1119644.description: Olivia and William Bell rescue Walter from the hospital. Then Olivia meets her double, who is a dangerous woman, trying to find Peter; however they fight but Olivia subdues her. Olivia poses of her double to lure Charlie and convinces Peter to return. Meanwhile Walter and William bring a piece of equipment from Walter's laboratory in Harvard to the theater to let them return to their universe. However, the FBI and the Fringe Division also arrive and there is a shootout. Will Olivia, Walter, Peter and William Bell return to their universe?

1119644.title: Olivia
1119644.description: After the extraordinary turn of events that shockingly left an imprisoned Olivia "over there," she fights to find her way home. Meanwhile, Peter and Walter try to move on with their lives unknowingly alongside alternate Olivia.

1119644.title: The Box
1119644.description: Three men abduct and keep a family tied up and gagged in the living room. Two of them dig the basement while the third one watches the family.
